Help Rupert infiltrate "Music Box Records" and collect all of his stolen notes which are scattered throughout the complex. Ride the crazy elevators and beware of the security robots on patrol. Rupert can move laterally and jump. Elevators move the player between platforms. The player must enter all 16 rooms at the music studio. Within each room lies a stolen note which the player must gather. The player must avoid dangers and falls from height, and they start with 9 lives.
title: Rupert Rythym: The Music Box Caper

description:
Neutroid II is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

"For centuries, man has strived for the ultimate power source. As fossil fuels become scarce, the need for a new, inexhaustible source of energy grows more and more. In a dimly lit laboratory, a professor is experimenting on a newly discovered sub-atomic particle. This particle has been named, Neutroid and is causing great controversy in 'The Neutroid Project'.

The player controls the Neutroid on a large grid within the Particle Vault. The player must avoid Antitroids which move on the grid and are attracted to the Neutroid. Protroid particles and special maintenance units called Grid Charges are adjacent. The player tries to collide the Neutroid with the stream of Protroids, removing the Protroids from the stream. If the player collides with a wall or an Antitroid, it begins to heat up, and after too many collisions the system will overheat. If all Protroids are removed from the system, the player advances to a more difficult level.

Science is counting on you professor! Complete each grid quickly before the particle vaults reach the meltdown state, else all is lost!"
title: Neutroid II

description:
Butterfly Patrol is a side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a butterfly on the bottom of the screen that moves laterally. The player must move to the side while avoiding dangers dropped from above. They must jump over rocks and holes. Three lives in total.
title: Butterfly Patrol

description:
Decathlon is a 1 - 4 player arcade sports game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes as Canada, United Kingdom, or United States in the 10 sports of the decathlon. These include: 100 meter dash, running long jump, shot put, high jump, 400-meter run, 110 meter hurdle, discus throw, pole vault, javelin throw, and 1500 meter run. Games involve rapidly pressing the -enter- button to gather speed, and then throw or jump their character. The player requires a minimal score to qualify for the next event.
title: Decathlon

description:
Cubix is a 1-player Q*Bert clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves Cubix, as he tries to change all the colors on a pyramid by jumping on the squares. The player must avoid dangers including a snake which chases the player. The player starts with 5 lives, and loses one if they are caught by a monster or move off the pyramid. Small transporters off the side of the pyramid will bring the player back to the top of the pyramid. There are 15 levels of difficulty.
title: Cubix

description:
Devious is a clone of the game Xevious for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship which moves in all directions, and fires a short distance forwards. Player from a top-down perspective, the player must avoid or destroy enemy vessels, while destroy enemy factories and artillery.
title: Devious

description:
Ghost Gobbler is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates a gobbler through the maze using their joystick. The goal is to try to eat all the food dots while avoiding the ghosts. An energizer dot in each of the 4 corners temporarily makes the ghosts vulnerable. After eating all dots, the player moves to the next challenge. The player starts with 3 lives. There are 16 skill levels.
title: Ghost Gobbler

description:
Lancer is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo..

The player controls a knight with lance atop a large bird. Gameplay allows for 1-player or 2-player cooperative. The player can move rapidly left and right, but can also flap their bird's wings to raise up in the air. Enemy mounted knights appear, and the player must destroy them by hitting them from above or behind, otherwise they lose a life. When hit, knights turn into eggs, which land on the platforms. These must be picked up before they hatch into a new knight, which they be picked up by a mount to ride again. There are 15 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 5 lives. As stages increase, new challenges like disappearing platforms or invincible dragons appear.
title: Lancer

description:
Le Mans is a 1 - 2 player arcade racing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player races around a fixed screen track trying to complete 20 laps in as little time as possible. There are 15 levels of difficulty, which control the slide the vehicle experiences around corners. Gas cans randomly appear on the track for a short period, which can be picked up for an additional lap on the counter. Random cars and obstacles appear in the track. In competitive play, players can collide with each other. Hitting obstacles or the walls slows the player down. There are 3 tracks to choose from.
title: Le Mans

description:
Maze Escape is a 1-player 1st person maze game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must navigate a dungeon of varying levels based upon difficulty. The player must find the ladder to the next levels of the dungeon to escape. Each level has 2 ghosts, which can be shot by quickly directing the gun at the bottom of the screen.
title: Maze Escape

description:
Miss Gobbler is a 1 - 2 player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates Miss Gobbler through a maze trying to eat all the food dots while avoiding the ghosts. An energizer dot in each of the 4 corners temporarily makes the ghosts vulnerable. After eating all dots, the player moves to the next challenge. Subsequent levels have different maze design. The player starts with 3 lives. There are 16 skill levels.
title: Miss Gobbler

description:
The Naugus is a 1-player fantasy-themed arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You play as Byron Axehead, renowned soldier in the King's army. After slaying a kinsman of the King in self defense during a barroom brawl, you have been tasked with recovering a stolen magical scepter from the haunted forest ruled over by the dragon Naugus.

The forest is populated by dangerous Zombies and Lyx. The player moves about a large 8 x 8 grid searching for items. Magical doors allow transport between different forests, but the player must first find keys to unlock them. The player can find rope, and use it to climb trees. Bryon starts without arms or armor, and must also locate a sword and bow. Some areas have water requiring a boat. The player has limited strength, and takes damage by close encounters with monsters. The player travels between areas while avoiding or slaying monsters.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Friendly Gnome Nurses me to Health

title: The Naugus

description:
Pick Which is a 1 - 4 player arcade tile game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Sixteen tiles are hidden on the screen, which can only be revealed one at a time. The player uses their joystick to quickly move between tiles, and after a brief period, whichever tile the player is sitting on is selected. This period becomes shorter until the game ends. The screen then zooms this tile to the background, and a new tile must be selected. Ice Cream Cones, Kiss, Sun, Key, Golden Chalice, and Pot of Gold all increase the players' score. Other tiles can supply a map of the available tiles, cause the player to lose points, increase the score by 1/4, or cut the score in half. Finally, a Stop Sign tile will end the game.
title: Pick Which

description:
Piggy is a 1 - 4 player racing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Four little pigs race along a track, trying to be the first to reach the treats on the right of the screen. At the beginning of each turn, the player rolls 2 dice. That value represents the number the player can't roll without penalty. The player then repeatedly rolls 2 dice, and moves that value along the board. Every roll, the player can choose to roll again or stay. If the player hits the penalty value, they are sent back to where they started the round. Once the player stays, they will restart in that position on future rounds.
title: Piggy

description:
Qiks is a 1 - 2 player clone of Qix for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player guides a marker which must draw rectangles and other shapes in order to claim territory. Lines must be connected to previously present edges, and the player can't travel within claimed territory except along lines. Once a shape has been made, it will be colored in to show that this territory is claimed. While drawing the rectangles, the player needs to avoid the Qiks, a series of colored lines that crawl the screen, and the Sparks that travel around the border and any lines the player has made. The Fuse travels along new lines, preventing the player from moving too slowly. The player has limited time per stage. Once the player has claimed enough territory, they proceed to the next level.
title: Qiks

description:
Roller Controller is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must guide rolling marbles from the top left of the screen into the proper bins at the bottom of the screen. The solid colored marbles with a "T" in their center must fall into the bin which is the same color as the ball. A "ringer" ball will also appear, which is a combination of the three colors of the other balls. The ringer balls must fall through one of the two funnels at the lower right and left side of the screen.

The balls are guided to the appropriate bin by opening and closing the trap doors at just the right time. At the extreme bottom left and right of the screen are two fans, that will blow balls back up to the top of the screen, and start over. Each time this happens, the velocity of the ball will slightly increase.

In the top right of the screen are happy and sad faces, which represent how many balls must be correctly or incorrectly guided into bins before the game is over. There are 3 skill levels.
title: Roller Controller

description:
Tanjali is a 1-player memory game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is briefly shown a 3 x 3 grid of different shapes consisting of squares, circles and triangles. Each shape can be either pink, purple, or green. This grid is then erased, and a new set of shapes are filled into the spaces. The player must decide if each shape is the same as in the original diagram or different. There are 3 levels of difficulty, and the player can choose the time allowed to view the picture.
title: Tanjali

description:
The Crystal City is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a fast-moving jet that can maneuver in all directions, and fires directly forwards. The player fights alien planes, helicopters, rockets, turrets, and other dangers. The player has limited shields, and must pick up parachuting energy before it is hit by friendly or enemy fire. Striking the ground is an immediate game over. There are 6 levels in total, and each level has a boss fight at the end.
title: The Crystal City

description:
Kung-Fu Dude is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Born to the royal house of Kilachi, as a child it was prophesized that you would initiate the destruction of the dark temple which ruled the land of your birth. You were hidden away in a monastery in the Orient, far away from your native homeland, and trained for 19 years in the ancient secrets of martial arts. With mere months left in your training, you have learned that Princess Trinsim, your prearranged bride, had been kidnapped by the temple.

You have now travelled to New York City, the new location of the dark temple, in your quest to rescue the princess and defeat the dark temple.

The player controls a martial artist who must defeat a number of enemies. The player can only face to the left, and must move to the right defeating enemies as they appear. They can jump, duck, punch, and kick low, medium, high, or back kick. There is limited time for each level, and all enemies must be destroyed to advance to the next stage.
title: Kung-Fu Dude

description:
Kyum Gai: To Be Ninja is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Something is killing off the members of the legendary order of Kyum-Gai. In desperation, its leaders have called upon the powers of the life stone to resurrect you, their greatest hero: the ninja Gai-Dan. Now, you must find and destroy the evil forces behind this dark plot.

The player controls a ninja who can jump, walk, and throw kicks and punches. The player travels through a number of stages trying to avoid or defeat other martial artists. The player starts with 5 lives, and can only take 3 direct hits before losing a life.
title: Kyum-Gai: To Be Ninja

description:
Paladin's Legacy is a fantasy-themed RPG for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two hundred years ago, the land of Tarnith was divided into three nations: the forest-dwelling Elves, the mountain-loving dwarves, and and the Humans who sought the grasslands. To this land began the appearance of a number of horrible twisted creatures which decimated the lands of the three races.

Suddenly, a stranger arrived. His knowledge of magical arts and swordsmanship seemed unlimited. With these tools, he was able to put the evil creatures to slaughter, and spent his remaining days teaching the arts to the three races.

In time this stranger passed, and he was remembered as the Paladin. Over time, the three races began to draw apart once more. The creatures have once again begun to appear, and the King of the land has been kidnapped by the forces of darkness. The player must rescue the lost monarch and reunite the land of Tarnith.

At the beginning of each game, the player creates a new character, spreading 60 attribute points between strength, dexterity, intelligence, and wisdom. The player moves about from a top-down perspective, and can enter various castles and towns from the overland map. The player can talk to the various inhabitants of Tarnith for clues to solve puzzles. Food, armor, weapons, and healing potions can be purchased from various stores. Every 1000 experience points, the player can visit the Queen of Tarnith to level up, which increases maximum hitpoints.

In combat, the player and monster takes turns exchanging blows until one is destroyed.
title: Paladin's Legacy

description:
Photon is a 1-player action strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The world has a clear social system specifying two distinct classes: the workers and the scientists. It worked well, and the people were happy (at least, the people who's opinions counted). Suddenly, a mysterious electronic intelligence appeared and began to drain the world's energy. The robot, named Ludevide, declared his intentions to continue to do so for the foreseeable future, and challenged anyone to try and stop him.

The scientists constructed the PT (Power Tank) series, a weapon intended to house a worker as attempted to force his way through the myriad layers of Ludevide's stronghold. The fortress is populated by beasts made of plasma and mindless DUPES (Dense Units of Photon Energy). Each of these is deadly to the PT, and successive contact with these guardians will lead to total destruction.

You have just been volunteered to pilot the newest model PT. The PT can be moved in the cardinal directions, and is able to push or pull pieces of Ludevide's castle. The goal on each level is to reach the exit point while avoiding enemy attacks. Power is used for moving the tank or teleporting objects. The PT takes damage when contacting guardian creatures, and this will drain energy to enact repairs. If all energy is drained and the tank is completely damaged, it is game over. There are 15 levels of increasing difficulty.
title: Photon

description:
The Quest for Thelda: A Journey Into Adventure is a 1-player The Legend of Zelda clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is armed with a sword and shield, and can move in all directions. The player begins their quest in the Overworld, which features forests, mountains and lakes and is divided into several screens. The player can explore the Overworld freely, though when he enters a screen, he will encounter several enemies. The player has limited health and magic power, which is increased by completing dungeons and gathering hearts. Defeated enemies can drop hearts, coins, or bombs. The goal is to defeat all the dungeons in the game.
title: The Quest for Thelda: A Journey Into Adventure

description:
A World at War is wargame construction program and game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player can create any variety of turn-based wargame. The player can edit unit graphics, characteristics, and locations. Players can create custom maps and graphics, and well as customize the starting strength of units.
title: A World at War

description:
Warrior King is a 1-player side-scrolling fantasy-themed clone of Rastan for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In an age of savagery and magic, where kings held their power by the might of their sword arm, one man stood alone. His name was Rastann, Warrior King of Aqualone. All who knew him feared his wrath, yet respected his integrity. He held his power and authority with a firm, yet fair hand. However, within the midst of the Battle of Faerendor, his crown was stolen by a changeling spy and spirited away. The Barbarian army under his command were a superstitious lot, rooted deep in tradition and religion where law failed to hold sway. They threatened to revolt, refusing to serve a king without a crown. Most of the army left to the Northlands; few remained loyal. The simple Battle of Faerendor had turned into a fight not only for Rastann's kinghood, but his life. Rastaan was desperate and only one route remained open: to recover the crown hidden within the deeplands of Faerendor.

The player controls a warrior, as he does battle with lizardmen and skeletons. The player can move laterally, jump, duck, and swing his sword high, low, or backwards. The player has limited health, and takes damage from enemy attack. Magic vials can restore a small amount of health, and the player can pick up jewelry and special powerful weapons as they explore. The player must carefully avoid falling in water or lava, and can climb up or down ropes. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Warrior King

description:
Jubilex is a 1-player side-scrolling space shooter for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions, and fires to the right as dangers approach. The player must avoid land-based turrets and rockets, while avoiding enemy ships. Power-ups can enhance the ship's combat ability. The player's ship can take a limited number of hits before being destroyed. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Jubilex

description:
Calduril 2: Weatherstone's End is a graphical adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It was seventeen days before the lightning and hail abated and the exhausted people emerged from their shattered homes. The crops were ruined. The dimmest wit could see that if the new planting failed, famine would come to the valley. The Weatherstone has been deflected from its task of controlling the weather by Silmnohleh, Darker Lord of Fire, who is scheming to destroy the House of Orin.

Your father has just left this world, and as his heir, you must travel to Lord's Isle and beg for help to restore the Weatherstone. You set out on your vessel Lampbearer, and on the eleventh you are struck by a terrible storm which leaves your ship and crew scattered, and you alone on the shores of an unknown land.

The player moves their character about on a large scrolling map, and can enter a variety of locations. When the player moves near an item, it appears as a visible item, and the player can interact with it. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and the player gathers a variety of items.
title: Caladuril 2: Weatherstone's End

description:
Overlord is a 1 - 3 player strategy wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a large scrolling overland map, the goal is to conquer the other player's land mass. The player can choose a variety of pre-made maps, or create their own. Each map has a number of cities, which can be conquered to increase production capacity. The player sets their desired military construction, and the new unit is created every number of turns. Transports can be used to move troops across water, and the player chooses from a variety of land-based and naval units. Units are moved individually across the land surface, with each unit able to move a set distance per turn.
title: Overlord

description:
The Seventh Link is a 1-player fantasy-themed RPG for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Elira and its 3 sister planets were created by a group of interstellar colonists using the power of the quantum blackhole that powered their spaceship. Unfortunately, the creation process has led to an unstable planet, that will slowly implode into death. With the creation of their new world, the colonists began the creation of Eliran society. Eventually, the land was colonized by 4 intelligent races: Men, Elders, Giants, and Dwarves. The lands founders even crated transportation points to the 3 sister planets, and hid them deep underground.

And evil entity known as The Power seeks to undue and destroy these lands. The player must form a party and seek out how to stabilize the worlds and defeat The Power.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player explores an overland map, cities, and towns. Dungeons are explored from a 1st person perspective. During character creation, the player spreads 40 stat points between strength, intelligence, wisdom, dexterity, and constitution. The player's party starts with a single character, but can recruit further characters during their adventure. In towns, the player can speak with townspeople and shop at stores. In combat, players fight a number of enemies on a separate combat screen. Players can use short or long-ranged weapons and cast a variety of spells.
title: The Seventh Link

description:
Vegas Slots is a 1-player compilation of slot machines for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Contains:

  • 3 Line Melons & Bars Slot Machine
  • 5-Line Bar 5 Slot Machine
  • 5-Line Fruit Slot Machine
  • Fruit Multi-Bars Slot Machine
  • Lucky Dollar Slot Machine
  • Right-Left/Left-Right Slot Machine
  • Multi-Bars Slot Machine
title: Vegas Slots

description:
Vegas Game Pack is a series of gambling games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Contains graphical versions of Blackjack, Keno, Poker, and multiple slots machines.
title: Vegas Game Pak

description:
Battle Stations is a 1-player Battleship game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes turns placing their ships on a 19 x 10 grid. The enemy position is kept hidden. The player and computer take turns firing 8 shots towards the enemy positions. The first player to sink all the opponent's vessels is the winner.
title: Battle Stations

description:
Birds is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. The player tries to shoot all the birds on the screen, that intermittently try to poop on or dive the player. If the player gets hit, they lose a life. Three lives in total. There are 5 levels of difficulty.
title: Birds

description:
Buzz Worm is a 1–2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a snake within a maze, trying to eat the flashing snake bait. Every bait the player collects causes the snake to elongate. If the player does not collect bait, the snake speeds up. If the snake bites itself, the player loses a life. A level is cleared by collecting all bait, and there are 10 different levels. Sometimes, the buzz worm will drop an egg. This is worth a large bonus if eaten, and a free man if it remains on the screen after all bait has been consumed. The player starts with three lives.
title: Buzz Worm

description:
Dragon Slayer is a 1-player platforming game with puzzle elements for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small triangular character who can move laterally and climb ladders. The character is able to carry only 1 item at a time, and must use them to solve puzzles. Swords slay dogs, platforms allow crossing gaps, ropes hang from rings, keys unlock doors, raid kills spiders, flashlights allow passing dark areas, etc. The player starts with 3 lives, and loses a life if they encounter any danger without the correct item. The player gains points by collecting bags of gold. The game is divided into 10 levels, with each level having 16 rooms. The goal at the end of each level is to slay a dragon.

sample_screenshots.caption: Watch Out for Fire and Water
I Need a Rope for the Loop

title: Dragon Slayer

description:
Escape from S.P.E.C.T.R.E. is a 1-player arcade adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a secret agent for British Intelligence sent on a mission to obtain the secret nerve gas formula being developed by S.P.E.C.T.R.E. to destroy the world. The player navigates their character though a series of tunnels. Enemies agents will intermittently fire at the player, but can't fire through walls. The player can pick up items and ammunition from lockers throughout the maze. Armed with grenades, the player can pick these up and throw them. A single hit, and it's game over.
title: Escape From S.P.E.C.T.R.E.

description:
Fangman is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a vampire in a maze, who tries to bite and convert the people running about into bats. Each level starts with at least 1 friendly bat to help the player. The sun chases the player about the maze, and people drop crosses if they encounter another human, both of which are fatal to the player. The people constantly run from the player, and they can only be captured if led to a dead-end or trapped between the vampire and a bat. Each human captured becomes a bat, which further helps the player. Once per level, the player gains the ability to destroy 3 cross. The player starts with 3 lives, and gain an extra life each level. Each level presents a new Halloween pun.
title: Fangman

description:
Flight 16 is a flight simulator for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a commercial aircraft through takeoff and landing. Instrument panels help with airplane navigation.
title: Flight 16

description:
The Frog is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Try to maneuver your frog across a busy road and a congested stream into one of the slots at the top of the screen. The frog moves in the cardinal directions, and if it's hit by a car or falls in the water, the player loses a life. The player has 99 time units per turn.
title: The Frog

description:
Gold Finder is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move laterally, climb ladders, and dig small holes in the ground to trap enemies. The character must collect gold from a series of platforms, and take them to the top-most ladder to advance to the next level. Enemy characters relentlessly pursue the player, and take their life if they catch them. Enemies can only exit and enter ladders from the top or the bottom, while a player can exit or enter a ladder at any point. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Gold Finder

description:
Gold Runner is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move laterally, climb ladders, and dig small holes in the ground to trap enemies. The character must collect gold from a series of platforms, and take them to the top-most ladder to advance to the next level. Enemy characters relentlessly pursue the player, and take their life if they catch them. Enemies will also pick up gold, and the player must retrieve it by dropping the enemy into a hole. Enemies can only exit and enter ladders from the top or the bottom, while a player can exit or enter a ladder at any point. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Gold Runner

description:
Journey to Mt. Doom is a fantasy graphical adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The Necromancer is about to wage war on Earth. He needs his lost gold ring to acquire the power to do so. You must find the ring, take it to Mt. Doom, and destroy it in the flames from which it came, thus eliminating the Necromancer's evil power.

During the adventure, the player is harassed by, and can be captured by goblins. The player must give a treasure to win their freedom. There are several item-based puzzles, and numerous items to collect. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and each area has a picture and a description. There is no Save/Restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: Gold Ring in the Mushroom Room

title: Journey to Mt. Doom

description:
Lunchtime is a 1-player clone of Burgertime for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a chef who moves laterally, and can climb ladders to different platforms. The player is constantly chased by different food products, who take a life if they catch him. The player must knock sections of a burger to the bottom of the screen by walking across them, and can defeat enemies if they are caught underneath a burger section. Burger sections are arranged vertically, and knocking a top piece down will knock down any lower pieces it hits. The player starts with 5 lives. When all burgers are completed, the player moves to the next challenge.
title: Lunchtime

description:
The Martian Crypt is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player has landed on the desolate surface of Mars. Deep within lies the Martian population asleep in suspended animation. The player must follow cryptic Martian clues and overcome several dangers to reach the Martian chamber. All locations are graphically displayed. All commands are via VERB NOUN text entry.
title: The Martian Crypt

description:
Maui Vice is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is trying to find David Crock, who has been seen selling illicit goods. All commands are via menu structures via the mouse. The player can travel to different locations by walking or via vehicle, and can interview the people at those locations. The player has an inventory, and items in that location or inventory can be examined, smelled, photographed, or dropped. There is also an option to shoot or arrest people. Locations and people can also be accessed by telephone. There is a save and restore feature.
title: Maui Vice

description:
Moneyopoly is a 2 - 4 player board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

An unlicensed version of the Parker Brothers board game Monopoly. Closely follows the rules of the original board game, with several game play options including time limitations, money goals, or playing until a monopoly is acquired. Players take turns rolling dice and moving on a board, and can purchase real estate and buildings to place on the sites.
title: Moneyopoly

description:
Moon Lander is a 1 - 4 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to place a moon lander on 1 of 3 possible landing sites. The player controls vertical and horizontal thrust of their vessel. There are 10 levels of gravity. The player receives a final score based upon the gravity and remaining fuel at time of landing.
title: Moon Lander

description:
Ms. Maze is a 1-player arcade clone of Ms. Pac-Man game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Try to gobble up the dots before the hungry ghosts catch you. Gobble one of the large power dots for added strength, and it's your turn to chase the ghouls for extra bonus points. The player starts with 3 lives, and 1 is lost if a ghost catches them. Gobble all the dots, and move on to the next level.
title: Ms. Maze

description:
P51 Mustang Attack Flight Simulator is a 1-player flight and combat simulator for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Allows the player to land, take off, and compete in aerial dogfights with up to 3 computerized drones, and even allows for 2-player combat via the modem. The plane is controlled from a 1st person perspective, and closely models real aspects of the P51 Mustang. The instrument panel includes air speed indicator, altimeter, MDA light, heading indicator, fuel gauge, radar, and throttle indicator. Ground locations are divided into friendly and enemy territory, and the player can hide from opponent radar below 500 feet, but is susceptible to enemy ground fire. There are 3 levels of difficulty for each player, and bullet holes appear on the screen as the player takes fire.
title: P51 Mustang Attack Flight Simulator

description:
Panic is a 1- 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a character that moves laterally and can climb ladders. The player has the ability to dig holes, and tries to trap the approaching enemies. Enemies can then be defeated by filling the hole in on top of them. The player starts with 3 lives, and there is limited time to complete each level represented by a player's remaining oxygen.
title: Panic

description:
Protectors is a 1-player arcade clone of Defender for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship, which can fire in all directions, and can move vertically. The player can control the horizontal speed of the vessel. The goal is to destroy incoming alien vessels, and prevent them from destroying friendly structures on the ground. The player is armed with 4 smart bombs, which destroy all enemies on the screen. The player starts with 3 ships, and gains an extra every 5000 points. The player can take limited hits to their city before a game over.
title: Protectors

description:
Quix is a 1 - 2 player clone of Qix for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player guides a marker which must draw rectangles and other shapes in order to claim territory. Lines must be connected to previously present edges, and the player can't travel within claimed territory except along lines. Once a shape has been made, it will be colored in to show that this territory is claimed. While drawing the rectangles, the player needs to avoid the Quix, a series of colored lines that crawl the screen, and the Sparks that travel around the border and any lines the player has made. The player can score double points by moving slower and coloring an area red. The Fuse travels along new lines, preventing the player from moving too slowly. The player has limited time per stage. Once the player has claimed enough territory, they proceed to the next level.
title: Quix

description:
Skyway is an isometric 2D Scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Travelling on a track out in the cosmos, the player controls a spaceship which moves laterally, jumps, and can fire directly forwards. The player must avoid dangers including enemy vehicles, stationary objects, and jumps. If the player moves off the side of the track or hits an object, they are destroyed. The player must travel through numerous sectors and levels, and starts with 5 ships.
title: Skyway

description:
Snak Pac is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a character in a maze, who attempts to eat all the dots. The player is chased by 3 ghosts, who become temporarily vulnerable if the player eats one of the larger power pellets in the maze. The player eats apples for bonus points, and advances to a harder challenge when all dots are eaten. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Snak Pac

description:
Solo Pool is a 1 - 2 player pool game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player's ball is randomly placed on the pool table, and the 6 pockets are given different point values, with more difficult shots being worth more points. The player positions the cue, with the distance from the ball determining the shot strength. There are 4 levels of difficulty which determine overall shot strength. Multicolored bonus balls can appear for extra points. Single player games go to 6 shots, while 2-player games are best of 5 with a 6th round if needed.
title: Solo Pool

description:
SR-71 is a flight simulator for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to navigate the SR-71 Blackbird reconnaissance aircraft from a Turkish military base to a site within the Soviet Union, photograph a specific military installation, and then safely navigate to and land in Japan to deliver the photographs. The player must navigate around or defend from 3 different types of SAM sites using the Blackbird's defense systems, including: heat flares and quail missiles. Instrument panels include: airspeed indicator, compass, and altimeter. The player has limited fuel for their mission. Autopilot can be engaged for long stretches of the mission to accelerate time, but this is discontinued when approach enemy SAM sites or when under direct threat.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mission end crashed too close to the ground

title: SR-71

description:
Startrek is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes control of the U.S.S. Enterprise, and warps between quadrants trying to destroy all the Klingon vessels. The player can fire torpedoes or use their phasers. The ship has limited energy, which can be used to power shields or the phasers. The ship can take damage and enact repairs, as well as visit star bases for repairs and recharges. There are 6 levels of difficulty.
title: Startrek

description:
Warehouse Mutants is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo

The player moves their mutant through a warehouse containing a number of boxes which can be pushed until they run into a wall or the edge of the screen. Running through the maze are similar appearing mutants, which can be destroyed by kicking a crate into them. As the level progresses, more mutants hatch from crates. If a crate is against the edge of the screen or another crate, it is destroyed. If all mutants are destroyed, the player moves to a faster level. The player can take 3 hits before game over, and there is no pause after taking damage. An extra hit is earned after each level.
title: Warehouse Mutants

description:
War Kings is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a king, safe behind the walls of their castle in the top left and bottom right of the screen. A small bouncing ball moves about the screen, and if it hits the castle, a small piece is destroyed. The player controls a paddle which moves around the castle, and can deflect incoming hits. There are 3 levels of game speed. If the ball makes it inside the castle and hits the king, it's game over.
title: War Kings

description:
Wizard's Den is a 2d scrolling 1-player scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player control a knight who must defeat the evil wizard and his servants by finding the magic gem. The player can move in all directions, and fires directly forwards. The knight starts with 8000 health points, and the player gains health by picking up food jars and wine. Potions increase the player's magic power, while rings increase the shot power. Swords allow the player to fire more shots at once. Monsters crawl out of spawn points, and each type has different hit points and damage values. Terrain with bones damages the player. On each level, the player must find the exit point to advance to the next level.
title: Wizard's Den

description:
Adventure in Mythology is a graphical text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores classing Greek mythology, in their quest to marry the fleet-footed huntress Atalanta. The player starts out in the countryside, but is transported to the island of Crete through a kiss of a beautiful statue of Galatea. In Crete, they visit King Minis' castle where they are tasked with entering the Labyrinth and slaying the Minotaur. Finally, they encounter Atalanta, and can win her hand in marriage if they can beat her in a foot race.

All commands are via VERB NOUB entry, and there are 10 save game slots. All locations are graphically displayed on the screen, and the game tracks how many turns have been played.
title: Adventure in Mythology

description:
Eagle is a planetary landing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective within the cockpit of the Eagle landing module, the player attempts to safely land at a predetermined site on the Earth's Moon or the surface of Mars. The player must carefully control the pitch and vertical and horizontal velocity of their craft. The player has limited fuel to make a safe landing, and receives a score based upon the time to landing and their remaining fuel. The planetary surface steadily approaches as the player approaches the landing site. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Eagle

description:
Fighter Pilot is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a fighter plane which can move in all directions, and fires directly forwards. The player attempts to destroy all enemy planes, which circle and fire towards the player. There are several different sizes and varieties of enemy planes, large ones requiring several hits to destroy. The player tries to destroy all enemy planes in each wave, and then proceeds to a more difficult level. The player starts with 3 planes, and it's game over when all are destroyed.
title: Fighter Pilot

description:
Marooned! is a science fiction themed graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Sitting outside on the back porch one fine afternoon, you see a strange, flashing UFO-type object descend from the clouds and land in the corn field. Being the curious type, you run out to investigate and find a spaceship with its hatch open. As you step inside, the hatch closes and the ship takes off! The object of the adventure is to find your way back home.

Marooned! is an adventure game in two parts. In the first section, the player boards the alien vessel, and forces it to crash on an alien planet. In the second part, the player must explore the alien planet to discover the door that leads back home. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a built in help system that provides hints in different settings. A save/restore feature with 10 slots is available.
title: Marooned!

description:
Mission of Vengeance is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo

You are Garrotte Severrin, master thief, spy, and assassin. One night, while routinely sitting along in a tavern, you were approached by two men clad in grey robes and hoods - priests of the Temple of Dah. One of the priests furtively dropped a heavy pouch of coins on your lap and said that if you wanted more to come to Cemetery Hill at midnight.

At the hill you were greeted by three dark figures, with hoods pulled down concealing their faces. It was the high Priest who spoke first, "The wizard Meemon has defiled our temple, stealing from us a sacred relic - the holy scepter of Tash. If you kill this infidel and return the scepter to us we will give you a fortune in gold."

That night, you steal away to the Black Swamp, where Meemon's fortress was hidden. You silently scale one of the towers and begin your search for the relic and the wizard.

The player inputs commands via VERB NOUN entry, and all areas are graphically displayed on the screen. There is a save and restore feature. The player tries to solve a variety of inventory based puzzles. There is a basic combat system, where the player and enemy take turns swinging at each other until one is destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Killed by a Sabre Tooth Cat

title: Mission of Vengeance

description:
Pumpman is a 1-player clone of Dig Dug for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who moves about underground, trying to destroy all of the subterranean enemies. The player digs a tunnel as they move, and if they burrow beneath boulders, these fall down crushing the player or monster underneath. The player is armed with a pump, which can inflate enemies and cause them to be destroyed. If the player has to stop inflating an enemy, they will eventually return to normal size. Enemies each start in their own section of the cavern, but they can sometimes move through solid rock to attack the player. If the player touches an enemy, they lose a life, and there are 3 lives at the beginning.
title: Pumpman

description:
The Andrea Coco is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

All you came down to the Yacht Club for was to get a drink and maybe play a little poker. Heck, nobody would ever guess that the closest you owned to a real yacht was the one over your fireplace. It was in the bar that you heard rumors of earth-shattering events about to take place. You step out onto the wharf to get a little air, when your natural curiosity and sense of adventure start to work. Can you save the world?

All commands via VERB NOUN entry. All locations are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player has an inventory to solve a number of puzzles. There is a save and restore feature.
title: The Andrea Coco

description:
The Treasure Hunt is a 1-player graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to find the elusive treasure of gold. The player must explore locations, which include: a farmhouse, a town, an abandoned mine shaft, and more. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and the player's travel between locations is animated as the screen scrolls. As the player travels between locations, they can pick up items, but only two at a time. There is no save nor restore feature.
title: The Treasure Hunt

description:
Adventure in Wonderland is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Play the role of Alice, as you wander through Wonderland. Visit the garden of live flowers, the treacherous Tugley Woods, the chessboard landscape, the wabe, and meet all the familiar residents of Wonderland. Your goal is to become the Queen, save Wonderland from the Snark, and manage to return home.

Gameplay uses an Eliza-like engine, and a large number of vocabulary words are recognized, even full sentences. Most puzzles are puns with multiple solutions.
title: Adventure in Wonderland

description:
City War is a 2-player strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players take control of either 8 American or Soviet cities. During peace time, each year starting from 1960 the player can construct and place surface to surface missiles or anti-ballistic missile systems. During war, missile launches occur in real time, and the player selects the city they wish to launch from and the chosen city to attack. Each city has a set population, which can be diminished by successful nuclear weapon attacks. The head of state can be covertly moved between cities to protect them from enemy attack. The goal is to destroy all of the enemy country's cities.
title: City War

description:
Darkmoor Hold is a fantasy-themed roleplaying game with adventure elements for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In an era destroyed by the knowledge of the Renaissance, magic and its like were common and adventure was a way of life for many. Yu are a mercenary, one of those who gains fortune by fighting for those who would rather not. Recently, the Wizard of the Moors has come out from his self-imposed solitude. It seems that he has stayed too long within his hold and is in need of entertainment. As a result, much of the populous has been lost. The ruler of this area, King Baccinus, has looked upon this turn of events with disfavor as the famed necromancer is killing his beloved taxpayers. Therefore, the king has sent for you, believing that only you and your comrades can win your way into the Darkmoors and defeat the dark Wizard.

The player controls 3 characters, an elf, a human, and a dwarf, who are given independent commands each turn. The dwarf is a good fighter, while the human is more resistant to damage. The elf can perceive things the others can not, and has spell casting ability.

The player moves through levels with the direction commands, and each area is graphically displayed on the screen. On each level, the player must find a weapon, an item of defense, and a treasure, and then find the stairs to descend to a lower level. The player can descend sooner if they choose. Characters level up and are healed the first time they descend a level. Monsters become progressively harder every time they descend a level. There are 10 levels in total, with the Wizard at the bottom.

There is a save and restore feature, and all commands are via text entry.

sample_screenshots.caption: Many Orcs Guard the Stairs Down

title: Darkmoor Hold

description:
Decipher is a 1 - 4 player word game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players can compete against the computer, or human opponents, taking turns trying to descramble words. As the player types, the program tells the player if each letter is correct. The player loses a point for every mistake they make, with the winner being the player with the fewest mistakes after multiple rounds. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Decipher

description:
Dungeon Quest is a 1-player fantasy themed adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move in all directions, and fights with a sword or bow in real time. The player explores a dungeon from a top-down perspective, and can open doors, search for hidden passages, and pick up or drop items. There are numerous enemies with different health and ability to deal damage. The player can pick up weapons, amulets, and armor to help them in their adventure. The player has limited health, and dies when they accrues 100 damage. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Dungeon Quest

description:
Erland is a 2 - 5 player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player takes control of an independent city state, with the goal to outperform their neighbors over a number of years. Each year, the player must allocate resources to maintenance and growth of their sheep and grain production, as well as their fishing fleet. The goal is to promote population growth by adequately managing resources. Rats pose constant danger to grain stores, and losses can be minimized by maintaining a health population of cats. Men at Arms can help protect lambs and the population. The player has to raise taxes to pay for their expenditures. The player can enhance their city by purchasing boats, bazaars, armories, castles, abbeys, and more acreage. If the population is overly exploited they may revolt, causing great damage to resources and infrastructure.
title: Erland

description:
You, Nordea Arkon, live in the small buy peaceful kingdom of Ursea and make your measly living as an apprentice to Thelamon, the royal blacksmith. The King of Ursea, King Winslick, is a good king, and has long ruled the kingdom with a firm hand and virtuous heart, but he is nearing the end of his life and is fast losing health. The King has declared that the person who can return his stolen scepter, the Scepter of Ursea, shall become the new ruler of the land. And so you begin your quest.

At the beginning of every quest, the player roles a character's statistics of strength, dexterity, and constitution. From these, damage adjustment, armor class, and hit points are derived.

Gameplay starts on the overworld, and the player can explore the lands of Ursea, which encompasses multiple screens. Movement uses fatigue, and if the player doesn't rest before their fatigue reaches 0, they die. Encounters interrupt the player's explorations, and some encounters are friendly allowing the player to buy information or goods. Exploration can be aided by boats or horses. The player can enter the dungeon, where numerous dangers and treasures lie.

During combat, the player first enters the tactical display, where they choose which creature in a group to fight. After choosing an enemy, the player and enemy take turns rolling a 20-sided dice for damage, with a minimum threshold to score a hit. Creatures and the player can have multiple attacks per round.
title: Scepter of Ursea

description:
To Preserve Quandic is a graphical adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The year is 481 A.D., and a race known as Quandic lives a parallel but secret existence to that of Earth's emerging civilizations. Quandic is already an advanced civilization dedicated to pure science. Their aims include elimination of disease, space discovery, time travel, and the creation of a wise government. Their scientists have done well, and the great discovery of the year is the Time Machine.

But, unfortunately for Quandic and the world, one of Quandic's foremost scientists, Cerderic, while working on a breakthrough of human disease, succumbed to the disease himself. He has gone berserk, and his deviousness and sickness make him a fugitive. No one can help him.

He has stolen the time machine, dismantled it, and sent the pieces into the future. Most were recovered, but one, the key piece (of course), is somewhere in the present time. The future of the Quandic depends upon locating this critical part. The object of this adventure is to locate this item for the good of all times and peoples. You have been sent to the general vicinity, and are ready to begin your search.

All locations have a graphical and text description. Commands are via text entry. Inventory is always shown in the upper left of the screen. A timer shows the elapsed time so far during the adventure. There is a save and restore feature available.
title: To Preserve Quandic

description:
Warp Factor X is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to defeat the Klingon empire by defending and recruiting planets and space stations, as well as destroying the Klingon vessels. Played via menu structures, the player controls a spaceship armed with phasers and photon torpedoes. The ship has short and long-ranged sensors for detecting vessels, starbases and planets. The player must optimize shield deployment and enact repairs to the systems of the vessel. Ships can also be repaired at friendly space docks and planets. The player must locate and build alliances with neutral planets, and must conquer Klingon starbases and planets, to convert them to the Federation. The player uses their impulse engines to travel within sectors, and their warp engines to travel greater distances.

To beat a scenario, the player must explore 2 quadrants consisting of 9 sectors, and must destroy all Klingon starbases, all planets must be allied with the Federation, and all Klingon vessels must be destroyed. The player statistics are saved across multiple games, and starts with the rank of Cadet. The goal is to become the Captain of the U. S. S. Enterprise.
title: Warp Factor X

description:
Welcome to the Jungle is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The object is to travel 2000 miles across the magic jungle to find the lost treasure of Omar. The player has the aid of 10 men in the expedition, and it's game over when all are lost. Each turn, the player has the chance to go left, right, or forward into the dungeon. These options bring the player a bit closer to their destination. Sometimes area have enemies, which the player can try to hide from, retreat from, or attack. Retreating brings the player further from their destination, while hiding has a risk of entering combat. The player must manage their food to keep their party fed, and must maintain a store of weapons to fight the dangers of the jungle. Along the way, the player can encounter friendly natives to trade with, and can also search for supplies. Digging can often reveal traps and other dangers, while searching can help find supplies. During combat, the player chooses what weapons to use, and then takes turns attacking the enemy as it approaches, with each hit leading to a loss of men. If the player retreats, they lose distance to their goal.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Discover Food in a Mangrove Swamp

title: Welcome to the Jungle

description:
Apples is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a blue apple-eater in a randomly generated maze full of apples. Your job is to eat as many apples as you can before time runs out. There is a green apple-eater-eater who is trying to eat you, and will chase the player about the maze. The player has the ability to destroy all walls surrounding them in the 4 cardinal directions, but must be careful not to destroy apples. The player tries to collect as many of the 40 apples before time runs out or they are eaten by the apple-eater-eater. There are 5 levels of difficulty.
title: Apples

description:
Color Bowl Football is a 1 - 2 player American football game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Gameplay is divided into four 7-minute quarters. During each turn, the offensive and defensive players choose their play from a list. After both players have chosen their play, gameplay turns to an arcade segment, where each player takes control of a single player, and tries to run their play.
title: Color Bowl Football

description:
The Dungeon Depths is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character that can move in the cardinal directions in a dungeon. They can shoot or avoid monsters, and must reach the locked exit door located at the far right of the screen with a key. Levels are displayed on a single screen, and consist of teleporters, walls, one-way doors, creature generators, slides, life zappers, and a variety of treasures and dangers. The player can shoot horizontally to the left or right.
title: The Dungeon Depths

description:
Escape 2012 is a graphic adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In the year 2009, the Earth solar system was attacked by hostile forces from another solar system. The battle has raged for three years. Even with faster than light star ships and planet covering force fields, the war has come down to a stalemate. Both sides have tried to find or develop an edge over the other. They use their spies, scouts, and ultimate weapons to try to defeat and destroy the other. As in any other war, the main turning point can be the actions of a few or even one person.

You are on an alien prison ship behind the enemy lines. You were captured while on a recon mission for the United Earth Forces. The object is to escape and return to the Earth.

The player starts locked in a jail cell, and must plot their escape. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is a save and restore feature. The player explores a large number of hallways, and can be captured by alien robot patrols, which return the player to their jail cell. The player is aided by their droid Tico, which can take a variety of commands to assist the player. There are 2 arcade sequences during the game, which must be successfully solved which involve collection antimatter and correctly placing a bomb.
title: Escape 2012

description:
Franchise! is a 1-player business simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes on the role of the manager of a fast food franchise. The player sets the company's food and advertising budget, employee salaries, and can sell franchises, or create corporate owned restaurants. Gameplay occurs in 1 week intervals. The player competes with other local fast food franchises. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Franchise!

description:
Gazon is a 1 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Defend your supplies from the Gazonians. The player controls a small spaceship that can move and fire in multiple directions. A number of supplies are sitting in the middle of the screen, and multiple Gazonians will approach and attempt to pull the supplies off the screen. If a Gazonian picks up the supplies and is then shot, the supplies will sit towards the edge of the screen awaiting the next Gazonian to approach. If the player strikes an enemy, they are removed to the edge of the screen. Certain Gazonians can only be destroyed by running into them, and are immune to cannon fire. The game is over when all supplies are lost.
title: Gazon

description:
Hyper Zone is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player tries to shoot incoming alien vessels and rockets by moving their space vessel. The player can briefly use shields to protect themselves from incoming missiles, or can dodge to the sides. The player starts with 5 lives, and loses one when they are hit. There are 9 levels of difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Getting Ready for the Next Stage

title: Hyper Zone

description:
Ice Hockey is a 1-player 2 on 2 ice hockey game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls their hockey player in the defensive or offensive zone depending upon where the puck is located. The player scores a point for each goal, and games are divided into three 10 minute periods. There is no goalie.
title: Ice Hockey

description:
Iron Cross is a 1-player World War II strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Nazi forces as they storm into Russia on 22 June 1941. The goal is to capture the major Russian cities using Nazi forces. Gameplay occurs on a map of Eastern Europe, and the player control cavalry units, panzer corps, tank armies, and infantry units. Each player takes turns moving forces and attacking enemies units. Forces can be moved in standard, attrition, blitz, entrench, and march mode, which effect speed and combat ability. Forces will be resupplied each month if they can make a direct line back to their side of the screen. Better supplied units fight better in combat. Each unit has a zone of control, forcing enemies to engage in combat if they enter this area.

Game play occurs in 1 week time units. Weather effects troop movement, and mud season slows the German advance. Rivers and lakes freeze solid in the winter. There are 5 levels of difficulty, with more difficult challenges including more Russian forces and longer play time. Games can be saved in progress.
title: Iron Cross

description:
Megapede is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character that moves on the bottom quarter of the screen, and can shot vertically upwards. Megapedes descend from the top of the screen, moving horizontally until they hit an object, and then descending one row and moving in the reverse. When a megapede is shot, it breaks into smaller components. The player must avoid spiders who quickly move about the bottom of the screen and fleas which descend towards the player leaving objects in their wake. When all megapedes are destroyed, the player advances to a more difficult level. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Megapede

description:
Nuke the Love Boat! is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

They are bent on detonating their stolen nuclear device on board but you stumbled upon it first. Captain Stubing was injured fighting the terrorists. You are now acting captain. With the help of Doc, Julie, Gopher, the rest of the crew, and an assortment of guest stars, you must form a commando army to keep the bomb, and the ship, out of terrorist hands. You discovered the terrorists planting the bomb in the communication room.

Surprised, they dropped the suitcase containing the bomb and fled. Gopher grabbed a flaregun and fired it at the fleeing terrorists. The flare exploded in the communications room, destroying it. You are now all but stranded in the middle of the ocean with terrorists aboard. Hopefully, all of the passengers are safe, as they are watching "Sink the Titantic!" in the showroom. Or are they all accounted for?

The terrorists have automatic weapons which could be hazardous to your health. Your only weapons are the ones your ingenuity can create. This strategy simulation is much more than a sitcom. It's a race against time and all the odds. The fate of primetime America rests in your hands. Can you stop Abdul Mullah before he Nukes the Love Boat!'?

Based upon the 1970s sitcom, the player much search the Love Boat in search of items which can be converted to weapons to fight off the terrorist threat. All commands are via menu structures, and navigation is via a plan of the ship. The player can communicate with and ask the cast members for help with the mission. Once weapons are assembled, the player can send cast members off on missions to try to stop the terrorist threat. There is a save and reload feature. If the player messes up, the show is cancelled by a network executive.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sending my Crew on a Mission

title: Nuke the Love Boat!

description:
Omniverse is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a theoretical physicist who has discovered gateways into new dimensions and universes. Unfortunately, you've also learned of an alien plot to set up networks of these gateways, and through them, conquer the Earth.

The player travels through a large number of featureless outdoor environments, collecting items and meeting several different characters. The player ultimately travels to a barren alien world, where they reach a volcano. All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and there is a save and restore feature. There is a help feature available.

sample_screenshots.caption: And Travel to a Deserted Island

title: Omniverse

description:
Pro Golf is a 1 - 4 player golf game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Includes 18 holes of golf, as well as a driving range and putting practice. Each player choses to be right or left handed. When playing on a course, the player chooses their club, which controls the length of their swing, and the direction of their swing. Wind Effects ball movement. Courses include water and sand traps, rough areas, and forests. When the player reaches the green, a special putting view starts.
title: Pro Golf

description:
Return of Junior's Revenge is a higher color remake of Junior's Revenge, which is a feature-complete clone of Donkey Kong Jr.. All four stages of the original game are present.

Junior, son of a monkey, must free his son from the evil Luigi. He does this by climbing up and down vines and jumping between platforms, avoiding the crocodile-like creatures that run up and down the vines. On later screens, he must climb chains to push locks into position so that the cage holding his son is opened. Finally, the player enters Luigi's lair, where they must avoid large electrical creatures. Fruits can be found hanging on the vines and chains, which can be picked up for points, upon which they drop, eliminating any enemies unfortunate enough to be positioned underneath.
title: Return of Junior's Revenge

description:
Sam Sleuth: Private Investigator is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to solve 1 of 3 criminal mysteries of 3 levels of difficulty. The mystery is the same, but the details of each case is randomly generated. All commands are via menu structures using the mouse. The player can travel to different locations by car, driving on a larger map. If the player goes off the road and crashes, they start at their previous location. The player can interview the people at these locations. The player has an inventory, and items in that location or inventory can be picked up, examined, or used. There is also an option to shoot people. Locations and people can also be accessed by telephone.

sample_screenshots.caption: Asking the Doctor About the Cat

title: Sam Sleuth: Private Investigator

description:
Time Patrol is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a space ship that can move and fire in 8 directions. The player navigates on a large 2D field that scrolls infinitely in all directions. The player travels through time, fighting progressively more advanced aircraft, starting with simple bi-planes, advancing to helicopters and jets, and finally to UFOs and other futuristic vessels. The goal on each level is destroy a number of enemy vessels until a boss vehicle appears and is defeated. When an enemy ship is shot down, it turns into a person parachuting to the ground, which can be picked up for bonus points.
title: Time Patrol

description:
Treasure of the Aztecs is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The adventure take place circa 1520, during Hernando Cortes' conquest of the Aztecs. You are amongst the soldiers searching the city of Tenochtitlan to find the great treasure of the Aztecs. During a foray into the jungle, you are rendered unconscious by an Aztec attack and separated from your party. Alone, you must survive in the jungle, avoid the Aztecs, and fine the Treasure of the Aztecs.

The player must explore undergrounds caverns, Aztec pyramids, dungeons, and impenetrable jungles to find the treasure. All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and there is a save and restore feature. There is a help feature available.
title: Treasure of the Aztecs

description:
Voxchess is a 1-player versus computer chess game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

All pieces are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player inputs commands by entering the coordinates of moves. There are 24 levels of difficulty.
title: Voxchess

description:
Blackbeard's Island is a graphic adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The year is 1608, and the place the West Indies. Captain Edward Teach (alias Blackbeard) has raided an English vessel, and has made a grand gain. Teach, wary of the British navy, sets sail into the southern Pacific where he buries the treasure on a forgotten isle.

You are treasure hunter, and all-around beach bum, Tom Wentworth. During a drunken voyage, you've fallen off your father's yacht and washed ashore. The island is a virtual paradise, except for the fact that the island's volcano is going to erupt. You must escape the island and find Blackbeard's treasure.

The player must contest with thirst, underground tunnels, as they explore an uninhabited island. All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and there is a save and restore feature. There is a help feature available.
title: Blackbeard's Island

description:
Brew Master is a 1-player clone of Tapper.

The player controls the brew master, who has to serve beer to demanding customers. There are four customers, each has their own lane lengthier than the previous one, whom you have to keep at bay. If they reach the end of the lane without receiving their beer, the player loses a life. If the player misses a customer and spills a beer, or if the customer throws a mug back and the brew master misses it, the player loses a life. On higher levels, there are multiple customers per lane.
title: Brew Master

description:
Coco Crosswords is a 1-player crossword program for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Complete crossword puzzles. Letters are manually types into spaces, and clues are made available. Contains 27 puzzles with 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Coco Crosswords

description:
Color Car Action is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small car from a top-down perspective, trying to survive in a 2D scrolling track as other vehicles try to push the player into the edges of the track. The player can hit other cars and bounce them into the edge, destroying them. The player must avoid boulders dropped by trucks, and running into the front of bulldozers. If the car is going fast enough, it can jump into the air, necessary to avoid bridges and other vehicles. The player starts with 3 vehicles.
title: Color Car Action

description:
Fourcube is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a 4 x 4 x 4 board, players take turns placing a colored piece on the board. The first player to score 4-in-a-row is the winner. The board can be viewed from multiple angles. There are 6 levels of computer opponent difficulty.
title: Fourcube

description:
The Mis-Adventures of Eddie is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Hiking in the mountains one sunny morning with your trusty golden retriever, you come across an abandoned mine shaft. Dust and cobwebs fill the tunnel, looking as if no one has been there for decades. You get your lantern out of your backpack and shine it down the shaft. Several crickets now become silent as you gaze down the tunnel, which goes on as far as the eye can see. Suddenly your dog takes off down the shaft, barking madly. You chase him with backpack lugging from side to side.

As you run after your dog you remember an old tale. Many years ago, there was a mining family who would not leave their boom town, even when the mines were empty of gold. They told people the mines held more that they thought. This family was after something much more, they wanted to live forever, and claimed the mines prolonged life. People called them crazy and left them to their fantasies. Several months later a mining shaft collapsed, tragically killing the miner's wife. Nobody has heard from the miner or his son since, but some say they still live in their mine, happy and content, almost a century later. But really, that's just a story told around a campfire late at night. Now where did that dog go?

As the player enters the caverns, they meet the old man, and learn that his son has escaped into the time continuum and may change the course of history. The player moves through a maze of tunnels. In this maze, are a series of fields of mist, which take the player to different time zones, each one containing Eddie. In each area, the player must collect gems and stop the bumbling Eddie from messing up history.

All commands are created by typing VERB NOUN entries. There are a limited number of hints available per game. There is a save and restore feature. The time and compass direction are displayed on the screen, including available movement directions.
title: The Mis-Adventures of Eddie

description:
The Wild West is a graphic adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Black Bart has been terrorizing the residents of the western town of Dry Gulch. As the sheriff around these parts, you're going to have to find out where Black Bart and his treasure are hiding, deal with his men and girlfriend, and put an end to Black Bart's reign of terror.

All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and there is a save and restore feature. There is a help feature available
title: The Wild West

description:
Champion is a 1-player arcade and strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a crusader for the side of all that is right and good, or more appropriately, a Champion. Blessed with super powers, you have decided to use these abilities to fight crime. Unfortunately, the criminal mastermind Mr. Bigg has decided to use his superpowers to rule mankind instead of help. Mr. Bigg has plotted to take over the fair city of Oakdale, and you are determined to stop him at all costs. Mr. Bigg has hired a small army of villains, and will use them to stop you.

You must search the city of Oakdale and gather the 3 components necessary to tune into the aural frequencies of Mr. Bigg, and track down the chief villain. You also must find the Power Drain, the only device which will allow you to defeat Mr. Bigg in combat.

There are 3 levels of difficulty. The game screen is divided into messages, commands, and a small map of the surrounding area. The player has the option to fly or walk. In fly mode, the game moves in real time, and the player can not interact with the villains. During this mode, the enemies move on their own. When the player lands, they enter walk mode, where gameplay is turn-based, and the player can search, take items, view their map, or fight with the various villains. The player can not search an area or get an item until all villains in that area have been defeated.

In combat, the player can punch, kick, dodge, blast, retreat, target specific areas, or use the power drain if in possession. Enemies are shown on the screen, and their attacks are animated. The player has limited strength, which is permanently lost with each hit. Endurance is drained by using actions, but is replenished during flight.

Victory is achieved by defeating Mr. Bigg. Defeat occurs when the villains take over the city, or all health is lost.
title: Champion

description:
CyberTank is a 1-player strategy arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a tank from a 1st person perspective on an intelligence gathering mission, as they attempt to invade enemy territory. A map of the nearby and previously explored areas are available on each level to assist the player with navigation. As the game progresses, the tank becomes armed with multiple different offensive and defensive systems, as well as stealth equipment. The tank is also armed with a radar sweep target indicator and the number and type of enemy vehicles currently in radar range. This equipment can be modified by being close to headquarters. For each mission, the tank has limited fuel and shield capacity, and tank systems can become damaged from enemy fire.

There are 4 types of enemy vehicles: flamethrowers, mobile pillboxes, battle tanks, and tank destroyers, each with unique offensive, defensive, and movement capacities. Four minutes into every mission, a surveillance aircraft arrives, which beams the location of your tank to all surviving enemy vessels. Four minutes after this, a transport plane arrives, and begins to deliver new enemy reinforcements at a rate of 1 every 12 seconds. This necessitates the player quickly destroying enemy vehicles and reaching their destination.
title: CyberTank

description:
Time Fighter is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small vessel, which moves in all directions and fires directly forwards. The player must avoid incoming vessels and hitting the edges of the screen. The player starts in 8291 BC fighting dragons, and then goes to 1939 AD to fight warplanes. In the future, the player fights advanced aircraft. The player also avoids invisible mines, which briefly flash on the screen. The player has limited ammo and fuel, and can recharge between rounds from a refueling vessel. The player starts with 5 vessels, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Time Fighter

description:
Sports: Volume 1 is a compilation of sports games for the Commodore 64.

Includes:* Clubhouse Sports

  • Indoor Sports
  • Superstar Ice Hockey
  • Superstar Soccer
title: Sports: Volume 1

description:
CC-Thello is a 1-player versus computer Othello program.

Each player takes turns placing a colored token on an 8 x 8 board. The player can collect all opponent pieces placed between their two pieces. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game is the winner. There are 4 levels of opponent difficulty.
title: CC-Thello

description:
Colorout is a 1-player Breakout clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a paddle horizontally on the bottom of the screen, and tries to bounce a ball into the blocks at the top of the screen. As each block is hit, it disappears from the screen, and the goal is to clear the entire board. The player starts with 6 balls, and when all are lost, it's game over.
title: Colorout

description:
Color Panic is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls an astronaut who moves about a series of ladders and platforms chased by aliens. Their only means of a defense is a shovel, used to dig holes to trap aliens. Holes cannot be dug on the bottom level. A trapped alien can be destroyed by reburying it, but if the alien escapes, it emerges in a more powerful form. The player has limited oxygen to complete each level, and starts with 3 lives. The player advances to a more challenging level by destroying all aliens present on the screen.
title: Color Panic

description:
Cosmic Superbowl is a 1-player arcade American football game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In a football competition between the Noteeks and Calaxxians, the player takes on the role of the Noteeks. The goal is to run the player the length of a football field, which is divided into 9 vertical segments. In each segment, the player or opponent can be in 3 different vertical positions.
