The player can move horizontally to the right, and can take the 3 vertical positions, and tries to maneuver themselves between the incoming opponent's men.
title: Cosmic Superbowl

description:
An implementation of Conway's Game of Life for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player implements the starting pattern by drawing it on the screen using the keyboard.

  • Any live cell with fewer than 2 or more than 3 live neighbors dies.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbors lives on to the next generation.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbors becomes a live cell through reproduction.

The player can advance by single steps, or set the game to automatically advance through multiple generations.
title: Game of Life

description:
Bouncing Boulders is a 1-player Boulder Dash clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player has to dig through monster infested caves in search of diamonds. In each level you must collect a certain number of these diamonds in order to open a portal to the next stage. Enemies can be squashed by falling boulders, which are released when the ground below them is removed or they are pushed onto empty ground, but be careful because these can also squash you. Each level is timed, and some monsters become diamonds when destroyed.
title: Bouncing Boulders

description:
F-16 Assault is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls an F-16 aircraft, which can move in all directions and fires directly forwards. The player travels over a 2D scrolling map, and must avoid assault by enemy helicopters, fighter jets, and incoming rockets. The player can see jets, helicopters, and rockets taking off from the ground below, and can shoot them before they reach the player. When enemy aircraft are not in the air, the player can drop bombs on enemy installations.
title: F-16 Assault

description:
Gantelet is a 1 - 3 player Gauntlet clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player chooses from 1 of the 3 classes Wizard, Warrior, and Elf. Each can move in the 4 cardinal directions, and shoot some sort of ranged attack. The player must navigate mazes fighting enemies. Players' health constantly falls, and must be replenished by gathering food. Keys are collected to unlock doors, and the goal of each level is to reach the exit square. Certain terrain can be shot, and treasure can be gathered for bonus points. Enemies spawn from specific points, which can be destroyed. With a speech pack installed, the game will narrate character actions. The game is over when all characters have lost their health.
title: Gantelet

description:
Gantelet II is a 1 - 4 player Gauntlet clone, and sequel to the original Gantelet for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player chooses from 1 of the 4 classes Wizard, Warrior, Valkyrie, and Elf. Each can move in 8 directions, and shoot some sort of ranged attack. The player must navigate mazes fighting enemies. Players' health constantly falls, and must be replenished by gathering food. Keys are collected to unlock doors, and the goal of each level is to reach the exit square. Certain terrain can be shot, and treasure can be gathered for bonus points. Enemies spawn from specific points, which can be destroyed. With a speech pack installed, the game will narrate character actions. The game is over when all characters have lost their health.
title: Gantelet II

description:
Gates of Delirium is a fantasy-themed RPG for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player quests to find the 7 keys to the Gates of Delirium hidden in the dungeons and towers of the land. The game is almost an identical clone of Ultima III.

At the beginning of each game, the player creates a new character, choosing the sex, race, and class, and spreading 50 attribute points between strength, dexterity, intelligence, and wisdom. The single player can recruit further adventurers during their quest.

The player moves about from a top-down perspective, and can enter various castles, towns, and dungeons from the overland map. The player can talk to the various inhabitants of the land for clues to solve puzzles. Food, armor, and weapons can be purchased from various shops. The king will increase the hit points of sufficiently experienced characters

Combat occurs on a separate screen, where the player's party fights with multiple enemies until 1 team is destroyed.
title: Gates of Delirium

description:
Gold Runner II is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo, and the sequel to Gold Runner.

The player controls a small character who can move laterally, climb ladders, and dig small holes in the ground to trap enemies. The character must collect gold from a series of platforms, and take them to the top-most ladder to advance to the next level. Enemy characters relentlessly pursue the player, and take their life if they catch them. Enemies will also pick up gold, and the player must retrieve it by dropping the enemy into a hole. Enemies can only exit and enter ladders from the top or the bottom, while a player can exit or enter a ladder at any point. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Gold Runner II

description:
Grand Prix Challenge is a 1- 3 player racing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a top-down perspective, players race 5 laps around a number of different tracks. Obstacles including water puddles and oil slicks that can be randomly placed on each track. Each race, the player can pick up wrenches, which can be used to increase a vehicle's speed, acceleration, traction, or overall score. The player starts with 3 lives, and if they come in 2nd in a race they lose a life, and if they come in 3rd they lose 2 lives.
title: Grand Prix Challenge

description:
Iron Forest is a 1-player shooting game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player uses a light gun to shoot birds flying across the screen. There are multiple levels of difficulty and various backgrounds. The game tracks score and number of birds shot.
title: Iron Forest

description:
Karate is a 1-2 player arcade karate game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players square off in a karate match, and can throw a number of defensive and offensive moves including: drop kick, forward kick, low kick, back kick to body or head, crouch, or flip. In tournament, each player scores 1/2 point for knocking their opponent down, and a score is given for the type of hit that connects. Victory goes to the first player to reach 2 points. Matches versus the computer opponent have a 30 second time limit.
title: Karate

description:
Knock Out is an arcade boxing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes against several different opponents of increasing difficulty in a single round 3 minute boxing match. The player can dodge left or right, and can also throw punches left and right. The view is from directly behind the player, with the player appearing transparent to show the opponent. Every hit that connects with the opponent increases the KO meter, allowing the player to land devastating punches if this is maxed out. The player and opponent also both have a health bar on the left of the screen. If the opponent is knocked down 3 times, or takes devastating hits, they stay down. If the player is knocked down once, it's game over. The player can regain some health by damaging their opponent at a full KO meter. If the player loses a match, it's game over, and must climb the ranking once again.

sample_screenshots.caption: First up is the Canvas Kid

title: Knock Out

description:
The Lansford Manor Adventure is a graphic adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores Lansford Manor and the surrounding community, including the police station and general store. The goal is to find a variety of treasures, and return them to the main hall of the mansion and deposit them there.

All commands are via text entry use VERB NOUN commands. There is a save and restore feature. The player can play with or without graphics.
title: The Lansford Manor Adventure

description:
Marble Maze is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to navigate a rolling marble through a series of mazes to reach the finish line. The marble can role in 8 possible directions, and must navigate a number of hills, ramps, and other obstacles. The player has a limited time to complete each level, and loses time if they hit an obstacle or fall off the edge of the maze. Different monsters move about the screen, and can slow the player down. The player receives a bonus on each level for remaining time upon finishing the maze.
title: Marble Maze

description:
Medieval Madness is a 1-player arcade shooter for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player uses a light gun to shoot enemies, as a knight slowly walks across the screen. The player must prevent the enemies, including: spitting plants, goblins, bats, and insects from touching the knight, or he must restart his slow journey minus a life.

There are 3 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Medieval Madness

description:
Paper Route is a 1-player clone of the arcade game Paperboy for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a paperboy, whose goal is to deliver newspapers to a number of residences along the street. The player moves their bicycle along the side of the road, trying to avoid dangers including moving cars, remote control cars, people throwing boomerangs, fences, cracks in the sidewalk, and others. The player can move laterally, and accelerate and decelerate. The player can pick up more newspapers as they cycle, and must throw a certain number into mailboxes to keep their job. The player loses a life for every crash, and starts with 3 lives.
title: Paper Route

description:
Rush'n Assault is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a soldier from a top-down perspective, who can move in 8 separate directions, and can fire bullets and throw grenades. The player moves continuously forwards, but can briefly back up to the bottom of the screen. The player has limited bullets and grenades, but can pick up more by destroying pillboxes and other enemy structures. These structures can only be destroyed with grenades. The player has limited health, and takes damage from gunfire. It's game over when all health is lost.
title: Rush'n Assault

description:
Wrestle Maniac is a 1 - 2 player professional wrestling game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Allows for 1-player versus computer, 2-player, and even tag-team matches. Wrestlers are controlled via joystick. Wrestlers can move about the ring, kick, punch, and even climb onto the ropes and take a flying leap at their opponent. Each player has limited health, and when sufficient damage has occurred, the player can be pinned to the mat.
title: Wrestle Maniac

description:
Xenion is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship which can move in all directions, and fires directly forwards. The player combats streams of alien vessels, that swoop in and fire at the player. The player has limited health, and energy can be replenished by picking up energy cells. A small radar in the bottom right of the screen notes when tanks, helicopters, or forcefield dangers are approaching. Forcefields cover most of the gameplay area, and can only be destroyed by shooting their generator. The player has 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Xenion

description:
Flying Tigers is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship, that can move in all directions and fire horizontally forwards. Alien vessels attempt to swoop down and kidnap the humans that are on the bottom of the screen, and the player must shoot the alien vessels before they leave the screen. A small map at the top of the screen shows alien and human locations. There are 5 levels of difficulty. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Flying Tigers

description:
Annihilator is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Hoards of funny little creatures have invaded the planet Val. The aliens are harmless, but you want to kill them anyway, just like flies. A new wave of faster pests arrive at the planet after you destroy the old wave.

The player controls a small vessel that can move in all directions, and fires directly forwards. A small map at the top of the screen shows the location of alien vessels. The player tries to shoot all alien vessels as they move about on the screen. If all vessels are destroyed, the player moves to a challenge with faster moving creatures.
title: Annihilator

description:
EZ Ski is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to navigate a skier down a hill, while avoiding obstacles including rocks, trees, flags, and other skiers. The player gains points for the longer they ski, and also for going between or around specific flags. The player has 3 lives per game. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: EZ Ski

description:
Fly By is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to shoot ducks, planes, and smiley faces as they fly horizontally across the screen. These enemies will drop bombs when directly above the player. The character can move horizontally at the bottom of the screen, and fire vertically upwards. Two large barricades offer some protection. The player has 3 lives.
title: Fly By

description:
Gremlin is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a small crosshair through a maze trying to shoot the gremlins that move about. The crosshair shoots in 4 directions, and the player loses a life if they're hit by a gremlin. After clearing all gremlins, the player advances to a level with more gremlins.
title: Gremlin

description:
Grid is a 2-player strategy board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The goal is to change as much of a 14 x 7 grid to the player's color as possible. The player with the most pieces at the end of the game is the winner.

The player uses their joystick to move their cursor about the board to grab blocks from the edge of the screen and place them on the board.
title: Grid

description:
Maze Land is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates 1 of 3 mazes, trying to pick up all the moving boxes. There are 2 monsters the player must avoid, or they lose a life and have to restart the level. A special block which moves through walls can be collected, which speeds up the player's movement. When all boxes are collected, the player moves to the next maze.
title: Maze Land

description:
Germ Warfare is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically forwards. Enemy germs move at 45 degree angles towards the bottom of the screen, and the player must zap them before they reach the bottom and infect the host. When 8 germs reach the bottom, it's game over. The game tracks how many germs have been destroyed, and when all enemies on the screen have been zapped, a new set of baddies appear.
title: Germ Warfare

description:
Mr. Munch is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves Mr. Munch around a maze trying to gobble all the dots. A single ghost invariably moves towards the player. If the player munches a large pellet, the ghost is temporarily vulnerable. The player clears a level if all pellets are munched.
title: Mr. Munch

description:
Wiggle Worm is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The Wiggle Worm descend through the forest towards the player. The worm moves horizontally, but descend a row and changes direction whenever it encounters an obstacle or is shot. The player controls a small character who can move in all directions on the bottom portion of the screen. Fleas drop new lines of mushroom caps, the spider hunts about the bottom of the screen, and the scorpion turns mushroom caps poisonous. The player's goal is to shoot all centipede segments on the screen to advance to the next level. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Wiggle Worm

description:
Zero G is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship which can rotate 360 degrees, and accelerate. The player has 99 time units to pick up a space pod which appears randomly on the screen. If the player hits the outer wall, they bounce rapidly from the site of impact. Every time a space pod is picked up, a new pod appears randomly on the screen, the player scores points, and the 99 time units are restored. Every pod retrieved makes the ship bounce faster. The game is over when 5 pods are not retrieved within time.
title: Zero G

description:
Anti-Ballistic Missile Command is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small crosshair, and tries to shoot incoming missiles. The player has a limited number of shots per round, and must try to destroy the incoming missiles before they hit the ground.
title: Anti-Ballistic Missile Command

description:
Bleep is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small square, that must move to the same position as a highlighted square. Every time they do this, the highlighted square moves to a new position, and the player gains a point. The player has a total of 50 seconds.
title: Bleep

description:
Blak Jak is a 1 - 2 player graphical blackjack game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players or a computer opponent named Sheriff Rudey compete against the dealer in a game of blackjack. Players can hit, stay, double, split, or surrender depending on cards dealt. All cards are graphically displayed on the screen. The player starts with $5000, and each game costs $500.
title: Blak Jak

description:
Climb is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a character along a series of ladders and platforms, trying to collect the 3 parts of the word 'Fuel'. A series of monsters move about the platforms and ladders, that the player has to avoid. The player starts with 10 lives.
title: Climb

description:
Color Dot is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player and their human or computer opponent take turns placing lines on a 13 x 9 grid. Whenever a player inserts a line to complete a square, they gain 1 point, and the square is marked on the screen. Sometimes the computer skips a player's turn. The player with the most squares at the end of the game is the winner.
title: Color Dot

description:
Maximum is a 1 - 2 player strategy game for the TRS-CoCo.

Played on an 8 x 8 graph with a single open space, players take turns moving in one row or column to score points. When all points are taken, the player with the highest score wins.
title: Maximum

description:
The Realm of Nauga is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a lone adventurer now entering the kingdom of Volmar. You find a note reading, "To any who hear, I King Thomas II offer 1/4 of my kingdom for the return of my magic golden scepter". You go to the palace to speak with the King. He tells you the scepter is in Forest 3, 'The Realm of Nauga'. The King gives you a box containing two magic spells, and transports you to Forest 1.

The player explores 3 forests in real-time, and in each section tries to find the key to open a door to enter the next forest. Each forest is divided into 12 sections. In each level, the monsters become more aggressive, and the Nauga can be found in Forest 3. The forest contains trees and water, where trees can only be entered if the player possess a rope, and water can only be entered if the player possess a boat. The player can find swords, bows, healing, or magic as they explore.

The player can cast magic, which randomly either freezes the monsters, transports to a different section of the forest, or move to another spot in the same section. If the player takes too much damage, they are rescued by a friendly gnome, who may help heal the player.
title: The Realm of Nauga

description:
QBee is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to move QBee around the board, changing all blocks from blue to red. The player must avoid the scorpion which chases the player, and the ball which bounces from the top of the screen to the bottom. The scorpion can be defeated by standing below a yellow block when the scorpion is very near. The ball will change blocks back to blue. If all blocks are changed to red, the player moves to a more difficult level. The player starts with 4 QBees, and a new one is earned every 2 levels.
title: QBee

description:
Blockade is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a line on the screen which leaves a continually elongating tail. If either player runs into the tail or the edge of the screen, the other player gains a point. Players can move in 8 possible directions. The game tracks the score.
title: Blockade

description:
Space Ace is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically forwards. The player tries to shoot a number of alien vessels that move about randomly, and occasionally fire towards the player. When all opponents are destroyed, the player faces a new group of similar aliens.
title: Space Ace

description:
Utopian is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to help a small island country that starts with 1000 people to grow and prosper. The player's island is graphically displayed on the screen, and can place crops, housing developments, schools, hospitals, and factories. Each turn is timed, and the player can make as many purchases as possible during that turn. Housing developments give people a place to live, crops help feed the people, schools, hospitals, and factories improve the efficiency of the population.

Each turn, the player can try to gamble for money or points, check the weather forecast, check their money, score, and census.
title: Utopian

description:
Space Escape is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two weeks ago, a UFO landed in your front yard and took you captive. Since then, you have been examined, and measured, and experimented with. You are their specimen from Earth. However, it has been a day since they have prodded and poked you, You can't help but wonder, will you ever escape and return to Earth.

All command are via 2 word VERB NOUN entry, and the game understands about 10 verbs. There is no save or restore option. All directions are in nautical terms, and there is a help command that can be used 2 times per game.
title: Space Escape

description:
Aldaron is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The Evil Necromancer has stolen the only son of the King of the Elves. Young Aldaron lies in a charmed slumber in the depths of a black fortress designed specifically as his prison. There is no possibility of an elf rescuing him, but the King has determined that a mortal (with sufficient courage and intelligence) might succeed. You have been sent to a cavern far beneath the fortress. Your mission is to defeat to necromancer's traps and restore Aldaron to his rightful place. Aldaron must be brought back safely to the cavern beneath the fortress where the player starts.

The player must search through the many rooms and dangers of the Necromancer's castle to discover Alderon, break his magic sleeping spell, and defeat the Necromancer. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save or restore feature. A wandering witch causes complications, by moving the player's inventory around. There is a help command for assistance with the quest.

sample_screenshots.caption: Battered About in the Tower of Winds

title: Aldaron

description:
Dragon's Temple is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a small knight through a maze gathering treasure, and avoiding the dragon represented by an 'X'. Each treasure collected garnishes the player points, and partially refills their rapidly depleting time gauge. The player starts with 3 bombs, which can be used to destroy walls of the maze. Extra bombs can be picked up from treasure chests. If the player gets eaten by a dragon, or runs out of time, it's game over. The maze is randomized each game.
title: Dragon's Temple

description:
5 Player Poker is 1-player poker game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes against 4 computer opponents at poker. There is a single round of bets, follows by drawing up to 5 new cards, and another round of betting. Cards are graphically displayed on the screen.
title: 5 Player Poker

description:
Able Builders is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a construction worker on the bottom of the screen who tries to catch rivets dropped from the worker above. Every 10 rivets caught, the top worker moves 1 row higher up the screen. Every rivet missed caused the worker to lower 1 row. If the top worker falls too low, he crushers the player, and it's game over. There are 15 levels of difficulty, and the game progressively speeds up.
title: Able Builders

description:
Air Attack is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small plane that moves in all directions, and drops bombs and fires horizontally forwards simultaneously. The player must combat a number of enemies, including: UFOs, missiles, turrets, and radar installations. The player has limited refuel, and refills by bombing fuel silos. The player can lose 3 planes before game over.
title: Air Attack

description:
Baccarat is a 1-player versus computer card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player and computer are dealt 2 cards, and the goal is to score as close to 9 as possible. The player can accept an additional card, and can bet $1 - $999 each round. When the sum of cards is added, the final digit is counted. The computer wins in a tie. The game ends when the player goes bankrupt, or breaks the house after winning $10,000.
title: Baccarat

description:
Balloon Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a hot-air balloon up and down, while trying to hit tanks and soldiers by dropping bombs on them. The tanks and soldiers scroll continuously from the right. The player must avoid 2 cannons that attempt to track and hit the player. There are 10 levels of difficulty, and the player gets 3 tries each game.
title: Balloon Attack

description:
Balloon Fire is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player maneuvers a bow and a and arrow horizontally across the top of the screen, and tries to fire vertically downwards to hit balloon that float from the bottom. The player starts with 3 lives, and loses one for every balloon missed.
title: Balloon Fire

description:
BrikPong is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a vertically moving paddle, and try to bounce a ball towards their opponent. Behind each paddle are 6 rows of bricks. A brick is destroyed when struck by the ball. The first player to destroy all 6 rows of their opponent's bricks is the winner
title: BrikPong

description:
Caterpillar Cave is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Try to collect all the gold bars by moving a man through a series of vertical passageways. The player must avoid the caterpillar which moves randomly about. The player starts with 6 lives.
title: Caterpillar Cave

description:
Caviator is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to descend a small landing craft through a series of tight winding caverns. The player has unlimited fuel, and can accelerate or decelerate in any direction. The player gains points for how far they descend. If the player hits a wall, it's game over.
title: Caviator

description:
City is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a helicopter, which must protect the city at the bottom of the screen. The helicopter can move in all directions, and fire directly forwards. Invaders include blocks falling from the sky, and a giant foot that stomps on and destroys buildings. When all buildings are gone, it's game over.
title: City

description:
Coco-Terrestrial is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a little boy in search of your terrestrial friend. The player moves their small green dot around a series of areas, trying to gather the correct items to open a series of gates. If the player runs into any object, or touches items in the wrong order, they must restart their adventure.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Run into the Wrong Item

title: Coco-Terrestrial

description:
Cosmic Sweeper is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player controls a spacecraft to shoot down incoming asteroids. A map displays the location of incoming asteroids. A map in the top left shows the player's progression through an individual stage. The player can take a limited number of hits before their spacecraft is destroyed. The player's shields are restored every 10,000 points.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm About to Take a Hit

title: Cosmic Sweeper

description:
Dig is a 1-player arcade puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who moves in the cardinal directions underground, digging a tunnel behind him. Several boxes are located on the screen, which will fall towards the bottom if the ground beneath is removed. The player is equipped with a digging device, which removes squares of dirt vertically below them. Four monsters appear on the screen. They are initially immobile, but will chase the player if the ground near them is disturbed. The goal is to lure monsters into boxes, or drop boxes onto monsters, causing them to be destroyed. When all 4 monsters are destroyed, the player proceeds to the next puzzle. Money can be picked up for bonus points. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Dig

description:
Draw Poker is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each game, the player is dealt 5 cards, and can redraw up to 5 cards. The player starts with $25, and each game costs $1 to play. The player only receives winnings if their hand is a 3-of-a-kind or higher.
title: Draw Poker

description:
Draw Poker is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each game, the player is dealt 5 cards, and can redraw up to 5 cards. The player starts with $100, and can set an ante of $1 - 99 each game. There is a different payoff depending on the player's hand. The game ends when the player runs out of money or makes $10,000.
title: Draw Poker

description:
DropPack is a 1-player Tetris clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Different shaped blocks consisting of at least 4 squares scroll across the top of the screen. As pieces scroll, the player can rotate them, and when a piece is in the correct position, the player can send it to the bottom of the screen. If the player creates a complete line, that line will disappear. There are 10 levels of initial difficulty. If the player's blocks reach the top of the play field, it's game over.
title: DropPack

description:
Scrambled Eggs is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You play as a chicken farmer, whose job is to gather the eggs from their chickens in a basket, and bring them to the awaiting delivery truck. The player moves a small dot around the farm to accomplish these tasks. If the eggs are not collected in a timely fashion, they will drop and create a big mess which must be picked up with a shovel and taken to the trash pile. If eggs drop from the chute, the window to the coop will be jarred open, and the player must use a hammer to fix it. The player must also watch out for the chicken thief and the fox, who approach the chicken coop from the top right of the screen, and can be defeated with a club or rock salt respectively. These tools are located in the tool shed, and can only be used one at a time, and must be replaced before acquiring a new tool. There are 3 levels of difficulty. If the player loses too many eggs, it's game over.
title: Scrambled Eggs

description:
Escape! is a text adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are trapped three levels below the surface in a series of near identical looking underground passages. The goal is to map and explore the passages, gather items, and solve the puzzles to exit each level to reach the surface. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Get Killed by a Brute

title: Escape!

description:
Fire Runner is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who runs ceaselessly to the right along the bottom of the screen. Armed with only a shield, the player must maneuver this up or down to block incoming fireballs. He must also jump over fires on the floor to stay safe. The player has a temperature gauge, and if they encounter too much heat, it's game over.
title: Fire Runner

description:
Flight Simulator is a 1-player flight game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small aircraft from a 1st person perspective. The control panel displays bearing, altitude, fuel, thrust, airspeed, and vertical velocity. The player starts on the runway, takes off, flies as long as their fuel lasts, and then can land again. Landing occurs from an over-head perspective, and the plane is refueled on the runway.
title: Flight Simulator

description:
Flippy is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a circus seal an the bottom of the screen, who moves laterally and tries to catch balls dropped from a conveyor belt at the top of the screen. Two creatures at the edges of the screen place balls on the conveyor belt, which randomly fall. As the seal catches progressively more balls, they balance on the tip of his nose until they reach the top of the screen. When the player catches 6 balls, they move to the next level. If the player misses a ball, they can still flip the ball back up in the air with their flippers to try to catch it again, but if it hits the ground the ball is lost. If the player misses too many balls, it's game over.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Ball is Ready to Drop

title: Flippy

description:
Foot Race is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who runs towards the right of the screen, and attempts to jump over a number of obstacles as they approach. The player continuously speeds up, but will slow down if they hit an object. The goal is to complete the obstacle course in minimal time.
title: Foot Race

description:
Fortress of the Mutant Waffles is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a small character through a multi-screened maze to gather 9 bottles of maple syrup, and return them to the starting point. The player must avoid waffles, which bounce about on several screens. If the player is hit by a waffle, their energy decreases, and if it hits 0, it's game over. A timer counts how long it takes to finish the game.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Return to the Starting Area

title: Fortress of the Mutant Waffles

description:
Gem Search is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a small character through a multi-screened maze from a top-down perspective to gather 6 gems, and then take them to the exit point. A timer counts how long it takes to finish the game. The game tracks the player's current position.
title: Gem Search

description:
Gliblibs is a phrasal template word game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player submits a list of nouns, adjectives, numbers, and names, and the program creates a series of entertaining stories to read.
title: Gliblibs

description:
Global Thermonuclear War is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a 7 x 8 grid, where they place their defense and offensive systems, and players take turns launching nuclear missiles at their opponent until one side is destroyed. In the setup stage, each player places their buildings on their grid while their opponent is encouraged to leave the room.

Each player places a control base, satellites, missile bases, ABM bases, communication centers, and computer centers on their grid. A control base is used to coordinate missile and ABM launches, and it's game over if destroyed. Missile bases are used to launch warheads at the opponent, while ABM bases can be used to shoot down incoming missiles. Each missile and ABM base has a total of 9 missiles.

The satellite is used to spy on enemy territory, but will only function if there are working communication centers. Communication centers also help control ABM function.

During war, each player has the option to launch an offensive missile or a defensive ABM. Players input the coordinates of where they wish to fire, and play continues until 1 side loses their command center.
title: Global Thermonuclear War

description:
Nine Card Choice is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

At the beginning of each game, the player is asked to place a bet. The game uses the cards 2 - 10, and each turn the computer picks a number and a limit, while telling the player a different number and limit near the true value. The player then tries to draw cards until their total is within the limit, but does not go over the true number. If the player is successful, they double their bet.
title: Nine Card Choice

description:
Gun Fighter is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two gun fighters stand off against each other, and each have a total of 6 shots to try to hit each other. Numerous obstacles including cacti, rocks, and a moving chuckwagon provide protection from gunshot. The player can shoot shots at an angle to try to hit their opponent.
title: Gun Fighter

description:
Graphic Nine Card is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A re-released graphical version of Nine Card Choice. At the beginning of each game, the player is asked to place a bet. The game uses the cards 2 - 10, and each turn the computer picks a number and a limit, while telling the player a different number and limit near the true value. The player then tries to draw cards until their total is within the limit, but does not go over the true number. If the player is successful, they double their bet.
title: Graphic Nine Card

description:
Haunted House is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must explore a haunted house, and tries to solve the mysteries within. There are frequent instant death situation, and the player must contend with ghosts, poisonous snakes, ravenous dogs, and other dangers. All locations are graphically displayed on the screen, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Haunted House

description:
Hi-Lo & Craps are 2 casino games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In Hi-Lo, the player is shown 2 cards, and must guess if the next card will fall between the two displayed. Each turn, the player must bet between $1 to all their money. A win will double the bet, while a loss loses it all.

In Craps, there is an initial roll of 2 dice, and the player wins with a 7 or 11, and loses with a 2, 3, or 12. Otherwise, the number rolled becomes the point, and the player loses if the point is rolled, and wins with a 7.
title: Hi-Lo & Craps

description:
Jeopardy! is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player chooses from 5 questions of 5 different topics. Questions are worth $100 - 500, and answers must be manually typed in. A correct answer will reward the player the value of the question, while an incorrect answer will lose that amount. The player with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner. Players can make custom questions, and there are 3 games included.
title: Jeopardy!

description:
Jungle is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

During a storm, you fall off your yacht into a life raft which carries you to the shores of a small island. Overcome by the heat, you pass out. Upon awakening, you find you're in an exotic jungle, and must find the exit before a volcano erupts.

Each location is graphically displayed on the screen, and the player can move north, south, east, or west from each location. There are no items to collect, but the player can encounter a tiger, a witch doctor, and natives who throw garbage at the player.
title: Jungle

description:
Killer Mansion is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a detective in a large city. An insane man has recently robbed a bank, killing three people and running off with one million dollars. You suspect the criminal is hiding out in an old abandoned mansion. Your mission is to find the treasure and the money, while evading the criminal.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save restore feature. All items and available locations are displayed on the screen. Each room has multiple items that can be picked up, and there are several inventory items to solve.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Shovel in the Coal Room

title: Killer Mansion

description:
Kingpede is a 1-player Millipede clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move in all directions about the bottom quarter of the screen, and fires vertically forwards. The player moves through a field of mushrooms, and tries to destroy all the kingpedes which approach from the top of the screen. The kingpede moves laterally on the screen until it hits an obstruction, at which point is moves down 1 row and reversed direction. When a kingpede is shot, it breaks into smaller components. When all kingpede components are destroyed, the player moves to the next level. Other enemies include spiders which move randomly about the bottom of the screen, bees which descend from the top of the screen leaving new mushrooms, earwigs which make mushrooms poisonous, inchworms, and ladybugs.

The player starts with 3 lives, and there are 3 levels of game difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Bee and a Poisonous Mushroom Appear

title: Kingpede

description:
Labyrinth Master is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores a labyrinth from a 1st person perspective. As they explore, monsters randomly appear that the player can directly engage by exchanging blows. The player has a health and strength bar, where health represents hit points, and strength represents available endurance. If hit points reach 0, it's game over. Strength can be lost by attacking monsters or running into walls. Health and strength restores over time. The player can get stronger by destroying monsters and finding items. Enemies include skeletons, eyeballs, and minotaurs.
title: Labyrinth Master

description:
Lander is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship that moves in all directions, but will continuously fall toward the ground due to gravity effects. As levels progress, the platforms becomes progressively smaller, and there are more enemies to avoid. If the player misses the platform they are destroyed, and if the player hits too hard, they bounce wildly back up into the sky. The player starts with 5 ships.
title: Lander

description:
Liberty Ship is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player controls a spacecraft to shoot down incoming stars. A map displays the location of incoming asteroids. A map in the top left shows the player's force field. The player can take a limited number of hits before their spacecraft is destroyed. The player's shields are restored every 10,000 points.
title: Liberty Ship

description:
An implementation of Conway's Game of Life for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player implements the starting pattern by drawing it on the screen using the joystick.

  • Any live cell with fewer than 2 or more than 3 live neighbors dies.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbors lives on to the next generation.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbors becomes a live cell through reproduction.

The player can advance by single steps, or set the game to automatically advance through multiple generations.
title: Life

description:
Loopy is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player uses their joystick to rapidly move a line, in order to encircle a target. If the player accidentally hits the target, they lose a life. Falling targets must be encircled before they hit the bottom of the screen, or a life is lost. Every 5 targets circles, the player's line will shorten. The player strart with 3 lives.
title: Loopy

description:
Mazey is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates a small character through a maze trying to rescue four moths. When all 4 moths are collected, a new moth appears to show the exit of the level. The player can shoot in their movement direction, and the player has a limited amount of available shots. Every moth picked up increases available shots. The walls of the maze open and close, and the player may need to shoot away obstructions. Enemy ships appear in the center of the screen, and fire towards the player if given the chance. Enemy ship fire can also destroy walls. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Mazey

description:
Mini-Golf 3 is a 1-player mini-golf game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a top-down perspective, the players take turns hitting a ball on a small mini-golf hole.
title: Mini-Golf 3

description:
Montezumas Dungeons is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who must navigate a series of passageways to reach several chamber entrances. Enemies patrol the hallways, and the player loses a life if they touch one. The player has no ability to shoot in the passageways, and must avoid the enemies. After entering a room, the player moves to a separate screen containing smaller enemies and a treasure. Here, the player can fire upon all the enemies, and must quickly collect the treasure and exit the room. If the player takes too long, an unkillable monsters appears and rapidly follows the player. Back in the passageways, the player must try to navigate to the next chamber.
title: Montezumas Dungeons

description:
Mrs Pac is a 1 - 2 player Ms. Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Mrs. Pac, as she moves through a maze trying to gobble all the dots. She must avoid 4 ghosts, who move about randomly. There is a power pellet in each corner which temporarily makes ghosts vulnerable. The player starts with 3 lives, and moves to a more difficult level if all dots are gobbled.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level Two is a New Maze

title: Mrs Pac

description:
Munchman is a 1 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Munchman, as he moves through a maze trying to gobble all the dots. There are 4 ghosts, who move about randomly. Several power pellets temporarily makes ghosts vulnerable, and if eaten reappear in the corner of the game field. The player starts with 3 lives, and there is only 1 level.

sample_screenshots.caption: The Level Doesn't End when All Dots are Munched

title: Munchman

description:
Noids is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small tank that moves towards the top of the screen to fight their way through the Noids' defenses. The player can fire directly forwards, and must avoid firing guns, mines, and force-fields. Once the player has traveled through the battle zone, they must face the Noid. The player starts with 5 tanks.
title: Noids

description:
Nuclear Avenger is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small tank that moves laterally along the bottom of the screen. The tank can fire directly vertically, or at 2 separate angles to the left and right. Numerous bombers, fighters, and other planes stream in formation across the screen, and drop bombs towards the player. The player gets points for each enemy plane shot down. There are 9 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Nuclear Avenger

description:
Panzer is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a tank that moves vertically at the sides of the screen and fires towards their opponent on the opposite side. The goal is to shoot the enemy tank for points. Between the two tanks is a busy road, and points are awarded to the opposite player if vehicles are hit. The first player to reach 10,000 points is the winner.
title: Panzer

description:
Peg Jump is a 1-player peg solitaire game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

This version is played on a cross-shaped board with 33 pegs, with the single center peg always empty at the start of game. The aim of the game is to remove pegs from the board by moving neighboring pegs over them. Pegs are moved by typing movement coordinates.
title: Peg Jump

description:
Pyramid 3000 is a graphical text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores an Egyptian pyramid in the desert. As they dive deep into the pyramid, they must translate hieroglyphics, navigate darkened chambers, and solve other mysteries.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature. All items and available locations are displayed on the screen. Many rooms have multiple items that can be picked up, and there are several inventory puzzles to solve.
title: Pyramid 3000

description:
Rambo is a graphic adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Rambo explores the jungles of Vietnam to try to rescue his comrades from a Vietnamese prisoner of war camp. As the player explores the jungle, any wrong direction leaves them irrevocably lost in the jungle. There are numerous instant death scenarios, where the player must immediately use the correct item.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save or restore feature. All locations are graphically displayed on the screen.
title: Rambo

description:
Rat Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a large blue snake who patrols about a maze trying to gobble up rats. Opposing him is an orange snake, which moves randomly about the maze. The snake has an extended tail, and if the player runs into a dead end, their head appears out the tail end. If the player runs into the orange snake, they lose a life. A level is completed by gobbling up all snakes. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Rat Attack

description:
Red Dog is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes with 3 computer opponents. Each player starts with 5000 chips, and it costs 1000 chips to start each hand. Each turn, each player is dealt 5 cards. Each player can bet an additional 1 or more chips, if they think one of their cards will be the same suit as the next card to appear and 1 card will be higher than the card that is turned up. Otherwise, the player can copper that they do not have such a card. If the player guesses correctly, they double their bet.
title: Red Dog

description:
Robot Bomber is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

One player controls an alien saucer which can move in all directions, and drops bombs towards the 8 aliens sitting on the bottom of the screen. This first player tries to destroy at least 7 of the aliens without being hit by returning fire. The player controlling the robots has a small shield they can move laterally to block incoming fire in addition to a scanning rocket they can fire towards the saucer. If the saucer is hit, the ground player wins.
title: Robot Bomber

description:
Sand Rover is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small rover that travels along the screen to the left towards its destination displayed at the bottom of the screen. The rover can jump, move laterally, and fire vertically upwards, and must must safely avoid incoming asteroids and dangerous boulders. The player has 3 lives to reach their destination.
title: Sand Rover

description:
Scrabble is a 2-player unlicensed version of the board game of the same name.

Each player takes turns playing tiles on a board to spell words and earn points. Each word, except for the starting word, must build onto previously present letters. Different letters have different point scoring, and there are bonus point squares present on the board. Gameplay occurs until there are no letter tiles remaining. There is no computer opponent, and no built in dictionary.
title: Scrabble

description:
Smash is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two cars race in the opposite direction on a 5 lane circular track. The goal is to collect as many pellets as possible without coming in contact with the opponent vehicle. The opponent vehicle will always try to change lane towards the player, and can move one lane per opening. The player can change one or two lanes per opening, and must outmaneuver their opponent. Because shorter inside lanes take less time to traverse, the time between two vehicles passing remains variable. It's game over if the two vehicles connect.
title: Smash

description:
Snafus is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on an 8 x 19 board, each player tries to rapidly claim as many squares as possible by moving their flashing cursor around the board . Each square has a different point value, with high value squares congregating around the top and bottom. If a player hits the border, an obstacle, or a previously claimed square, then that round is over. The player who ends the round gets fewer points than their opponent. After 3 rounds, the player with the highest score is the winner. Gameplay can occur with or without obstacles, and there are 100 levels of game speed.
title: Snafus

description:
Solo Poker is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player places cards from a deck on a 5 x 5 grid. The player's score is calculated in the 5 rows and 5 columns. Different hands have different scores, and the goal is to reach at least 60 points from the 10 hands.
title: Solo Poker

description:
Space Raider is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player controls their space fighter and tries to shoot down enemy vessels. The player can look and fire out the front or rear of their vessel. Each zone, the player has limited fuel to destroy the enemy fighters, and more fuel is lose when hit by enemy fire. It's game over when all fuel is lost.
title: Space Raider

description:
Starwars is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to destroy a rapidly moving enemy star fighter by maneuvering it to the center of a crosshair and firing. There are a total of 50 ships, and each ship is either destroyed or escapes off the edge of the screen. There are 5 levels of difficulty.
title: Starwars

description:
Steps is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who moves laterally, and can climb up and down a staircase. The player tries to collect all the dots on each stage, while avoiding cascading bubbles and falling off the stairs. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Steps

description:
Styx is a 1-play Qix clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player guides a marker which must draw rectangles and other shapes in order to claim territory. Lines must be connected to previously present edges, and the player can't travel within claimed territory except along lines. Once a shape has been made, it will be colored in to show that this territory is claimed. While drawing the rectangles, the player needs to avoid a spinning series of colored lines that crawl the screen. If the player's line is struck by the spinning graphic, the player loses a life.
title: Styx

description:
Super Vaders is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship that moves vertically at the left side of the screen, and fires to the right. Alien ships move vertically until they reach the edge of the screen, and then advance one row to the left, and move in the opposite direction. Alien ships continuously fire towards the player. Four shields offer a place for the player to hide from enemy fire. The player can opt for guided bombs, diving invaders, exploding bombs, and guided missiles.
title: Super Vaders

description:
T&D Track is a 1 - 6 player horse racing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

There are 6 horses in each race, and each horse is rated by the odds which will change as bets come in. There are five different types of bets: win, place, show, perfecta, and trifecta. The odds table is updated at least every 4 seconds prior to the race. The player starts with $500, and the minimum bid is $2, except for the trifecta which is $3. After the bets are in, the players watch the horses race and collect their winnings.
title: T&D Track

description:
Tank is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a tank, which can rotate and fire in 8 possible directions, and can move in the 4 cardinal directions. The tanks must avoid and navigate around other obstacles, and try to destroy their enemy. Each player starts with 3 tanks.
title: Tank

description:
Tetra is a 1-player Tetris clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Seven different geometric shapes appear at the top of the screen. As they descend, the player can rotate and move them laterally to help them fit at the bottom of the play area. If the player completes an entire row, that row is removed and the player gains points. If the blocks reach the top of the play area, it's game over. There are 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Tetra

description:
Tunnel Racer is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small space ship which moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, and can accelerate or decelerate. A series of swerving tunnels approach the player from the top of the screen, and the player must safely navigate through these. The player starts with 3 lives, and if they hit a wall, they lose a life.
title: Tunnel Racer

description:
Turret is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player rotates their viewpoint to find and try to destroy German tanks. Enemy tanks must be hit just behind the turret to be destroyed. A radar screen shows the position of enemy tanks, and a fuel gauge shows how much movement the player has remaining. If the player takes a hit from an enemy tank, they are destroyed.
title: Turret

description:
Warp is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small vessel that can rotate 360 degrees, and can accelerate and fires directly forwards. The player attempts to shoot a series of spinning balls that bounce about the screen. While this is happening, a number of blocks begin to fill in the edges of the screen. The player gains points for shooting the spinning balls or the blocks that are filling in the screen. Starting with 69 health points, the player loses health if they bump into blocks or spinning balls. Gameplay continues until the player runs out of health.
title: Warp

description:
Weirdo is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates a small monsters on a playing field that contains 5 sets of 2 identical monsters. The character can move in all directions, but only shoots laterally. When the player shoots a monster, it is temporarily stunned, and if the other similar monster is quickly shot, both creatures are removed from the field. Otherwise, the monster reactivates. If the player hits a monster they lose a life. When all 10 monsters are destroyed, the player starts a newer level with faster monsters and slower stun times. The player starts with 5 characters, and it's game over if all are lost.
title: Weirdo

description:
Wizard Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You have fallen asleep, and are dreaming that you are in the magical Kingdom of Oz. Only the wizard can return you to Kansas where you live with your Aunt, Uncle, and local dog Toto. You must collect treasures and accomplish other tasks before the Wizard will let you wake up.

All commands are via VERN NOUN entry. There is no save and restore feature. All available directions are displayed on the screen.
title: Wizard Adventure

description:
World Conquest is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two generals battle to take controls of a board consisting of 20 countries. At the beginning of each game, each general places 30 companies of armed forced across the 20 countries. Each round, the generals receive a number of new companies to place on the board. Players can move their companies to attack adjacent nations, and there must be at least 1 unit on a country for a player to claim it. The first player to control the entire map is the winner.
title: World Conquest

description:
Yahtzee is a dice game for one to nine players.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and the player can reroll any or all of the dice twice more before selecting their scoring category. Scoring categories include the sum of all ones to sixes, 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used. The game tracks top high scores, and dice are graphically displayed on the screen.
title: Yahtzee

description:
Yahtzee 3 is a dice game for one to nine players.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and the player can reroll any or all of the dice twice more before selecting their scoring category. Scoring categories include the sum of all ones to sixes, 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used. The game tracks top high scores, and dice are graphically displayed on the top of the screen.
title: Yahtzee 3

description:
Zector Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You have just been pulled into the enemy ship by a tractor beam. You must find the ship's battle plans and somehow return them to the rebel fleet. You started equipped with only your blaster.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. Available directions are shown on the screen at all times. There is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Crew Member in the Bunk Room

title: Zector Adventure

description:
4 Mile Island Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The "impossible" has happened. The area has been devastated by a severe earthquake, and the nuclear reactor has been severely damaged. The plant has been deserted. Only you can save the area from a major disaster. Your goal is to achieve a cold shutdown of the reactor.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and available locations are shown on the screen. The player must gather the necessary tools and follow the correct procedure to shut down the reactor. There is a save/restore feature.
title: 4 Mile Island Adventure

description:
Crystal Revenge! is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls the turret of a planetary defense system as enemy craft move towards a planet. The goal is to line up a crosshair and shoot the enemy vessel. The player has 30 shots per wave, and there are 10 ships per wave. The player can set the difficulty by modifying the number of hits before their home planet is destroyed and the number of waves attacking.
title: Crystal Revenge!

description:
Espionage Island is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A submarine has dropped you off. Your mission is to locate a roll of top secret microfilm. You must then return to your drop point and shoot a flare to signal for pickup. The player must explore the island and solve its secrets

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is a save/restore feature. All available directions are displayed on the screen.
title: Espionage Island

description:
Stellar Search is a series of 4 science fiction themed games set as a continuing story.

The player takes on the role of captain of the U.S.S. Enterprise. The Federation has recently recovered a space probe of unknown origin. By careful study of the probe's trajectory, we have traced it back to the quadrant from which it was sent. Unfortunately, this quadrant has several black holes making it impossible to trace the proper sector of origin within the quadrant. Your goal is to make first contact with the alien race, and decide if they would make good members for the Federation.

In part 1, the player must explore a number of quadrants on a 12 x 8 board trying to find the hidden planet. Some squares are empty, some contain a black hole which drains the player's energy, and some have enemy Klingon vessels which the player must manage their shields, phasers, torpedoes and other weapons. The player can recharge at several star bases. After discovering the correct quadrant, the player must navigate a shuttle craft to the planet's surface.

In part 2, the aliens have taken the shuttle crew hostage. The player's job is to rescue them and try to arrange some type of agreement between the aliens and Federation. The player can fire phasers, try to beam down to the surface, communicate with the aliens, leave orbit, or arm engines. The player can speak with their bridge crew, and must defeat an incoming Klingon fleet to protect the planet.

In part 3, the player beams down to the alien planet's surface and must try to rescue the captured shuttle crew. Armed with their tricorder and phaser, the player enters a text adventure and must navigate through a 5 x 5 map. The player can examine items, check their inventory, use items, look at a their map, and take items.

Finally, in part 4, the game switches to a side-view arcade section. The player must level terrain by dropping bombs, so they can safely land on the planet's surface to rescue the Captain. If the shuttlecraft hits the land, they must restart. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Stellar Search

description:
Kingdom of Bashan is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must enter the Kingdom of Bashan, and discover the 10 hidden treasures while avoiding the numerous dangers of the Kingdom. The goal is to reach 200 points and return to the starting area.
title: Kingdom of Bashan

description:
Cyborg Wars is a 1-player arcade clone of Robotron 2084 for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts each level by teleporting into a field surrounded by multiple enemies that move rapidly towards the player. The player can move and fire in 8 separate directions, and tries to fight their way to the exit point on each level. The player tries to rescue the humans, and some enemies require multiple hits or are indestructible. If the player touches an enemy, they lose a life.
title: Cyborg Wars

description:
Nova Pinball is 1-player Pinball game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player gets 3 balls per game, and the machine has 2 flippers, 3 bumpers, and 4 kickers. The top 5 high scores are tracked.
title: Nova Pinball

description:
Armchair Admiral is a 2 - 8 player board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Similar to the board game Battleship, players start each game by placing 4 ships of increasing size: sloop, caravel, brigantine, galleon, on a 10 x 10 board. Each turn, the opponents take turns firing 3 shots at enemy positions, and receive a report on ships hit and destroyed. Ships can be moved forwards or backwards between turns, and there are aiming options available. The winner is the last player with a ship afloat.
title: Armchair Admiral

description:
Classic Solitaire is a series of card games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Contains graphic versions of the 1-player card games:* Canfield Solitaire

  • Klondike Solitaire
  • Pyramid Solitaire

There are 4 difficulty levels for each game.
title: Classic Solitaire

description:
Crazy 8's is a 2 - 4 player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player starts with 7 cards, with the goal to discard all cards. On each turn, the player can discard a card that is either the same suit or value as the exposed card. If not, they must pick up cards from the stock until it is empty or they can play. 8s are wild, and can be played at any time. The winning player receives points based upon the cards left in their opponent's hands.
title: Crazy 8's

description:
Duo Deck Solitaire is a series of 2 solitaire games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each game requires 2 decks of cards to play:* Sly Fox: 4 aces and 4 kings, 1 of each suit are removed from the double deck. 20 additional cards are placed in a 4 x 5 pile between them. The player tries to build up the ace foundation, while building down the king foundation. During the first phase, cards placed on either foundation are immediately filled from the stock. In the second phase, 20 cards are placed on the 4 x 5 pile in whichever positions the player chooses. The player then tries to place as many cards as they can in the 3rd phase, but spaces are not refilled. The second and third phases are repeated until there are no moves remaining or the foundations are filled.

  • Windmill: Gameplay starts with cards placed in the shape of a cross, with an ace in the center called the primary foundation. The 4 empty spaces between the arms of the cross are the secondary foundations. The arms of the cross represent 8 reserve positions. The primary foundation is played from ace up, while the secondary foundations are played from king downwards. Cards are played from the stock or the waste to try to complete the foundations. Gameplay ends when all foundations have been filled.
title: Duo Deck Solitaire

description:
Scrabble is a 2-player unlicensed version of the board game of the same name.

Each player takes turns playing tiles on a board to spell words and earn points. Each word, except for the starting word, must build onto previously present letters. Different letters have different point scoring, and there are bonus point squares present on the board. Each player holds onto 7 tiles at a time, and these are replaced as words are created. Gameplay occurs until there are no letter tiles remaining. There is computer opponent with 15 levels of difficulty and a built in dictionary.
title: Scrabble

description:
Plateau of the Past is a graphic adventure with the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player's goal is to follow a winding branching trail through dangerous jungle to safely reach civilization. At the beginning of each adventure, the player rolls for stamina, fate, and ability points. The player also gets to choose from 8 of 20 possible survival items to start their adventure. The player's movement is shown on a small map with a dotted line showing possible trails. At every intersection, the player must choose which direction to travel. A number of dangers appear as the player travels, and these can be avoided by specific items, or simply rolling for fate points. If the player rolls poorly, they can lose stamina or be instantly killed by the dangers of the jungle. Further, if stamina falls to 0 the player perishes. Fate and ability points can also be lost by actions. Certain encounters enter the player into combat, where the player and enemy take turns rolling for damage.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find a Secret in a Cave

title: Plateau of the Past

description:
Body Parts is a 1-player guessing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Entirely text based, the player thinks of a body part, and the computer tries to guess what it is by asking clues. As the player answers more questions and describes more body parts, the program becomes better at guessing.
title: Body Parts

description:
Guess the Animal is a 1-player guessing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Entirely text based, the player thinks of an animal, and the computer tries to guess what it is by asking clues. As the player answers more questions and describes more animals, the program becomes better at guessing.
title: Guess the Animal

description:
Ice Bird is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small penguin who moves in the cardinal directions within a maze of ice blocks. The penguin can kick blocks, causing them to crash into the next block. There are several immovable blocks in each maze. Blocks intermittently come alive and start moving about, and the penguin must try to crush these pieces between other ice blocks. If the player is hit by a moving block, they lose a life.
title: Ice Bird

description:
The Icon of Naliphae is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must enter the castle Deathspire and retrieve the holy relic The Icon of Naliphae.

There is no save or restore feature. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: The Icon of Naliphae

description:
Hot Slot is a casino gambling game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls an animated slot machine, and can play $1-5 each pull. The player can choose 3 levels of payout, and with or without jackpots.
title: HotSlot

description:
Sam Diamond, P.I.: Case of the Switch Blade Slasher is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Coastal City is being terrorized by the Switchblade Slasher. Ironically, the latest victim was a free lance photographer who had accepted an assignment to photograph the slasher for the Central City Tabloid Press.

Citizens are afraid to venture outside their dwellings for fear of becoming the next victim. The city is close to panic. Streets are nearly deserted and traffic sparse. Pressure is mounting on the police to solve the crimes, yes the police are baffled. Finally, in desperation, the civic leaders meet to discuss the problem. After lengthy and acrimonious debate, they decide to hire the world famous Sam Diamond, private investigator.

The player takes on the role of Sam Diamond, as he tries to solve the case. All commands are via text entry, and all locations are graphically displayed on the screen. There is a save and restore feature.
title: Sam Diamond, P.I.: Case of the Switch Blade Slasher

description:
Sky-Defense is a 1-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions, and fires horizontally forwards. The player's ship scrolls to the right, while enemy craft appear from the left and fire towards the player. The player gains points for each enemy ship hit. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Sky-Defense

description:
Guardian is a 1-player Defender clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions, and fires horizontally forwards. The screen scrolls horizontally to the left and right, and the player must stop alien vessels from kidnapping humans on the planet's surface. A small map on the top of the screen shows the location of alien vessels and humans. If all humans are abducted, it's game over.
title: Guardian

description:
The Enchanted Forest is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to rescue a captive princess. A graphical adventure that differs from other early adventures, in that all clues are graphically displayed on the screen. Rooms do not have text descriptions, and looking at objects only provides a picture of them. Available directions aren't displayed, but looking in a direction will provide a picture of what is available in that direction. There is no save/restore feature.
title: The Enchanted Forest

description:
Q-Man is a 1-player Q*bert clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to color all the blocks on a pyramid by moving their character between spaces. Each space landed on will change color. Enemies will turn blocks uncolored, and can chase Q-Man. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Q-Man

description:
Mr. Corey is a graphic adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

As a secret agent of ATHENA, you have been discovered and placed in a security cell with a ticking time bomb. Your job is to escape from the hi-tech underground detention center by disarming the bomb and stealing a parked jet. You must then fly to the island of the secretive Mr. Corey, infiltrate his base, capture Mr. Corey, and save the imprisoned Doctor Tyson.

All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and locations and directions are displayed on the screen. There is a save and restore feature.
title: Mr. Corey

description:
Tomb of T'ien is a graphical adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Set in the Far East, the player must seek out the Tomb of T'ien and recover the shrine that has been stolen by a dragon. The player must travel through the mountains, explore rice patties and the jungle to reach the shrine.

All command are via VERN NOUN entry, and all locations and directions are displayed on the screen. There is a save/restore feature available.
title: Tomb of T'ien

description:
Barbarian Quest is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Back in the days when the Kingdoms were young, in the land of Lynn, good king Brighton ruled with a kind hand. King Brighton had a fair and generous Queen, a beautiful daughter, Leonore, and a true friend, the good wizard Lothar.

Shannon, King of neighboring Arth, had proposed marriage of his son Griswold to Leonore. King Brighton politely declined. Humiliated, King Shannon called upon demons for revenge. They descended upon Lynn, killing King Brighton and possessing the wizard Lothar.

Lothar, once a kind man, turned into a cruel and heartless villain. He sought the crown and Leonore's marriage for himself, and when refused, stole her spirit, and hid it in both ordinary and magical containers. Leonore became zombie like, spending her days sitting her chamber, speaking to no one.

The Queen, in turn, promised her daughter's hand and the kingdom to whomever could retrieve Leonore's spirit. Many of the land's bravest soldiers have gone to their death, one by one. Finally, you, Hector, an uneducated street brawler, and on of a pig farmer, present yourself to the Queen. It is your turn to take up the quest.

The player controls Hector, who can move sideways, walk, run, jump short, jump long, climb up and down ladders, duck, punch, and stab with his sword. The player can can acquire objects, and must be careful, as Hector can only fall short distances. The player explores different scenes, where he does battle with the minions of Lothar, and tries to recover the 15 objects that contain fragments of Leonore's spirit. There are other evil objects which will injure the player. The player has limited lives, and can take only so many injuries before losing a life. If all lives are lost, the player can restart an area.

There are 4 levels: outside, in the castle, and 2 dungeons.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Defeat a Villain near a Skeleton

title: Barbarian Quest: The Rescue

description:
Gridiron Strategy is a 1 - 2 player American football game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player can control team names and the number of minutes per quarter. The field is seen from a top-down perspective. At the beginning of each game, players flip a coin to see who plays first. During each round, players select offensive and defensive plays, and the game automatically determines yards won or lost during the play. The ball's movement is graphically displayed on the screen.
title: Gridiron Strategy

description:
Wargame Designer is a 1 - 2 player strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player creates custom units and terrain tiles, and can set individual attributes for these tiles. Each individual tile has movement parameters, and the player can create custom maps. Each unit has unique attributes, including battle order and strength. The players can then combat in their customized terrain/map
title: Wargame Designer

description:
Revenge of the Germs is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You were taken to Christ County Hospital yesterday at night due to a car accident you were treated for the bump on your head and then quickly dozed off. The next morning, you awoke only to discover that the hospital had been abandoned by every doctor, nurse, and patient except yourself. The object is to save yourself from whatever the cause of evacuation might be.
