Unfortunately, this 'cause' has rearranged and hidden objects, broken equipment, and damaged furniture so that the simplest objectives are turned into the most difficult obstacles.

All locations are graphically displayed on the screen, and available directions are displayed. The player must solve a number of inventory based puzzles. Large germs approach the player, forcing the player to flee. There is a save and restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Revenge of the Germs

description:
Nibbler is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Nibbler, as he tries to eat all the dots in a maze. There are 3 ghosts which chase the player in the maze. There are 4 power pellets located in the 4 corners of the maze, which temporarily make the ghosts vulnerable to the player. If the player eats all pellets, they move to the next level.
title: Nibbler

description:
Vegas Gamepak is a 1 - 2 player series of gambling games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player can start with 1 - 10,000 chips. The computer starts with 50,000 chips. Contains 5 separate games:

  • Black Jack: The players draw cards trying to get closest to 21 without going over.
  • Craps: The player must roll the same total twice without getting a 7 or 11.
  • Keno: Choose 10 digits from 1 - 80. The computer randomly selects 20, and the player receives points based upon the number correct.
  • Slot Machine: The player gambles using a slot machine
  • Up N Down The River: The player draws 5 cards, and then goes through two rounds of 5 cards from the deck. The player loses money for matches in the first 5 cards, and gains for the last 5.
title: Vegas Gamepak

description:
Fyr-Draca is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a large vessel, which moves laterally on the screen and fires directly forwards. The ship is armed with a shield, that can be used for a short period each level, temporarily making the ship invulnerable. The player does battle with hordes of dragons who breath large fireballs towards the player. The goal each level is to destroy all eggs before they hatch into dragons, and then destroy the dragons that hatched. Every fifth level is a bonus stage, where the player tries to catch falling dragon eggs. The player starts with 3 lives, and there are small and large dragons.
title: Fyr-Draca

description:
Zone 6 is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are on a mission through the radioactive rubble of The Aftermath. Safety lies beyond the enemy in Zone 6. In the cockpit of the strike force Zyton-class tank, your hands clench the controls. Your plasma shield disintegrates all in your path.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player tries to destroy all alien ships with their laser. The player moves left and right to avoid hitting incoming buildings. Radar on the bottom of the screen shows the player's location and that of alien ships. The player is destroyed if they hit too many buildings and their shield falls to 0.
title: Zone 6

description:
Xygoid is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Your ship is being enshrouded by the Xygoid Web. Certain death is minutes away! You must blast the through the enveloping Web and destroy the Xygoid vessel before you are crushed.

The player controls a small vessel that moves laterally on the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically upwards. The player must avoid enemy fire while trying to blow a hole through the rotating enemy shields to hit the vessel above. As the lower level shields are depleted, they can be replaced, making it more difficult to hit the enemy vessel. On harder levels, more rotating shields appear. A timer on the bottom of the screen marks the time remaining until the player's ship is destroyed. The player starts with 3 ships.
title: Xygoid

description:
Komet Kaze is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The Asteroid Belt is crashing down on Earth. You are the first line of defense. You must destroy the blazing asteroids and the homing orbs with your disruptor.

The player controls a large spaceship that can move in all directions. The ship can fire only a short distance, but can fire straight forwards, or on a 45 degree angle to each side. The player tries to destroy incoming aliens, and must avoid or shoot down homing orbs that track towards the player. The player starts with 3 ships.
title: Komet Kaze

description:
Eno is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Your eccentric aunt has just died and left you her estate. She had millions. If you find it, it's yours. Your only clue: living room. The player explores the rooms within his aunt's house looking for the treasure.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. All available directions are displayed on the screen. There is no save or restore feature.
title: Eno

description:
Gray Lady is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a submarine that travels horizontally at the bottom of the ocean, and shoots torpedoes directly upwards. Boats travel across the surface of the water, and the player tries to destroy as many boats as possible before time runs out. On higher levels, the player must avoid mines.
title: Gray Lady

description:
Que Bit is a 1-player Q*Bert clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to color all the blocks on a pyramid by moving their character between spaces. Each space landed on will change color. Bouncing balls fall from above and snakes chase the player. Touching any of these costs the player a life. Teleporters can bring the player back to the top of the pyramid. When all blocks are colored, the player advances to the next level. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Que Bit

description:
Pyramix is a 1-player Q*Bert clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to color all the blocks on a pyramid by moving their character between spaces. Each space landed on will change color. Bouncing balls fall from above and snakes chase the player. Touching any of these costs the player a life. Small gremlins unselect blocks, and these can be removed by running into them. Higher levels have unsafe squares. Teleporters can bring the player back to the top of the pyramid. When all blocks are colored, the player advances to the next level. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Pyramix

description:
Candy Co. is a 1- 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who moves along a series of continuously moving platforms that cross the screen horizontally and vertically. The player tries to rescue the people caught on the platforms, while collecting shapes and avoiding monsters.
title: Candy Co.

description:
Colorpede is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a small shooter on the bottom few lines of the screen, and fires directly upwards. The player navigates a field of toadstools, and tries to shoot and destroy the colorpedes that approach from the top of the screen. Colorpedes move horizontally across the screen until they hit an obstacle, move down 1 row, and reverse direction. The player must contend with the bouncing bug that moves about the bottom of the screen, the beetle which falls from the top of the screen, and the stinger that travels across the screen creating poisoned mushrooms. The player starts with 3 shooters, and a new shooter is awarded every 10,000 points. The player proceeds to a more difficult stage when all colorpedes are destroyed.
title: Colorpede

description:
Robotack is a 2-player Robotron: 2084 clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move and fire in 8 separate directions. The player starts each level in the center of the screen, while numerous large robots move towards the player. The goal is to blast the robots, while trying to capture the humans. The player moves to the next level when all humans are rescued. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Robotack

description:
Willy's Warehouse is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Willy, who has to fill orders at a warehouse. Orders, represented by boxes numbered 1 - 4, come down the conveyor belt on the left and must be placed on the appropriate numbers on the belt on the right. The player moves horizontally on a platform, which moves up and down. The player must avoid enemy creatures, including: Kamakaze, Stretch, and Whirly Bug. Boxes can be dropped enemy creatures to defeat them. The player starts with 3 lives, and must complete a certain number of orders to advance to the next level.
title: Willy's Warehouse

description:
Mystic Mansion is a menu-drive graphic adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You start in the room of a mansion, which was was built by an evil man. You must find a way out of the mansion and off the surrounding island.

All locations are graphically displayed on the screen, and each screen displays 2 - 4 movements or actions. The player must avoid dangers including spider bites and falling to their death.
title: Mystic Mansion

description:
The Wizard's Tomb! is a 1 player text adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player creates a party of 1 - 4 named adventurers, and each player can choose 3 of 6 items to assist their quest: a suit of armor/sword/shield, a charm of protection, a chain maze, a week's food and water, a spell to repel attackers, and a small sack of gold. On the surface, the player moves north, south, east, or west to reach the dungeon entrance. The player can load up their map at any time. Upon reaching the dungeon, the player must navigate to the 10th level to collect the Wizard's treasure. If the player moves, they are attacked by random monsters. The player can choose to fight or cast a repel spell. Combat shows the monster and player move about randomly, and the player takes some damage from combat.

sample_screenshots.caption: Attacked by a Suit of Armor

title: The Wizard's Tomb!

description:
Return of the Jet-I is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the speeder chase scene from Star Wars: Episode VI, the player must race their speeder bike between large trees while firing upon enemy Stormtroopers. The character gains bonus points by picking up Ewoks. There are 15 levels of difficulty, and the player can take a limited number of hits before their speeder explodes.
title: Return of the Jet-I

description:
Track Events is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes in track events that include: 100-yard dash, long jump, javelin, hurdles, hammer throw, and high jump. During each event, the player must achieve a specific score or time to proceed to the next event. Each event is played from a side view, and events are played by rapidly pressing or moving the joystick.
title: Track Events

description:
3-D Tic-Tac-Toe is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players compete against the computer taking turns placing pieces on a 4 x 4 x 4 game board. The first person to score 4-in-a-row is the winner.
title: 3-D Tic-Tac-Toe

description:
Frog Trek is a 1 - 4 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a frog, that tries to navigate from the left side of the screen to the right. The player must cross a road and a river, while avoiding traffic, snakes, and maneuvering across floating objects in the river. There is limited time to reach many of the homes in the right.
title: Frog Trek

description:
Starfire is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship which can move in all directions, and fires horizontally. The screen scrolls horizontally in both directions, and the player must shoot alien vessels before they abduct humans from the bottom of the screen. The ship is armed with 3 bombs that can be dropped to destroy all enemies on the screen. A map at the top shows the location of all enemy vessels.
title: Starfire

description:
Caterpillar is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move in all directions at the bottom portion of the screen. The player fires directly forwards, and tries to destroy the caterpillars that stream from the top of the screen. Caterpillars move horizontally, and when they hit an obstacle, they reverse direction and move down 1 row. The player must avoid spiders that move about the bottom of the screen, and fleas that stream from the top of the screen. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Caterpillar

description:
Graphic Mars is a graphical upgrade of the early text adventure Mars

In Mars the player is stranded with their spaceship on the planet Mars. The player must recover the items required to fix the spaceship and create more fuel, in order to get off the planet again.

All commands are via text entry, and there is no SAVE RESTORE feature.
title: Graphic Mars

description:
Graphic Pyramid is a graphical update of the earlier text adventure Pyramid.

The player is an archaeologist who must explore an ancient Egyptian pyramid to gather 4 treasures: A sword, amulet, golden deathmask, and a jeweled dagger. They must avoid the dangers of the pyramid, and bring the items safely back to the starting point.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and all available directions are displayed. There is no save or restore feature.
title: Graphic Pyramid

description:
Jupiter Patrol is a 1-player Moon Patrol clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small rover, which drives along the bottom of the screen as dangers appear. The rover can move left and right, jump, and fire vertically and horizontally simultaneously. The player must jump over holes and mines, destroy incoming boulders that block the path, and shoot down alien saucers. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Jupiter Patrol

description:
Planet Raider is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small futuristic ship that moves vertically on the left of the screen, and fires to the right. Enemy installations and terrain scrolls from the right. The player tries to destroy enemy installations including artillery, vessels, and other buildings. The player gains bonus points for picking up friendly civilians. The player starts with 5 vessels. There are 3 levels of game difficulty.
title: Planet Raider

description:
Tube Frenzy is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo

The player moves a small character through a series of tubes trying to collect flashing dots positioned at the intersections. As dots are collected, they transform into angled barriers, which allow the dots to move in only 2 directions. Other barriers allow the player to move in only straight lines. Flashing enemy monsters prowl the maze. The player starts with 3 lives, and a life is lost if they run into a monster or run out of time to complete the level. There are 3 levels of timed difficulty and 9 levels of enemy difficulty.
title: Tube Frenzy

description:
Tutankam is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player explores King Tut's tomb on a mission to retrieve as many of the valuable treasures as they can find. The player can shoot in the cardinal directions to defeat enemies that spawn at a number of locations. The player must also find a key in each of the chambers in order to unlock the entrance to the next, more difficult chamber. Teleporter pads allow the player to rapidly move about the maze. A map of the level of the tomb is displayed at the top right of the screen. The tomb is guarded by dangerous cobras, bats, and scorpions, and will cost the player a life if they encounter them. The player starts with 3 lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Find a Key by a Teleporter
Lots of Enemies in the Corner

title: Tutankam

description:
Jungle Queen is a 1-player clone of Jungle Hunt.

The player must challenge 4 levels of jungle dangers to try to rescue their girlfriend in peril. There are 2 levels of difficulty. In the first stage, the player must swing between vines, carefully timing their jumps to grab the next vine before it swings away. Mistimed jumps lead to the player's demise. In the second stage, the player must swim under the water, dodging alligators, and regularly surfacing to take a breath of air. In the third stage, the player must jump over boulders while ascending a mountain, and in the final stage, the player must jump over spear wielding natives to save their girlfriend from being boiled in a cauldron.
title: Jungle Queen

description:
Grand Slam Bridge is a 1-player bridge game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes against computer opponents at bridge. The player is the dealer, and their partner bids standard American. Cards are graphically displayed on the screen. All moves are via keyboard commands
title: Grand Slam Bridge

description:
Amphibia is a 1-player Moon Patrol clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a moon buggy, that tries to reach their destination at Moon Base Amphibia. The buggy can move laterally and jump. There are a 3 levels with increasing difficulty, where the player must jump over boulders and avoid rockets on level 1. They must avoid craters and bombs on level 2, and avoid geysers on level 3. The distance to the next level is displayed at the bottom of the screen. The player starts with 4 buggies, and loses one if they hit any obstacle.
title: Amphibia

description:
The Arconiax Assignment is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are an employee of an international policing organization tasked with recovering the stolen Arconiax diamond. You are sent to the home of one of leaders of the criminal organization responsible for stealing the diamond to look for clues. While there, you are kidnapped, and send to a Victorian mansion where you await their orders. Attempting to escape is punishable by death. Your goal is to locate the diamond, avoid the dangers, and escape from the mansion.

The game came with a special scratch and sniff pad, that would alert the player to the name of key items that could otherwise not be discovered.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save and restore feature, and all available items and locations are displayed on the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Every Text Adventure has a Crowbar or a Shovel

title: The Arconiax Assignment

description:
CoCo-III Solitaire is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

This is a version of the classic Klondike Solitaire, a game of patience played with a standard deck of fifty-two playing cards. All commands are via keyboard entry.
title: CoCo-III Solitaire

description:
CoCo-Q is a peg solitaire game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to clear pegs from a 33-hole peg board. Each turn, the player can jump a peg into an empty space. The goal is to clear all pegs with 1 remaining. There are 5 demo games and a teaching mode.
title: CoCo-Q

description:
Color Computer Championship Golf is a 1 - 5 player golf game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each hole and ball position is graphically displayed on the screen. The player must select the club they wish to use, and choose from 8 possible directions to hit the ball. The player then receives a report on the distance and position of their stroke. The ball itself is not animated. After landing on the green, the computer automatically calculates the number of strokes required to finish the hole. The computer tracks the score over 18 holes.
title: Color Computer Championship Golf

description:
CoCo Minature Golf is a 1-player mini-golf game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player challenges 18 holes of mini-golf. The player selects the direction they wish to hit the ball, and a power bar on the left side of the screen chooses the power of the shot. The goal is to sink a shot in as few strokes as possible. There are 2 difficulty levels: beginner and expert. Beginner adds 1 to par for each hole.
title: CoCo Minature Golf

description:
The CoCo Zone is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are seated in a dingy courtroom enduring heat so stifling that not even the flies have bothered to drop in. You have been tried for theft of the priceless African Jewel, for which you know you are innocent. The judge winks at an overconfident district attorney as he pronounces sentence. A sentence that he nor you fully comprehend. One whose limits are the barriers of the imagination. For you have just crossed over into The CoCo Zone.

As you wake up in your cell, you find a note that your cell has been left unlocked by a friendly guard, and that you must try to escape by faking your death. The player must navigate a series of passageways, find items, and avoid dangers to escape their imprisonment.

As the player explores the hallways, they can look in all 4 directions, and can move in the displayed directions. Hallways are shown by wireframe, and there are several specially displayed graphical rooms. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature. Available directions are displayed.
title: The CoCo Zone

description:
Color Blackjack is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes against the computer at blackjack. The goal is to pick cards, with the goal getting closer to 21 than the computer opponent.
title: Color Blackjack

description:
Color Poker is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with 40 dollars, and can bet 1 - 8 dollars per game. The player starts with 5 cards, and has a single opportunity to discard cards. The player is awarded earnings based upon their hand.
title: Color Poker

description:
The Controllers is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

While scavenging a west coast city which will be destroyed by your masters, the Controllers. You find an odd looking shuttle large enough to hold only one person. Climbing in, the door accidentally shuts behind you. You become dizzy as your vision greys. Minutes later, your senses return. It is clear now that the Controllers are able to manipulate the human will. Somehow the shuttle must shield you from this. You cannot leave the shuttle! Are there others who know what you do? There things you must find out and if any way possible destroy the Controllers.

Played from within the capsule, all commands and directions are graphically displayed on the right of the screen. The player has limited fuel and battery power. Fuel is used for movement, and can be found during exploration. The shuttle also has a power supply, which is used to control the ship's flashlights. Gas, power, and other items can be found during exploration. The player can pick up and drop items, and there is a map of visited locations. There is also a save/restore feature.
title: The Controllers

description:
Escape From Tut's Tomb is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You were warned, but you did you listen? No. And now you're lost in this musty tomb, fighting for your life against smelly, stupid horror movie rejects.

The player guides an adventurer through a series of passageways, collecting treasures and avoiding dangers, including: bats, serpents, spiders, dragon heads, and curses. On each level, there are spawn points, where an endless series of these monsters stream forth. The player can move in the cardinal directions, but can only fire horizontally. Monsters can also be safely bounced off the player's helmet. There are a total of 15 rooms to navigate, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Escape From Tut's Tomb

description:
F-15 Ground Assault Simulator is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 3rd-person perspective from behind the jet, the player controls a small fighter jet which can move in all directions, and tries to shoot incoming enemy vehicles. Enemy vessels intermittently fire back at the player, and can destroy their vehicle. The player has limited fuel to destroy as many enemies as possible. If the player is hit, it's game over. The player can control the speed of their vehicle, and this increases fuel use, but does not allow the player to closer approach the enemies
title: F-15 Ground Assault Simulator

description:
Galactic Conquest is a turn-based multiplayer strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played via BBS, multiple players compete in galactic exploration and conquest. Each player starts at a randomized position in a large user-defined map. The goal is to explore sectors and colonize planets. Some sectors contain trading posts, which allow the player to purchase flagships, fighters, base kits, and scanners. Base kits allow the player to establish new bases, which generate credits each turn. Fighters can be used to protect bases, and scanners allow the investigation of adjacent sectors. The player warps to different sectors to establish bases. If the player encounters a sector with another player's base, they can declare war and attempt to conquer the base with fighters. Each player has a limited number of moves per turn.
title: Galactic Conquest

description:
Inter-Planetary Trash Collector! is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to navigate a super-charged garbage scow through an asteroid field to collect space trash. The player's ship leaves a constantly elongating tail, and never stops moving. If the player strikes an asteroid or their own tail, it's game over. There are 50 levels of difficulty, and when the player completes a level, they move to a harder challenge.
title: Inter-Planetary Trash Collector!

description:
Jetpack Challenge is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character with a jetpack, and tries to navigate through a maze. The player can move laterally and accelerate vertically, while gravity brings them down. If the player hits a wall, it's game over. There are 4 mazes, and the player is rewarded based upon the time to complete the maze.
title: Jetpack Challenge

description:
Joker Poker is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes in five card draw poker, and cards are graphically displayed on the screen. In each hand, the player is dealt 5 cards, and has a single opportunity to discard and draw new cards. The player can bet $1 - 10 each hand. Cash reward is based upon the score of the hand.
title: Joker Poker

description:
The Second Rainbow Book of Adventures is a series of BASIC text adventures for the TRS-80 CoCo.

  • African transference: Watch out for cannibals
  • Castle of Naurios: Capture the sword and end the oppression
  • Chief Inspector: Who killed B.L. Brown?
  • Curse of Karos: Save Barreltown from the curse
  • Dark Castle: Find the diamond that protects the kingdom
  • Hero of Lonesome Valley: Tom pursues knighthood and riches
  • Ice Princess: She will steal your heart
  • Island: A test for survivalists
  • Lunar Escape: Private space travel proves hazardous
  • Pappy's Gold: What happened to Pappy and Sara's Mine?
  • Ring Quest: He who holds the ring has the power
  • Robert's Adventure: Buying a house can be hazardous for your health
  • Scavenge: An old-fashioned treasure hunt
  • Secret Agent Man: No trip to Rio until the case if solved
  • Silverton House: Where is the money stashed?
  • Sir Randolf Returns: But our hero runs into an evil sorceress
  • Stowaway: In search of Sinanthropus Pekinensis
  • The Crypt of Flodnar: It's time to seek your fortune
  • The Riddle of Randomar: Getting away for the weekend
  • The Wands of Raga Dune: There is life on Vogguk
  • Thief of Dirloc: It's up to you to restore your family's good name
  • Time Tripper: Lost in another dimension of time
  • World War III: Only you can you prevent the inevitable
  • Yellow Submarine: Of Pepperland and the Blue Meanies

It also includes 3 bonus programs on tape:

  • Caves of Kalakh: Caves on family farm contain evil and riches
  • Castle Thuudo: Overthrow Thuudo to end a reign of terror
  • Halls of Dungeon Death: Capture the crown and save the kingdom
title: The Second Rainbow Book of Adventures

description:
The Little Runner is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a smurf-like character that runs through the forest at a set speed, and the player must time jumps to clear small logs. On easy mode, the player can hit 10 logs, and on hard mode only 1 before game over.
title: The Little Runner

description:
Squares is a 1-player sliding block puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a large 16 x 11 board populated by 8 different board pieces, the player must use the single empty space to slide blocks. The goal is to create a 16 block row of the same type in as few turns as possible.
title: Squares

description:
Monkey Shines is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move horizontally at the bottom of the screen. A monkey moves laterally at the top of the screen and drops coconuts. The monkey starts with 10 coconuts, and the player can then throw back as many as they catch. The monkey then returns caught coconuts, and the game continues until there are no coconuts remaining.
title: Monkey Shines

description:
Lunar Lander is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

As remote pilot, it is your job to land the unmanned cargo ship at the designated landing site. For each successful landing you will be paid according to the landing site and the cargo class. You will also be given a bonus for conserved fuel. Every 5th landing will be promoted to a higher cargo class with higher fuel consumption.

The player's cargo ship can be rotated 90 degrees left and right, and can apply thrust. This can be used to slow the ship and land carefully at the designated site. The player has limited fuel, and it's game over if they leave the play field, crash into the ground, run out of fuel, or leave the planet.
title: Lunar Lander

description:
Lurkley Manor is a graphical text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It's Halloween. You're locked in Lurkley Manor with an assortment of bizarre people and other unearthly things. The front door is locked, and the player must safely navigate to the attic of the building to escape. In each location, the player can move north, south, east, or west depending upon available locations. If the player moves in an unsafe direction, they can lose their life. Several locations have yes/no prompts to pick up items or interact with the location.

sample_screenshots.caption: Do I Have Something to Drink

title: Lurkley Manor

description:
Match Game of Opposites is a 2-player tile matching game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players compete on a 4 x 4 board trying to match tiles that contain opposite pictures or ideas. The player who matches the most tiles is the winner.
title: Match Game of Opposites

description:
Megatank is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a tank that move laterally at the bottom of the screen, and fires vertically upwards. Enemy vehicles approach from the top of the screen, and the player has to shoot them before they reach the bottom of the screen. Every 10 enemies, the game changes to a new faster moving enemy vehicle. Every enemy that reaches the bottom of the screen, or every 5 missed shots, the player loses a tank. The player starts with 5 tanks, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Megatank

description:
Nuclear Reactor Simulator is a 1-player simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must control a nuclear reactor, and try to prevent it from melting down. Random negative events occur, forcing the player to maintain a steady state at the reactor. The player is given specific objectives, including maintaining a specific power output, loop temperature, primary loop pressure, and pressurizer water level. The player must modify the control rods, and can control the pumps, valves, and the pressure in the water heater.
title: Nuclear Reactor Simulator

description:
Para-Jumper is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to jump out of an airplane and land on the landing pad at the bottom of the screen. A small plane flies across the top of the screen, and the player must jump out, and avoid lightning bolts, cliffs, toxic waste clouds, and mining lasers. The player can move left and right, and speed up their descent, as they only have a limited time to reach their landing pad.
title: Para-Jumper

description:
Penguin is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a penguin in a field of ice blocks, and tries to avoid and crush the attacking Coneheads. If a block is pushed into another block, it is destroyed. A block pushed into a free space will travel until it hits the edge of the screen or another block. Coneheads can be destroyed by pushing blocks into them. The player challenges a number of progressively more difficult levels.
title: Penguin

description:
Penguin Icarus is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to help a young penguin earn its wings by navigating through 3 arcade challenges. The small penguin can move laterally and jump. The player starts with 5 lives, and each level is timed. Running out of time is an immediate game over. On the first level, the player must climb ladders and jump between platforms while avoiding falling ice blocks. On the second level, the player must climb ladders and navigate elevators while avoiding lighting bolts from clouds. On the third level, the player must jump between small platforms while avoiding lighting bolts from the sky.

sample_screenshots.caption: A Lightning Bolt from the Sky

title: Penguin Icarus

description:
Prospector is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores a series of platforms and ladders, trying to collect all the gold located on each level. When all gold is collected, a teleporter to the next level appears. The player can move laterally, jump, and climb ladders. The player must avoid enemies, including: Snarfs, which move laterally at random, Ratty, which can climb ladders and chase the player, Igor, who can climb ladders and jump chasms, and the Grof, which hops and lays eggs. Container of stun gas can temporarily stop enemies from moving. The player loses a life if they touch an enemy or fall off a platform. There are a total of 50 levels, and the player can set practice mode that controls enemy movement speed and intelligence.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 2 has Enemies that can Climb Ladders

title: Prospector

description:
Rescue on Alpha II is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You have just received a new assignment from the bureau chief of the Galactic Secret Service. It seems some character named Zarkon, one of the last of the group of cosmic wizards, is masterminding a new threat to the security and peace of the galaxy. Zarkon has captured famed Professor Ion Smartguy, and is holding him on a small planetoid known as Alpha II, where he is being forced to breed an army of mutated, killer beasts.

Your mission is to gain entrance to Zarkon's stronghold, avoid the dangers within the fortress, defeat the evil wizard, overload the nuclear reactor, and then steal a spacecraft and escape before it explodes.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and locations are graphically displayed on the screen. Available directions are displayed on the screen.
title: Rescue on Alpha II

description:
Run For Your Life is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You were in a spaceship traveling to your home planet. The ship sustained heavy damage due to a meteor shower. You were ejected from your ship in a space pod 20 miles from a small military base. You must walk to that base if you are to survive.

The player controls a spaceman who attempts to run through multiple rooms to the right. Dangers include pits, spikes, spider webs, and water. All of these instantly cause death, except for the pits which move the player to a lower level. The player's oxygen continually declines, limiting available time to reach the base.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Fall to a Lower Level

title: Run for Your Life

description:
Scepter of Kzirgla is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to descend through 13 levels of dungeons to retrieve the Scepter of Kzirgla. The player can choose to be a warrior or magician, and 30 stat points are assigned between strength and hit power. Hit power is equivalent to hit points, while strength is the character's overall effectiveness.

Each level of the map is displayed as a series of walls and special locations. The player enters each level on the left, and tries to reach a staircase down on the right. Walls block movement, but can be attacked and destroyed. Special events can include treasure chests, trap doors to lower levels, and poisonous gas which weakens the player. The player can also find flying carpets which allow rapid movement through a level. Monsters randomly appear and attack the player, and the player selects a direction to attack and a weapon. Weapons can break during combat. Monsters drop items, and the player gains hit power and strength with each enemy defeated and level completed. There are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Scepter of Kzirgla

description:
Sea War is a 1-player game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You command a shore battery which has been ordered to sing an enemy fleet in a foggy cove in front of you. You can't see the ships right away, but as soon as you hit one the location and type of ship will be known because the explosion will highly illuminate the immediate area. The playing field is 10 x 10, and the player has 60 shots to try to sink the 5 enemy vessels.
title: Sea War

description:
Stockticker 88 is a 1 - 4 player stock market trading game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players take turns buying and selling stocks, bonds, wheat, oil, metals, and other resources. At the beginning of each game, the players choose how many rolls to play, where each roll represents a small change in value of a single item either up or down. All items start at $1.00 a piece. Item price movement up and down are graphically displayed on the screen. Each player starts with $10,000, and the player with the most money at the end of the game is the winner.
title: Stockticker 88

description:
The Trip is an adventure game with arcade elements for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You need to free your friend Joe, a prisoner of evil forces. The player is represented by a flashing square that is moved about on the screen to interact with different items and locations. The player starts outside a house and garage, with the goal of acquiring a vehicle. After entering the vehicle, the player travels along a road from a 1st person perspective, where 1 of 10 side roads appear. The player can enter these side roads to enter mini games or other locations including stores and missile ranges. If the mini-games are successfully completed, the player can acquire items. If the player makes a mistake, they die. The goal is to locate Joe, and acquire enough gold and special items to purchase his freedom.
title: The Trip

description:
Vicious Vic is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is placed onto a field surrounded by electric fences with a number of enemies called Vicious Vics. Each turn, the player can move in 8 directions, and the Vicious Vics always move directly towards the player. The field contains vats of acid and more electric fences. Each Vic is destroyed if it runs into a fence, a vat, or another Vic. A fence is removed if a Vic hits it, but the vats can destroy multiple Vics. Each more difficult level starts with more Vics.
title: Vicious Vic

description:
Zonx is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. The player encounters Zonxes and Zugs, that rapidly approach from the top of the screen. Zonxes are harmless, and the player gains points by running into them. Zugs are deadly, and it's game over if the player hits one. The player first encounters a wave of Zonxes, followed by a wave of Zugs, followed by a mixed wave. After surviving 3 waves, the player enters a more difficult 3 waves.
title: Zonx

description:
Bugs-II is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

While out on a deep space exploration mission beyond the orbit of Mars, the ship and its crew become frozen in time for over 500 years. Upon returning to Earth, the crew finds that the planet has suffered a devastating nuclear war, and is now ruled by giant intelligent bugs. The crew makes ready a "land bug", an armored vehicle designed to descend into the dangerous bug infested maze that hosts their reactor. Victory is achieved with destruction of their reactor.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player's bug can move in the 4 cardinal directions, and fire directly forwards. Endless streams of bugs flow out of bug creator rooms. The player can enter object rooms, and can acquire a single key or missiles. Missiles can be used to destroy barriers, while keys can unlock specific doors. Transport rooms move the player to a different location in the maze.

There are 4 levels of difficulty, and the player starts with 5 lives. There are a total of 6 levels, and upon reaching a new level, the player can restart at that level.
title: Bugs-II

description:
Galactic fighter is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Earth has been invaded by aliens from the planet Dracoz. The aliens were forced to do so because of a shortage of agricultural land, and a case of over population. Fusion bombs were used to destroy most of the planet. Cities were obliterated to make room for fields. , and the human survivors were placed in special prisons.

Earth's only remaining hope is a secret defense base hidden in some hills. The people working at the base have developed the ultimate space craft, one which is capable of flying in a planet's atmosphere as well as the vacuum of space. You have been assigned to be the pilot of this craft. Your mission is to bring a device capable of saving Earth to Dracoz.

The player controls a large ship on the right side of the screen, which can move vertically and fire to the left. The player contends with asteroids, meteors, missiles, alien fighters, and alien transporters. Special events such as alien invasions, missile strikes, and meteor showers occur, which change the composition of the dangers. The player progresses through stages with more enemies, and there are 3 levels of difficulty.

Every 25,000 points, the player enters the laser trench, where the perspective changes to behind the craft. The player must navigate the trench while avoiding or destroying enemies. If they can survive 60 seconds, they are awarded an additional ship. The player starts with 5 ships.
title: Galactic Fighter

description:
Possum Run is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a possum, who can move laterally and switch to 3 different lanes on a highway. Vehicles approach from the left and the right, and the player must avoid being run over by vehicles. There are 20 levels of difficulty, and if the player can survive until the timer runs out, they move to a more difficult challenge. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Possum Run

description:
Cavehunt is a 1-player text-based strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player travels through an underground cave trying to defeat all the enemies within. Each turn, the player can move north, south, east, or west within the dungeon. The player can pick up weapons, and can only hold 2 weapons at a time. If they pick up an extra weapon, they must drop one. The player encounters enemies, and must use a specific weapon to defeat them. If the player uses the wrong weapon, they are defeated. The goal is to defeat as many enemies as possible.
title: Cavehunt

description:
Desert Patrol is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a jeep as it cruises through the desert. The vehicle fires directly forwards and upwards, and can move laterally and jump. Dangers approach from the sky, and the player must shoot rocks and jump over holes that approach from the front. Fuel must be picked up without being shot.
title: Desert Patrol

description:
Foodwar is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a man who can move in all directions, and has to avoid chefs that arise from holes in the ground. The chefs throw different food at the player, and chase them about the screen. The player can pick up food to throw back at the chefs, and can also try to lead the chefs to fall back into the holes. The player starts with 5 lives. There are 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Foodwar

description:
Wacky Food is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a set of teeth that can move and fire in any direction. Different types of junk food move randomly about the screen. If the player shoots a piece of food it becomes temporarily immobile, and if the player then shoots another similar piece of food before the first one moves again, both are eaten. When all food on the screen is eaten, the player moves to the next challenge. The player starts with 10 hits, but multiple hits can be lost with a single food encounter. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Wacky Food

description:
Legend Quest is a 1-player fantasy themed arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores a large outdoor area, while trying to collect rainbows for points. The player has a total of 99 time units to try to maximize rainbow collection. Coins provide additional time. The player has a map, that allows them to view all the screens they have previously explored. Dangers include: bats, pits, tree monsters, fire monsters, skeletons, and more. The player has limited health, which is reduced with every injury. The game is over when all health is lost or time runs out. The player receives a bonus for screens explored and remaining health or time at the end of the game.
title: Legend Quest

description:
3D-Ghostmania is a 1 - 2 player maze game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player explores a large maze containing 30 ghosts. The player can review a map at any time. There are several blue squares which make the player invulnerable to ghosts. The ghosts do not move until they see the player, and then begin to chase. The player must run to a blue square, and gains points based upon how far they managed to lead the ghost. If the ghost catches the player before reaching a blue square, the player gains a negative encounter. Nine negative encounters, and it's game over. Each blue square can only be used to defeat 3 ghosts. There are 3 difficulty levels and 10 levels of ghost speed, and maze design is randomized each game.
title: 3D-Ghostmania

description:
The Third Rainbow Book of Adventures is a series of BASIC text adventures for the TRS-80 CoCo.

  • Aandark: Dangerous territory awaits on the new planet
  • Adventure of Cleopatra's Pyramid, The: Peril on the banks of the treacherous Nile
  • Adventures of Johnny Zero, The: The genetic android defeats evil in 2091
  • Amulet, The: The mystical stones grant a long life
  • Actor's Nightmare, An: Backstage at the London Theatre
  • Balm: Soothing revenge as you become the Adventure
  • Escape: Keep a cool head for a mind-twisting challenge
  • Escape of Embroilment, The: Don't go in without the Super Ammo Ghostblaster
  • Evil Crypt: Bottomless pits, graves that kill, and flesh-frying fires
  • Ghost Town: There's gold in them that hills!
  • Iconia: Attempt a daring space rescue
  • Professional, The: Hot on the trail of international jewel thieves
  • Spymaster: Agent 27 diverts international catastrophe
  • Sword and the Sorcerer, The: Preserve the people of Ling Shai from enslavement
  • Time Machine, The: Time is of the essence to save the universe
  • Time Travelers: Gather treasures of the ages with Dr. Temptus' machine
title: The Third Rainbow Book of Adventures

description:
A Day at the Races is a multiplayer gambling game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The players are given a list of 7 horses, their odds to win, and comments about the horses' performance. The players choose a horse, and whether they'll win, place, or show. The player then watches an animated horse race, and gains or looses money based upon their performance.
title: A Day at the Races

description:
Advanced Star Trench Warfare is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player pilots their spaceship through a trench, trying to target enemy vessels with a crosshair as they appear. The player has limited fuel, which is used up with every shot. If enemy vessels are not destroyed quickly enough, they can damage the player's vessel. It's game over when all fuel is used or the player is shot.
title: Advanced Star Trench Warfare

description:
Air Traffic Control Simulator is a 1-player air traffic controller simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Utilizing a radar display, the player tries to safely navigate a number of airplanes to safely land at a runway positioned in the center of the screen. A close up view of the position of planes on the runway is provided. Temperature, wind, precipitation, and visibility information is shown. The player gives commands to planes including altitude, heading, and speed, and tries to ensure all vessels safely land. There are 3 levels of air traffic difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Not Many Planes on Light Traffic
It Quickly Gets Hectic on Heavy Traffic

title: Air Traffic Control Simulator

description:
The Second Rainbow Book of Simulations is a book and accompanying cassette tape containing 16 BASIC programs for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Published by the people at Rainbow Magazine, the magazine solicited submissions of new simulation programs for the TRS-80 CoCo written in BASIC, and published the best ones in this compilation. The book contains program descriptions and code listings, while the tape can be used to directly load the games onto a TRS-80 Color Computer.

Contains the following:

  • 18-Wheeler: Put the load on the road and the pedal to the metal
  • Bomb Squad: Explosive action as leader of the Rainbow City Bomb Squad
  • Bush Pilot: Danger above the canopy of the dense African jungle
  • CoCo's Bowling Alley: Monday night fun at the local lanes
  • Flight to Mars: At the controls of man's first visit to the Red Planet
  • Ghostgetters: Who ya gonna call? Who else...
  • Lifestyle: An ambitious simulation of life itself
  • Master Train Dispatcher: The pressure is intense to keep the trains running on time
  • Nereid Countdown: Broad skills are needed to get the massive Ezekial into orbit
  • Olympic Boxing: World class amateur action in the ring
  • Olympic Decathlon: Fighting to qualify in 10 grueling events
  • Pro Wrestling: It's no time outs, no substitutions, and absolutely no holds barred
  • Project Theta: Alone in your fighter, you stand before Zygor's invasion fleet
  • Refunder's Delight: Coupon clipping for savings at the checkout counter
  • Stock Market: Failure or fortune in the world of high finance
  • Vacation U.S.A.: On the trail of adventure through the American heartland
title: The Second Rainbow Book of Simulations

description:
A Warlocks Revenge is a roleplaying game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It has always been the duty of the Warlock to protect dragons. But recently a great evil has plagued them, an evil as ancient as the dragons themselves. A group of 8 very powerful wizards managed to trap this evil on a separate plane of existence in what as referred to as the Isle of Dread. Lately, reports of terrible monsters fiends appearing out of nowhere have arisen. It is known to but a few, that Tiamat, the Chromatic Dragon, has been releasing these monsters from the island. Her intents are to eventually overpopulate the Material Plane with so many monsters, that while mortal community is busy battling these creatures, she will attack the good and defenseless dragons. You must travel to this island to find and defeat Tiamat.

The player gains hit points by walking around, and will enter random combat with monsters. The player can attack with fists, daggers, staff, sling, or cast spellfire. Levels are gained by killing enough monsters. The player can enter dungeons played from a 1st person perspective, and acquire weapons and armor. The player gains experience and levels by destroying enemy creatures.
title: A Warlock's Revenge

description:
Autobahn is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player races along 3 lanes of traffic, and can rapidly move between lanes. Other vehicles rapidly approach from the front. The player gains points as they pass other vehicles. A counter rapidly increases until the player reaches 10,000 meters. 200 meters are gained for every vehicle hit.
title: Autobahn

description:
The Power Stones of Ard: The Quest for the Spirit Stone is an RPG for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A long time ago, a group of powerful wizards gathered in a fortress with the intent of combining their powers to rid the world of evil. From the very core of their magic emerged three small stones of incredible power. These stones took the name of the fortress where they were created, the Power Stones of Ard. The wizards, now armed with the stones nearly rid the world of all evil, but in a movement of weakness, the remaining wizards chose to keep the stones for themselves. These wizards eventually fell, and the Power Stones of Ard became the property of the forces of evil. Your goal as an adventurer is to find the first Power Stone, the Spirit Stone.

In character creation, the player chooses a race and sex. They are then given several possible statistics to choose from. The player's statistics are shown on the screen at all times as well as inventory. The player's location is shown as a small picture at the bottom right of the screen. When exploring outside of town, the player can load up a larger map of the nearby area. When exploring town, the player can level up at the guild hall. They can purchase arms, armor, healing, and equipment at stores, as well as enter buildings to talk to the residents. In combat, the player and a single enemy take turns exchanging blows. If the player's hit points or any other statistic goes to 0, they are are killed. The game can be saved by exiting the main gate of town.
title: The Power Stones of Ard: The Quest for the Spirit Stone

description:
The Power Stones of Ard II: The Five Towers of Trafa-Zar is an RPG for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You have been apprentice to the great wizard Niz for many years. He tell you that many years ago, a group of powerful wizards gathered in a fortress with the intent of combining their powers to rid the world of evil. From the very core of their magic emerged three small stones of incredible power., which took the name of the fortress where they were created, the Power Stones of Ard. The wizards, now armed with the stones nearly rid the world of all evil, but in a movement of weakness, the remaining wizards chose to keep the stones for themselves. These wizards eventually fell, and the Power Stones of Ard became the property of the forces of evil. The evil wizard Trafa-Zar has in his possession one of the three great Power Stones of Ard, the Mind Stone. By accident, you are teleported to the Towers of Trafa-Zar instead of your master, and must solve their dangers to defeat the wizard and recover the Mind Stone.

In character creation, the player chooses a race and sex. They are then given several possible statistics to choose from. The player's statistics are shown on the screen at all times as well as inventory. The player's location is shown as a small picture at the bottom right of the screen.

All locations are in darkness, and the player has a variety of protective and navigational spells they can use to aid in exploration and healing. Their activity is displayed on screen. There are also a variety of activity commands available to assist with exploration. The player must manage spell points, and will fall unconscious if these are exhausted. The player will die if statistics or health points reach 0.

Multiple enemies can be encountered at once, and a portrait of the player and enemies are graphically displayed on the screen. The player has multiple powerful protective and offensive spells they can use. The player can level up, improving spell and health points after defeating a certain number of enemies.
title: The Power Stones of Ard II: The Five Towers of Trafa-Zar

description:
Bash! is a 1-2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Similar to the arcade game Arkanoid, the player moves a paddle horizontally at the bottom of the screen to bounce a ball into blocks at the top of the screen. The goal of each level is to destroy all of the colored blocks on the screen. As blocks are destroyed, power-ups and other items drop towards the player, and can be picked by the player. There are multiple levels of challenge.
title: Bash!

description:
Marty's Nightmare is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Dr. Marty Goodman of CoCo Consultants walks into his hotel to catch a good night sleep. On his mind is the seminar that he will be giving the next day at the Atlanta CoCoFest. Soon, Marty falls into a deep sleep and starts dreaming about the fun he will have in Atlanta. Because of the unfamiliar surroundings of the hotel room, the dream quickly turns into Marty's Nightmare! The rows of booths turn into an engulfing maze with CoCo users transformed into CoCo 3 and mouse. The users are now trying to hunt down Marty for answers to their never ending questions. Your job is to help Marty see every booth in this nightmare before it is time for his seminar.

The player navigates through a maze trying to pick up all the dots before a timer runs out. The player can pick up coffee, which temporarily speeds up the movement. If the player encounters a computer mouse or keyboard, they can't pick up more dots until they pick up a disk or memory chip. SRB tokens give the player another 30 seconds to complete the maze. After completing a maze, the player enters a new challenge.
title: Marty's Nightmare

description:
Snake Pit is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a snake with a long tail, as they continuously move about trying to avoid hitting the edge of the screen or the tails of other snakes. 1 - 4 computer-controlled snakes move about the screen laying eggs. These eggs must be gobbled for points before they hatch into another snake. Existing snakes can be destroyed by forcing them into a wall or the tail of another snake. The players' snake progressively elongates as the game progresses. The game is over when the human opponents are eliminated. There are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Snake Pit

description:
Warp Fighter 3-D is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from the first-person view of a space fighter, the player tries to shoot down enemy Akaire fighters from 25 sectors of space. The player has a target crosshair in the center of the screen, which will lock onto enemies or asteroids if the player manages to position the enemy in the center of the screen. Played in a 5 x 5 field, the player warps between sectors, trying to defeat all enemy ships. When all ships are destroyed, the player can return to their base for a promotion to a higher level of difficulty.
title: Warp Fighter 3-D

description:
War of the Worlds: Chapter One - The Landing is a graphical menu-based adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are an astrophysicist from the University of Washington, Seattle. You've been called to the mountains to the east to investigate a strange meteor, which has crashed near the town of Taima. Flying from Boeing Field, your small plane lands in a clearing south of the crash site.

All commands are via menu structure, including the four compass directions and a variety of activities. The player must avoid being killed by the alien invasion, and with the help of a local priest, try to make peace between the aliens and the people of Earth.

sample_screenshots.caption: I'm Kidnapped and Held in a Mine

title: War of the Worlds: Chapter One - The Landing

description:
War of the Worlds: Chapter Two - The Quest is a graphical menu-based adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are an astrophysicist from the University of Washington, Seattle. After narrowly escaping destruction at the original landing site to the east, you and the priest head for Boeing. As you fly over the city, you can see that the aliens have been here, too. You need to get to your lab at the University, so that your Proton Detector device can help you find Klandor's mysterious island.

All commands are via menu structure, including the four compass directions and a variety of activities. There is a save and restore feature. The player must avoid being killed by the alien invasion or the roving mobs of Seattle. With the help of the priest, the player tries to make peace between the aliens and the people of Earth.
title: War of the Worlds: Chapter Two - The Quest

description:
War of the Worlds: Chapter Three - The Last Hope is a graphical menu-based adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are an astrophysicist from the University of Washington, Seattle. Having escaped the destruction back in Seattle, you fly to the northwest. As you and the priest approach Merristone Island, the helicopter's engine sputters and quits!.

All commands are via menu structure, including the four compass directions and a variety of activities. There is a save and restore feature. The player must explore Merristone Island, infiltrate an alien saucer, and put an end to the alien invasion.
title: War of the Worlds: Chapter Three - The Last Hope

description:
Arena of Skill is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player creates a character with randomized attributes of speed, dexterity, strength, and constitution. The player encounters a progressively more difficult series of enemies. In combat, the player moves about an arena, and exchanges ranged blows with a single enemy by holding down the attack button. After each battle, the player gains gold and experience, and can purchase a series of better arms, armor, and special items. The player can review their character at any time.
title: Arena of Skill

description:
Bats -n- Bugs is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Long ago during the age of magic and sorcery, there existed an endless set of caverns so deadly, so terrifying they were known simply as The Caverns of Death. There was a curse on the caves, forcing all who enter to go deeper until they perished. Due to an error in a time machine, you were sent back to this age in the form of a bat.

The player tries to navigate a small bat through an endless cavern filled with stalactites and stalagmites, while trying to eat red and blue bugs, while avoiding deadly yellow bugs. The bat moves at a set rate, and the player flaps the wings to move the bat up and down. The player has 3 lives, and there are 8 levels of difficulty.
title: Bats -n- Bugs

description:
Blackjack is a 1 - 4 player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player bets against an animated opponent at blackjack. The player starts with 4 chips, or $40, and sets the bet at the beginning of each game. The player starts with 2 cards, and draws 1 card at a time with goal to get as close to 21 as possible without going over. A win pays double, and 21 pays triple. The player can break the bank at $10,000.
title: Blackjack

description:
Blackjack Royale is a 1-player graphical card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player bets against a single computer opponent at blackjack. The player starts with $100, and sets the bet at the beginning of each game. The player starts with 2 cards, and draws 1 card at a time with the goal to get as close to 21 as possible without going over. A win pays double.
title: Blackjack Royale

description:
The Black Grid is a puzzle game based upon predicting the output of a ray fired into a grid.

The game board consists of a room in an 8 x 8 grid, which is filled with 3 - 9 reflecting items. The player assigns the position where a ray will be fired into the grid, and will be shown where the ray exits the grid. If the ray directly hits an object, it is absorbed. If the ray travels beside a object, it is deflected 90 degrees. The player is shown on the screen where the ray exits. The player must flag the position where the reflecting items are located. After all positions have been flagged, the player can check their answers. The player is awarded points based upon the number of correct answers, and how many rays are used.
title: The Black Grid

description:
Blitz is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a tank that moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen, and can move its turret to fire in multiple directions. Enemy planes fly horizontally from both sides of the screen, and drop bombs towards the player. The player must avoid or shoot down incoming bombs and destroy enemy planes. There are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Blitz

description:
Blox is a 1-player Tetris clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to position different shaped 4-square blocks as they fall from the top of the screen. If the player fills a row, that row is removed, and the player scores points. If the blocks reach the top of the screen, it's game over. There are 10 levels of difficulty, and the player can start with 1 - 4 rows of random blocks.
title: Blox

description:
Digger is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move laterally, climb ladders, and dig small holes in the ground to trap enemies. The character must collect gold from a series of platforms, and take it to the top-most ladder to advance to the next level. Enemy characters relentlessly pursue the player, and take their life if they catch them. Enemies can pick up gold, and the player must trap the enemy in a pit to retrieve the gold. There are hidden trap doors and floors that can not be dug into. Enemies can only exit and enter ladders from the top or the bottom, while a player can exit or enter a ladder at any point. The player starts with 5 lives

sample_screenshots.caption: Ladder to the Next Level Appears

title: Digger

description:
Digger III: The Saint's Ascension is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a character who can move laterally, climb ladders, and dig small holes in the ground to trap enemies. The game features lateral and vertical scrolling. The character must collect gold and other treasures from a series of platforms, and take it to the top-most ladder to advance to the next level. Enemy Gomers relentlessly pursue the player, and take their life if they catch them. Enemies can pick up treasures,, and the player must trap the enemy in a pit to retrieve the treasure. Enemies can be killed by trapping them in pits, and new enemies then immediately appear. There are hidden trap doors and floors that can not be dug into. Enemies can only exit and enter ladders from the top or the bottom, while a player can exit or enter a ladder at any point. The player starts with 5 lives
title: Digger III: The Saint's Ascension

description:
Buried Buxx is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small helicopter that can move in all directions, and can fire in a forward arc, destroying sections of the ground. The player's goal is to dig a hole into the ground to recover the money buried within. An airplane continuously flies across the top of the screen dropping bombs. These bombs can destroy the helicopter or repair the ground. If the helicopter hits the ground it is destroyed. The helicopter can store 25 shots, and then must rearm at the landing pad. The player's money continuously drains, and it's game over if the money hits 0.
title: Buried Buxx

description:
A Diamond in the Rough is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Starting in their own home, the player searches for the famed Tandy Diamond.

All available directions are displayed on the screen, and the player can only enter commands a maximum of 9 characters long. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save or restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Fall in to a Pit

title: A Diamond in the Rough

description:
Picture Puzzles is a sliding block puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player generates a randomized picture consisting of squares, circles, stripes, stars, or abstract shapes. This picture is then divided into a 6 x 6 grid with a single square missing. The player can have a timed or untimed game, or compete on the number of moves to rearrange the puzzle.
title: Picture Puzzles

description:
Revenge of the Mutant Miners is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a character who can move horizontally, jump, and climb up and down ladders. There are also doorways to different areas of the level and springboards. The player can jump over monsters, and receives bonus points by picking up shovels and lanterns. As players walks over sections of floors and platforms, they become highlighted, and the player completes a level by highlighting all sections of the floor. The player loses a life if they strike an enemy, and they start with 5 lives. There are 10 separate levels and 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Revenge of the Mutant Miners

description:
Castle Ragoona is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The object of this adventure is to solve a variety of puzzles within a castle to reach the flagpole at the top. The player must deal with randomly appearing zombies, mazes, and a number of dangers.

All locations are graphically displayed. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and available directions are shown on the screen. There is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Find a Needle and Thread

title: Castle Ragoona

description:
Castle Zhagwhar is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In a different time far away, the small magical kingdom of Lithana is thriving. It is a peaceful kingdom with a just king on the throne, a good economy, and happy people. One day an evil wizard arrives at an odd, abandoned fortress outside the kingdom, called Castle Zhagwar. He wants to rule Lithana, so begins transforming entire forests into gigantic armies of goblins to attack the kingdom. The king sends a decree throughout the kingdom requesting help defeating the wizard. Finally, after many weeks, a strong, yet unskilled woodcutter named Gwydion appears to take on the quest.

The controls a small character who can move horizontally, jump, climb ladders, and duck. On each level, the player tries to collect gold and the key, and bring the key to the door to move to the next level. The player has limited life, which is lost by falling or touching enemies. If the player jumps onto a ladder, it breaks and is lost permanently. As time passes, life begins to decrease, but randomly discovered healing elixirs can restore health. The ultimate goal is to reach the wizard and defeat him.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Duck to Avoid a Bat

title: Castle Zhagwhar

description:
Catacomb is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Gameplay is divided into two stages, a catacomb stage and a space flight stage. In the catacomb stage, the player moves through a series of very tight caverns trying to pick up fuel blocks. The total fuel is displayed at the right of the screen. The player must avoid the enemies that move in the hallways. Once the player thinks they have gathered enough fuel, they choose to enter a spaceflight stage, where they can move horizontally, and partially forwards on the screen. During this stage, the player can fire forwards to destroy or avoid enemies. Small amounts of fuel can additionally be picked up in space. The goal is to collect enough fuel in the catacombs to fly far enough in the spaceflight stage to return to the mothership.
title: Catacomb

description:
Kron is a clone of the arcade game TRON for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It contains 4 mini-games that the player must complete within 3 lives:

  • Light Cycles: Race a light cycle against a single enemy in an attempt to have them crash against a light wall or the edge of the screen.

  • I/O Tower: Blast through numerous replicating grid bugs in an attempt to get into the I/O Tower. The player can move in all directions, and can fire vertically or at 45 degree angles.

  • Master Control Program Cone: Blast through the rotating defensive walls of the Master Control Program in order to get into its central cone. The player can move in all directions, and can fire vertically or at 45 degree angles.

  • Battle Tanks: Maneuver a tank through the battlefield to shoot the enemy before getting hit. Shots bounce off walls.
title: Kron

description:
Caves of the Unwashed Heathen is a RPG for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a 1st person perspective, the player patrols grid-based dungeon levels gathering treasure and battling with monsters. Each character starts with randomly rolled statistics of strength, intelligence, dexterity, wisdom, constitution, and charisma. The game starts at Inn of the Black Trident, where they can heal, purchase weapons and armor, or enter the dungeon. Once entering the dungeon, the player has a map to guide their explorations. Treasure chests contains weapons, gold and armor. The player enters combat with randomly appearing enemies, and can attack, cast spells, or run.
title: Caves of the Unwashed Heathen

description:
Chatwin Manor is a 1-player mystery adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You work as a detective, and have received an invitation from George Chatwin to visit Chatwin Manor. There, you meet the Chatwin family. George Chatwin brags that he recently cheaply purchased the Golden Orange from an acquaintance who had been in debt. Early the next morning, you are awoken to find out that the Golden Orange had been stolen. To solve the mystery, the player must review files on the Manor's residents: George, Eliza, and Melinda Chatwin, the lawyer Larry Lowdown, and the maid Susan Walker. The player can investigate the different rooms of the residence looking for clues. After gathering clues, the player must accuse the correct resident of the crime. Each game is randomized.

sample_screenshots.caption: George Shows off the Golden Orange

title: Chatwin Manor

description:
Checkers is a 1-player versus computer checkers game.

The player can force computer or human moves, switch playing position, undo moves, and change the randomness. There are 9 levels of difficulty.
title: Checkers

description:
Chess is a 1-player versus computer chess game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player can set up custom boards by adding or removing game pieces, and board positions can be saved. There are multiple difficulty levels of difficulty, and the player can change their playing color.
title: Chess

description:
ChesSD is a 1-player versus computer chess game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

All commands are via text entry. There are multiple levels of difficulty, and the player can create a custom board.
title: ChesSD

description:
Chopper Rescue is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a helicopter that moves in all directions, and can lower a ladder to rescue people stranded atop buildings. These buildings slowly tumble to the ground, and the person standing atop is lost when the building collapses. Rescued people need to be returned to the landing pad. The player scores points for every person rescued. The game is over when all buildings collapse or the helicopter hits a building.
title: Chopper Rescue

description:
City Bomber is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player flies a plane or other flying object that moves laterally across the screen, and when it reaches the edge, moves down slightly, and changes direction. The player drops bombs that destroy all objects vertically below the player. The goal is to destroy the city before colliding into an object. There are 3 levels of difficulty and 3 levels of game speed. The player moves to progressively more cities as they are destroyed.
title: City Bomber

description:
Eastworld Karate is a 1 - 2 player fighting game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players face off in a karate competition. Each player can use a series of different kicks, punches, and blocks. The first player to make 10 hits is the winner. There are numerous different backgrounds for competition. There are 4 levels of computer opponent difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Taking a Punch at the Pool

title: Eastworld Karate

description:
CoCo 3 Cribbage is a 1-player versus computer card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

At the start of each game, both players are dealt 6 cards, and discard 2 for the crib. Players play their cards with the goal of reaching 15 or 31, as well as playing doubles. When all cards are played, people receive points based upon their hand and one player receives the crib.
title: CoCo 3 Cribbage

description:
CoCo3 Yahtzee Game is a dice game for one to four players.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and the player can reroll any or all of the dice twice more before selecting their scoring category. Scoring categories include the sum of all ones to sixes, 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used. Dice are graphically displayed at the bottom of the screen.
title: CoCo3 Yahtzee Game

description:
CoCo Craps is a 1-player gambling game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with $1000, and can bet 10%, 25%, 50%, 75%, or all of their money on a roll of the dice. The player rolls 2 dice, and if they roll 7 or 11 they lose. Whatever number the player rolls, they keep rolling until they reroll that number, or roll a 7 or 11. If they reroll the number, they increase their money,
title: CoCo Craps

description:
COCOdle is a 1-player word game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the game Wordle, the player attempts to solve a five letter word in five guesses or less. On each guess, the player is told which letters are in the correct position, which letters are used in the word but are in the wrong position, and which letters are not used at all. Only real words are allowed for each guess.
title: COCOdle

description:
Colordle is a 1-player word game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to solve a five letter word in five guesses or less. On each guess, the player is told which letters are in the correct position, which letters are used in the word but are in the wrong position, and which letters are not used at all. Only real words are allowed for each guess.
title: Colordle

description:
Cocogrow is a 1-player action strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player farms a 10 x 10 field of crops. The player moves a cursor between sections, and in each section the player can choose to plow, harvest, or plant tomatoes, wheat, pumpkins, or melons. Individual crops have different growing times and selling prices. Before crops can be planted, and after crops are harvested, the ground must be plowed. Untended land grows grassland. The player can compete in a timed game, or against a computer opponent to make more profit than the opponent. There are 3 levels of difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: An Empty Field Waiting to be Plowed

title: Cocogrow

description:
CoCo Stud is a 1-player five-card stud game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with $5000, and can set their bid $1 - 100 at the beginning of each hand. The player is dealt 2 cards, and then cards are revealed one at a time.
