As each card is revealed, the player can fold, single, double, or triple their bet. Payout is based upon the player's final hand. The player also receives a bonus based upon the final 3 cards they are dealt, and can set an individual 3-card bet..
title: CoCo Stud

description:
CoCo 3 Video Poker is a 1-player gambling card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with $1000, and bids $1-5 per game. Each game, the player is dealt 5 cards, and can choose to keep any of those 5. The player is then dealt new cards to replace their discards. The player receives payout based upon their final hand.
title: CoCo 3 Video Poker

description:
Get me Outta Here! is an adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to escape a large room filled with numerous items, locks, passcodes, and other secrets. Played with the cursor, the player can select items in the room to get a better view, and has a small inventory displayed at the bottom of the screen where collected items can be examined and manipulated. All clues to escape the room are found within the room itself.
title: Get me Outta Here!

description:
Color Blast is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a large tank at the bottom of the screen, as it drives down a highway into the distance. The player moves laterally and can fire vertically. Numerous enemy vessels continuously appear at the top of the screen, move about randomly, and fire towards the player. The player tries to avoid enemy fire and destroy as many enemy ships as possible. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Color Blast

description:
Aerial Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a spaceship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. Enemy vessels appear, which move laterally and slowly descend the screen, while firing at the player. Every 10 vessels destroyed leads to a new enemy type. After 4 enemy waves are destroyed, the player encounters an alien mothership. The player starts with 4 lives.
title: Aerial Attack

description:
Color Computer 3 Karate is a 1-player fighting game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A side-view fighting game, the player's goal is to defeat 14 enemy karate fighters to gain the title of Karate Master. As each level is completed, the opponent's strength and ability increases. The player can move left and right, kick, punch, jump, duck, and do high and low kicks and punches. Each player can take 10 hits before being defeated.
title: Color Computer 3 Karate

description:
Color Computer Clue is a board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the board game Clue, the player tries to guess the location, perpetrator, and weapon used in a murder. At the beginning of the game, each player is given a number of cards containing locations, weapons, and perpetrators. The cards no player possesses are the true crime. The player rolls dice to move between rooms, and in each room the player queries their opponent what cards they have. The player can only ask about the room they are in. Once the player has determined the true aspects of the crime, they can guess, and will win or lose the game based upon their guess.
title: Color Computer Clue

description:
Color Eights is a computer version of the card game crazy eights for the TRS-80 CoCo.

There is a single computer opponent. Each player starts with 8 cards, and can play any card that is the same suit or number as the active card. The player can pick up a card if there are no plays available. Eights change the suit, jacks skip a turn, jokers change the suit and make the opponent pick up 5 cards, and twos make the opponent pick up 2 cards. The first player to use their last card is the winner.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Can Play a Heart or a 10

title: Color Eights

description:
Color Modem Chess is a 2-player computer chess game played via modem for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player can send messages and moves to their opponent via the modem.
title: Color Modem Chess

description:
Concentrate! is a 2-player tile matching game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a 10 x 5 board, each player takes turns trying to find matching tiles. When tiles match, the player gets an extra turn.
title: Concentrate!

description:
Conquering Armies is a realtime strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are Crown Prince and heir to the throne of Glasco. Your country was invaded, and 6 of its 7 states have fallen under the control of enemy forces. The King, your father, was slain in the attack. You have a small army at Abby on Avon, and the aid of allied countries. You must now take your country back from the invaders.

A game of medieval warfare, Glasco is divided into 7 states, each ruled by a castle. There are 4 surrounding border areas. 1 - 3 of these border areas will be allied with the player depending upon difficulty level. Each castle continuously produces knights, light cavalry, men-at-arms, and archers. The player raises armies at castles, and can march them to other locations to engage enemy forces and castle. Armies can be reinforced by moving them into allied border areas.

The player can review their states and the armies currently stationed there. The player can raise up to 5 armies at a time. Enemies consistently send larger armies to engage. During combat, player and enemy units are displayed, while these units are defeated over several rounds of combat.

There are 50 levels of difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: My Army is in the Field

title: Conquering Armies

description:
The Dragons Castle is a graphic adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The fire-breathing dragon has attacked the castle of your king. He has killed everybody except the beautiful princess. Your mission is to save the princess and kill the dragon using the items and magic spells found on your adventure. Dangers including a goblin and imp who appear at certain locations. If the player encounters the goblin 3 times they are killed.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and all available directions are displayed. There is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: The imp appears in the kitchen.

title: The Dragons Castle

description:
Creature Feature is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move in all directions, and fires in the cardinal directions. The player encounters a series of monsters that fire in the cardinal directions. They most avoid dangerous obstacles on the screen. The monsters' movement and appearance rate steadily increases as the game progresses. The player has 5 lives, and tries to destroy as many monsters as possible.
title: Creature Feature

description:
Croaker is a 1 - 4 player Frogger clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to navigate a frog in the cardinal directions across a busy highway and dangerous river to reach the 5 safety sites at the top of the screen. The player must avoid vehicles, and travel atop logs and lily pads, to safely bypass these obstacles. The player has limited time to reach their destination, and a total of 3 lives.
title: Croaker

description:
Voyagers is a 1 - 4 player Frogger clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to navigate a spaceship in the cardinal directions across a busy highway and dangerous river to reach the 5 safety sites at the top of the screen. The player must avoid dinosaurs, and travel atop rockets, to safely bypass these obstacles. The player has limited time to reach their destination, and a total of 3 lives.
title: Voyagers

description:
The Crown of Merro is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are an English explorer, and your mission is to find the ancient crown of King Merro which is hidden somewhere in the Amazon jungle. When your boat stopped, your partner knocked you out and took off, taking most of your equipment. The player must avoid a number of dangers including apes and poisonous fountains.

All commands are via VERB NOUN command. All available directions are displayed. There is no save/restore feature.
title: The Crown of Merro

description:
Curillian Cruiser is a 1 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The year is 2584, the dawn of the Skirum War, and the player controls a Curillian Cruiser tasked with travelling to different planets to perform missions. Each planet has several arcade sequences, where the player must carefully navigate their ship through asteroid fields, laser drones, or other dangers. Each planet then requires a careful landing procedure through underground caverns. On some levels, the player can move horizontally at the bottom of the screen, on other levels the player can move throughout the screen, but is affected by gravity. There are a total of 12 distinct levels to complete spread over 4 planets. The ultimate goal is to destroy the Skirum homeworld. The player starts with 5 lives, but can customize their game up to 999 lives.
title: Curillian Cruiser

description:
Defender is a TRS-80 CoCo clone of the original arcade Defender.

Defender puts players in charge of a ship sent to protect mankind from wave after wave of attacking alien forces. The player controls a ship that moves in all directions, and fires directly forwards. Enemy aliens try to attack the player, and also swoop down and attempt to abduct humans at the bottom of the screen. The player is armed with a limited number of smart bombs which destroy all enemies on the screen, and can warp around the game play area. The player's ship must fight against Bombers, Pods, Swarmers, Baiters, and Landers. Fail to save the humanoids from freefall or Mutant transformation, and the planet is destroyed. A map of approaching aliens and humans are shown on the screen, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Defender

description:
Destiny is a 2 - 3 player Wheel of Fortune game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the television show, each player takes turns spinning a wheel and guessing a letter. Vowels must be purchased. The wheel spins for dollar amounts, or can lose a turn or cause bankruptcy. With a wrong guess, lost turn, or bankruptcy, the active spin moves to the next player. The player can guess a word, and there are a total of 3 rounds per game.
title: Destiny

description:
Dock Master is a 1-player arcade strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Everybody is buying everything on-line! And one of the ways to keep it cheap, is to ship by sea. You work at a Chinese cargo port, making sure containers are properly loaded onto freighters waiting to ship goods.

Each freighter can carry 8 containers. Containers are placed from the crane atop the screen, and can be placed in 9 separate positions. The container is always placed in the lowest possible empty cargo slot. There are 4 different color-coded weights of containers. If too much weight is placed on the front or back of the ship, it will sink and the game is over. If a container is placed on the bridge of a ship, the ship is destroyed. A perfectly balanced ship gives bonus points, with the heaviest loads in the center, and the lightest loads on the periphery. The crane can only hold a container so long before dropping it, and this time reduces as the game progresses. When is ship is fully loaded, it sails out to sea, and a new empty ship takes a place in the loading dock.
title: Dock Master

description:
Domination is a 2 - 6 player strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a large world map, countries are randomly dispersed to each player. The game starts with each player taking turns placing groups of 5 soldiers on different countries. Each turn, the players take turns attacking nearby countries with their forces. Combat occurs by dice rolls between opposing countries, with the lower roll losing forces. The player can choose to end their turn at any time, and new troops are awarded each round. Game play occurs until only 1 force remains. Games can be saved in progress.
title: Domination

description:
Dragon Castles is a 1-player game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each turn, the player must randomly choose from 8 different colored castles. Each castle can either contain treasure, a monster, or a dragon. The player gains 25 - 100 points depending on the type of treasure found, but loses 100 points if they encounter a monster. If the player encounters a dragon, they must have a specific number of points to defeat it, otherwise it's game over. There are 5 levels of difficulty, requiring progressively more points to defeat the dragon.
title: Dragon Castles

description:
The Entity is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes control of an entity that can possess and control the bodies of people they encounter. The goal is to stop bad things from happening in the city. As an entity, the player can not pick up or manipulate objects or interact with the environment. The player can leave and enter other bodies at any time.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry and there is no save/restore feature.
title: The Entity

description:
Hostage is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts within the research lab of Rogart Technology, and must rescue the Hostage.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature
title: Hostage

description:
Exeter is a 1-player roleplaying game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It has been written that Exeter was once a peaceful and prosperous land. That is all but gone now that the Dragon and its many disgusting and evil followers have come and ravaged this mighty land. Exeter is now a mere shadow of its former self. The Master Wizard has traversed the land in search of a powerful and persistent warrior, who will come to the rescue and destroy the Dragon. You have become the Wizard's Chosen One. It is up to you to attempt this perilous deed.

At the beginning of each game, the player is randomly given attributes in strength, intelligence, wisdom, dexterity, constitution, hit points, gold pieces, and armour class. Before entering the Dragon's dungeon, the player can purchase weapons, armour, food, and projectiles. Dungeons are explored from 1st person perspective, and the player does combat with enemies. The player can return to town to resupply by climbing up the starting ladder. The player can also find secret doors and open chests.
title: Exeter

description:
Euchre is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes against 3 computer opponents in euchre. The goal is to win at least three tricks. All card are graphically displayed on the screen.
title: Euchre

description:
Rodoc Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player inputs text commands to a surface robot from their underground lair. The player explores areas including a castle, desert, forest, and field in a search to defeat the Dragon. There are numerous dangers that can cause the robot to malfunction.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature, and available directions are displayed.
title: Rodoc Adventure

description:
Police Cadet I: The Hidden Money in the Varingen House is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

There is hidden money in Charley Varingen's House. Your mission: find it if you dare! The player must explore the rooms of the house, avoiding dangers, solving puzzles, and searching for treasure.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature, and available directions are displayed. Available items are displayed in text, but are not separately displayed.
title: Police Cadet I: The Hidden Money in the Varingen House

description:
The Genesis Project is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Waking up in your bedroom, today is the day of the rocket launch. The player explores their house, and travels to the surrounding neighborhood using their car. The player must gather the crew, bring the rocket to the rocket pad, and gather a tube of rocket fuel.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature, and available directions are displayed on screen.
title: The Genesis Project

description:
Java is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to collect treasure while shooting objects that fall from the top of the screen. The player starts on the bottom of the screen, and can move laterally. The player can jump to higher platforms, but if they jump in a location with no platform above, they lose a life. The player also loses a life if they are hit by a falling object. If the treasure appears in an unreachable location, the player can touch the object on the bottom left of the screen for a loss of 5 points, but the location of the treasure in again randomized. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Java

description:
The Sandstone Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo

You have just arrived in India. You must find the missing Sandstone, which will supply clues to the whereabouts of your lost friend Gary Lamburd. The player starts their adventure exploring the streets and markets of a city.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entries. Available directions are displayed on the screen, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: The Sandstone Adventure

description:
Snow Fight is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players throw snowballs at each other as they move about their backyard. The players pick snowballs off the ground, and can throw them horizontally towards their opponent. The first player to get 9 hits is the winner.
title: Snow Fight

description:
Monsters and Magic is a roleplaying game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The goal is to move the player's army to destroy 5 groups of outlaw monsters on a map of a fantasy world. The player is represented by a small blue square that can move to different locations on the map. As they move, they can have injuries or suffer mutiny from their crew. The world is also dotted with towns, dungeons, and other places. In dungeons, the player can fight resident monsters for gold and treasure. In towns, the player can buy supplies, gamble, fight in the arena for money, and hire more troops.

During combat, the player's forces and the monster take turns exchanging blows until one is defeated.
title: Monsters and Magic

description:
Earth Trooper is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You destroyed the Space Invaders with ease, and you were instantly a hero. Next came slime monsters and alien invaders, as well as Martian Meanies and a horde of other evil menaces. Just when you thought it couldn't get worse, the Robo-Force arrived on Earth to spoil your day.

The player controls a ship on the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically. Every hit destroys a portion of the non-moving robots at the top of the screen. A protector bar moves between you and the robots. If you shoot this, you are hit by its tractor beam and lose a life. At the top of the screen, a scout ship moves laterally, and occasionally drops bombs. A scout ship at the bottom of the screen intermittently fires towards the player. The player starts with 3 lives.

sample_screenshots.caption: Shot by the Lower Scout Ship

title: Earth Trooper

description:
Crionaut Warrior is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are the last hope for a dying world. A warrior is needed to restore peace. You are ready for your final training, the House of Confusion.

The player must drive their tank through a series of randomized dark mazes. The player can only see the surrounding 8 squares. There are 6 levels, and the goal of each level is to find the exit position to the next level. The player receives a time for each level, and the time to complete all 6 mazes.
title: Crionaut Warrior

description:
Triorace is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Gameplay consists of 3 sequential arcade racing challenges. On each level the player can take 5 hits before being destroyed. The first level is played from a top-down perspective on a road. The player can accelerate/decelerate, and on each screen the player can move between the left and right lane to avoid potholes. On level 2, the player maneuvers a blinking boat that moves laterally The player can accelerate/decelerate, and must jump over waves. On level 3, the player jumps between vines, and can jump a set distance each time.
title: Triorace

description:
The Orbs of Derra is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Your job is to find the six Orbs of the Kingdom of Derra, which have been stolen. You start at the throne room, and must search the castle and surrounding lands for the Orbs.

All locations are graphically displayed, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: The Orbs of Derra

description:
Maxomar's World is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Maxomar, a famed criminal has just escaped from prison. He stole a device from one of the world's leading scientists. This device enabled him to create his own dimension, his own private world. You are a bounty hunter. You must bring him back to our world.

The player must travel through the different environments of Maxomar's world, solving puzzles. There is no save/restore feature. Available directions are displayed on the screen, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Maxomar's World

description:
Starship Showdown is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players start on opposite corners at the fueling stations of a starship. The players must travel back and forth between these two fueling stations to collect 2 shots. If the player hits a trap, they lose a shield. Five hits are required to defeat the opponent. If the opponents hit each other, both are destroyed. There are 2 bombs and a deactivator that cause instant destruction.
title: Starship Showdown

description:
Police Cadet II: The Haunted Carnival is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Having found the money hidden in Varingen House in Police Cadet I, the player has been given a new assignment. The player's goal is now to solve the mystery of the ghost recently seen at the local carnival. The player must explore the carnival and find the culprits before returning to the police station.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Police Cadet II: The Haunted Carnival

description:
Submania is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a sub that moves in all directions, and can fire vertically and directly forwards. Red and black mines continuously scroll from the left. The player can shoot and destroy red mines, but black mines are invulnerable. Red mountain bases on the surface need to be destroyed, and white crosses fall from the sky that must be collected. The player starts with 3 lives, and loses a life if they hit a mine or miss a cross or base.
title: Submania

description:
Police Cadet 3: The Gadget Factory is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

When you finished your case in Police Cadet II, you went home to rest. At 5'o'clock the next morning, the police chief called, and told you about your new mission. You must enter the factory of Professor Jenkins, and get the Solar Powered Perpetual Motion Energy Center. The professor died from a heart attack while you were solving the previous adventure. You have until sunup to solve the quest.

The player must explore the many dangerous rooms of the factory in search of the machine, avoiding a number of deadly traps. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature

sample_screenshots.caption: I Return to the Police Station

title: Police Cadet 3: The Gadget Factory

description:
Dream Tunnel is a side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship that can move in all directions and fires to the right. The player flies through a tunnel avoiding walls and shooting enemies. Small enemies chase the player, which can't be destroy, only avoided. The player can take 3 hits before losing.
title: Dream Tunnel

description:
Blaster is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically forwards. The player tries to destroy sections of a large alien mothership, while avoiding a small attack ship that fires at the player. A small shield moves towards the player, and the shield can be reset by shooting the attack ship or moving through a small gap in the shield. The mothership's total health is shown at the bottom of the screen, and the player starts with 3 lives.
title: Blaster

description:
Dungeon Maze is a maze exploration game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are pledging to a university frat house. In the last part of the initiation, the fraternity brothers have blindfolded you and dropped you off in a dungeon.

The player explores a dungeon from a 3D perspective, always looking to the north. Each room has up to 4 doors, and the player must navigate to the exit.
title: Dungeon Maze

description:
Mount Death is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a special agent with the Air Force. It is your mission to go into the Mountain of Death, and make it out. The reason? To map it for the Air Force. The government intends to make a missile base inside the mountain, depending on your success.

The player controls a small ship that moves continuously forwards, and can be directed up and down. The underground tunnels are divided into numerous screens, and the player must carefully navigate the tunnels without hitting the walls. The player can take 3 hits before being destroyed.

sample_screenshots.caption: Moving to a New Section of the Mountain

title: Mount Death

description:
Terron is 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You will be flying above a test site. A land cruiser moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen, intermittently firing vertically. The player can move in all directions, and fires horizontally to destroy the round target that moves about the screen . The round target can only be be shot, and the square target only scores points if the player run into it. The equal-sign target can neither be destroyed nor is worth points.
title: Terron

description:
Journey Up is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Help Jumpin' Joe as he tries to make it to the exit circle on each level. Joe can move laterally and jump vertically, and tries to move between a series of platforms. Some platforms are strong enough to walk on, but won't support someone who jumps. Joe starts with 3 lives, and loses a life if he hits a bat or falls off the bottom of the screen.
title: Journey Up

description:
Crazy Chemist is a 1-player memory game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player mixes different colored compounds to try to make a final product. There are 5 stages: mixing the original 4 colored compounds, mixing with 1 of 5 powders, heating for 1 - 3 minutes, mixing with acid, and final testing. If any of these stages are performed incorrectly, the mixture can explode, disappear, or dissolve. The steps have to be learned by trial and error. The goal is to create a final stable identified compound.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Created First Stage Stable Compound

title: Crazy Chemist

description:
Tiler Tex Two is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Once again you have been hired to tile a mansion. This time with 16 rooms. The player has 2 helpers who follow the player around the maze, one of whom has a broom and the other tiles. The player can switch between items by moving onto the position of these helpers. The goal is to first sweep the floor clean, and then lay tiles on all the cleaned squares. The level is complete when all squares are tiled. Diamonds can be picked up for bonus points. The woman who hired you forgot to deactivate the security alarm, and a small blinking dot follows the player, moving through walls. If the security system catches the player 3 times, it's game over.
title: Tiler Tex Two

description:
Tiler Tex is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Avoid Fifi the guard dog, while trying to lay diagonal tiles throughout 15 different levels. The player can move in all directions, and leaves tiles behind him as he moves. Fifi always moves towards the player. When all squares are tiled, the player moves to the next level.
title: Tiler Tex

description:
Feuer and Gasse is a realtime strategy wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the decisive World War I Battle of Belleau Woods during the Spring Offensive of 1918 which pitted American troops against German forces, the player takes command of the American 2nd Division.

The player controls infantry, marine, machine gun, engineer, and field artillery regiments. The player must move troops over a variety of terrain, which effect combat and movement speed. Combat occurs by moving forces over enemy positions. Ranged units can fire upon entrenched German positions. Strength of American and German forces can be reviewed at any time. The initial goal is to capture the town of Vaux, after which air force can be called against German forces. The final goal is to force German surrender by securing Belleau Woods and capturing Chateau Thierry. The player must contend with German artillery fire, gas, and air attacks.

There are 5 levels of difficulty, where 3 represents historical conditions. Games can be saved in progress.
title: Feuer and Gasse

description:
Flags is a 1 - 5 player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Similar to the board game Risk, players compete to gain control of a large world map divided into a many different countries. Players can attack any land mass adjacent to their units. Combat occurs by dice roll, with the lowest roll losing a troop each round. Each turn, the player initiates new battles, and gains new units which can be placed on the map.
title: Flags

description:
Programs for Friends is a series of educational computer games, but also contains the 1 - 4 player card game Wacko.

Played with a deck of 60 cards, the goal is to arrange 10 cards in descending order from top to bottom. Each turn, each of the 4 players is dealt a new card. They can either play the card on the rack or can choose a single new card to place on the rack. The first player to put 10 card in order is the winner.
title: Programs for Friends

description:
Puzzles is a jigsaw puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player scrolls through puzzle pieces at the bottom of the screen, and tries to correctly place them on a displayed outline. The game pack comes with several puzzles plus the ability to make new custom puzzles.
title: Puzzles

description:
Tetra is a 1-player Tetris clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Seven different geometric shapes appear at the top of the screen. All shapes contain 4 squares except for the straight piece which only has 3 squares. As they descend, the player can rotate and move them laterally to help them fit at the bottom of the play area. If the player completes an entire row, that row is removed and the player gains points. If the blocks reach the top of the play area, it's game over. There are 10 levels of difficulty.
title: Tetra

description:
Vocab is a 1 - 6 player unlicensed Scrabble game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player takes turns playing tiles on a board to spell words and earn points. Each word, except for the starting word, must build onto previously present letters. Different letters have different point scoring, and there are bonus point squares present on the board. Gameplay occurs until there are no letter tiles remaining. There is an available computer opponent, and a built in dictionary.

sample_screenshots.caption: Adding an S to make Bribes

title: Vocab

description:
Treasure Chest is a compilation of educational games and software for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Contains a number of drills for practicing math, spelling, U.S. states, capitals and presidents, and longitude/latitude. Also includes several technical programs. Games include:* Color Wheels: Spin 7 wheels with 6 colors so that all points match.

  • Connects: Guess 6 words from the first letter and a clue from the word above. The word elongates 1 letter with a failed guess, and gets 9 guesses.
  • Discover: A Scrabble clone with no computer opponent or dictionary.
  • Hangman: Guess the word before the player is hung.
  • Number Slide: Complete a 32-piece sliding block puzzle.
  • Picture Slide Puzzle: Rearrange a sliding block puzzle to complete the picture.
  • Take Some: Take turns removing 1 - 3 apples from a pile. The player who takes the last apple loses.
  • Tic Tac Toe Math: 2 player math game where the players answer math questions to place pieces on the board.
  • Touch Stones: Memory game where the player must remember the increasing long order 4 buttons flash.
title: Treasure Chest

description:
Flood It! is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with a 16 x 14 board containing yellow, white, blue, black, cyan, green, and red squares. The player starts in the top left corner, and can change the active square color. When a square is changed to a color matching its neighbor, the squares are locked together. The goal is to turn all squares the same color in as few turns as possible. The player has a limited number of turns to complete each level.
title: Flood It!

description:
Frogday Afternoon is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a laser positioned at the center of the screen, and moves a crosshair to try to shoot submarines, jellyfish, and depth charges that threaten scuba divers that swim across the screen. The player has a limited number of laser shots per level, and if they run out it's game over. There are also 5 scuba divers per level, and if they are lost, it's game over. After a number of divers have crossed the screen, a diver will appear carrying a flashing treasure, and if they make a successful crossing, the player advances to the next level.
title: Frogday Afternoon

description:
Zandar is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a spacecraft from a 1st person perspective, and tries to reach nine separate planets with the final goal of planet Zandar. Enemy drone ships try to stop the player's progress. There are 3 levels of difficulty, which are determined by the final planet goal.
title: Zandar

description:
Furious Felines is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to catapult cats onto mice to try to catch them. The player chooses from 3 weights of felines: tabby, shorhair, and siamese. Cats are stacked up as high as needed, and then a cat is placed on the other side of a seesaw. A cat jumps off the top of the stack, and flings the waiting cat towards the mouse. Wind effects cat movement. When a mouse is caught, the player moves to a harder challenge.
title: Furious Felines

description:
Police Cadet 4 is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The plot is to recover five pieces of evidence that can be used against a Soviet spy. The player must find all evidence before returning to police headquarters.

All locations are graphically displayed on the screen. All commands are via VERB NOUN entry and available directions are shown on screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Starting by a Pizza Delivery Truck

title: Police Cadet 4

description:
Speed Games is a series of arcade games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Includes 7 quick games:* Ball Saver: Move a paddle horizontally at the bottom of the screen to bounce a ball and destroy blocks at the top of the screen.

  • Bar Fire: Move horizontally at the bottom of the screen to shoot a bar that moves horizontally at the top.
  • Frogger: Try to move a frog across a busy road and congested river.
  • Ghost Catcher: Catch moving blocks with a crosshair and bring them to the home base.
  • Jewel Snatcher: Shoot the jewels at the top of the screen while trying to avoid laser fire from the sides of the screen.
  • Maneuver King: Move a block laterally atop the screen to avoid vertically moving blocks.
  • Missile Smasher: Move a crosshair to shoot missiles as they launch from the bottom of the screen.
title: Speed Games

description:
River Raid is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to sail a boat down a river filled with numerous dangers. The boat can be navigated laterally, and can accelerate or decelerate forwards. The boat can shoot directly forwards to destroy obstacles and enemies. The player's progress through each level is displayed on a map at the left of the screen. The player loses a life for every obstacle hit, and must restart that screen. Three boats lost and it's game over.
title: River Raid

description:
Food Factory is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move in all directions, and can throw cans of food at monsters. Gameplay is divided into 2 stages. In the first stage, the player gathers cans of food, while avoiding monsters that pop out of holes. After the player has gathered what they believe is enough cans of food, they choose to enter the next level, and try to destroy the monsters that move randomly about by throwing food at them. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Food Factory

description:
Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance! - Episode 1: Escape from Ru is an arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a spaceship that moves in all directions left and right, and can fire horizontally directly forwards. The player tries to destroy enemy spaceships that move horizontally across the screen, while trying to avoid a laser array that moves laterally across the screen shooting a vertical laser field. The player must carefully time their movement through the flashing laser field to avoid destruction. A single hit, and it's game over.
title: Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance! Episode 1 - Escape from Ru

description:
Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance - Episode 2: The Island Search is a 1-player puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must find the Daleks who are hiding on the Island of Nenar to make them reveal the location in time of The Master. The player moves about the island from a top down perspective visiting a number of different houses. One of the houses contains the Daleks, and the player must have the appropriate items to defeat them before encountering them. The other houses on the island provide clues or items to solve the mystery, including special coins and weapons. Some of these items can be traded at other houses.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Wasn't Ready for the Daleks

title: Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance - Episode 2: The Island Search

description:
Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance - Episode 3: The Island Search is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Welcome to the Earth of the future! Your mission in this, the third episode episode of the Doctor Who games, is to locate The Master. He is the one in charge of the alliance. When you questioned the Daleks in Episode 2, you were told that The Master was in Earth's future. With the Tardis, you have gone to the year they specified. Upon arrival, you managed to borrow a skyjet. To avoid anyone spotting the Tardis, you can use the skyjet to fly to the other side of the city.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and can fire forwards. The player tries to shoot incoming asteroids and destroy cities. Each time an asteroid is destroyed, the player moves ahead 1 sector If the player misses an asteroid or is hit, it's game over. The goal is to reach sector 135.
title: Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance - Episode 3: The Island Search

description:
Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance - Episode 4: Planet of Destruction is a 1 player arcade and adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Doctor Who has now arrived on the Planet of Destruction as he seeks out and attempts to put an end to The Master. Contains 4 separate games that must be completed in order:* The Entrance Maze: Move through several screens of a maze looking for the exit before time runs out.

  • Surface Jourey: Sides crolling arcade game where the player must jump over holes in the ground as they approach from the right.
  • Alien Base Adventure: Text adventure with 40 turns to successfully enter the alien base
  • The Enemy Lair: The final battle against The Master, move the Tardis along the bottom of the screen catching pods dropped by The Master
title: Doctor Who in: The Deadly Alliance - Episode 4: Planet of Destruction

description:
Mower Madness is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to clear a field of grass using a small lawn mower while avoiding large robots that move about randomly. The mower can move in all directions, and when the field is clear, the player moves to the next challenge. The number of robots on the field increases as the stage progresses. It's game over if the player hits a robot.
title: Mower Madness

description:
Flying Saucer is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You were the only one around when the flying saucer landed, a scout robot stepped out, and you began to devise a plan to sneak on board and fly the saucer. The player's goal is to enter, explore, and commandeer the alien vessel.

All commands are via VERB NOUN commands, and there is no save/restore feature. All available directions are displayed on the screen.
title: Flying Saucer

description:
Gorf-Land is a 1-player text-based game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The goal is to travel through Gorf-Land, make friends, work to earn money, buy/sell bus passes, floppy disks, watch out for trouble, and generally have a good time. The player's status includes money, bus tickets, floppies, memory, and friends. Memory can be improved by going to school. Work can increase money, and the player can make friends at the community center or wandering the streets.
title: Gorf-Land

description:
Gost Ship is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The goal is to find the treasure of the Gost Ship. The player must explore a number of locations onboard the old wooden ship and solve several puzzles.

All items and available directions are displayed. There is a save/restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Gost Ship

description:
Gravitor is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small spaceship that can turn clockwise or counterclockwise, accelerate, and fire directly forwards. The player has limited fuel for their mission, and this is used for movement or activating shields. The player starts in deep space, and must avoid being pulled into a black hole. The player can visit different planets, where they must fly through tunnels to destroy enemy installations, or attempt to challenge the twisting passages to the reactor on the death base. The player starts with 5 lives and 8000 fuel, and it's game over when all lives are gone or fuel are depleted.
title: Gravitor

description:
Disaster at Sealab is a strategy game for the TRS-80.

The player is in charge of the underwater habitat Sealab, and must try to avoid disaster.
title: Disaster at Sealab

description:
The Head of the Beast is a joystick driven text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Since the Beast came to the Forest of Wilmouth, the land has been filled by all manners of evil. Those who dare venture out at night or roam too close to the Beast's lair return a raving mess, or not at all. His Majesty, the King of Daethnon has declared, has declared that the one who brings him the head of the Beast shall be rewarded the hand of the Princess Shera and one quarter the land of the kingdom. You play as Jon, the woodcutter's son, who has lost both of his parents to the Beast's malice. Steeling your nerve, you set out into the woods to slay the beast.

Unusual for text adventures, all commands are by choosing a verb and noun from menu options using the joystick. There is a save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Found a Match in the Forest

title: The Head of the Beast

description:
Indiana Jim is a graphic adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Indiana Jim has become trapped on an island, hunted by the natives. The player must explore the nearby jungle and mountains to search for items, solve puzzles, and escape to safety.

All commands are graphically displayed at the bottom of the screen, and the player's current inventory items are shown. The player uses the joystick to select a command, and if applicable, can use that command on the screen to interact with items. There is a save/restore feature available.
title: Indiana Jim

description:
Inferno is a graphic adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Starting at the castle, the player explores the nearby lands to solve puzzles.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and items and available directions are displayed on the screen. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Inferno

description:
Patti-Pak is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player maneuvers a character through a maze attempting to eat all of the dots. The player is chased by ghosts, and these become temporarily vulnerable if the player eats one of the power pellets in the corners of the maze. The player can start with 1 - 9 lives. When all pellets are eaten, the player advances to the next level.
title: Patti-Pak

description:
Invasion is a simultaneous 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a small ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires directly forwards. A number of enemies cycle in front of the players, and fire towards the bottom of the screen. Numerous shields offer protection, and the players must fire between these shields to destroy enemies. If a player takes 3 hits, it's game over for that player. The L and R by the scores at the top of the screen indicated the left and right player; this indicates both which joystick port and which side of the playfield the player starts at.
title: Invasion

description:
Orbitroids is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player and their computer opponent are on opposite sides of the screen, where they move vertically and fire horizontally towards each other. Each player gets points by shooting their opponent or hitting the small balls that rapidly orbit around the central point. The ball in the center of the screen slowly counts down from 10 to 0, and with each number, the balls are replaced. The winner is the player with the highest score at the end of the game. There are 5 levels of difficulty.
title: Orbitroids

description:
Monster Mash is a 1-player platformer for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who can move laterally and jump, they also can shoot small fireballs that move diagonally downwards. The player moves through numerous screens looking for gold, while avoiding mummies and bats that fly across the screen. The player must avoid pits, and can use stairs and go through doors to different parts of the castle. The player starts with 8 lives, represented by hearts at the top of the screen. When the player takes a hit, they lose a heart, and have to restart their current screen.
title: Monster Mash

description:
Gnome Quest is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small gnome who moves laterally and jumps. The player tries to jump on all the platforms on a level, which change color as the player walks over them. If the gnome falls off the bottom of the screen, they lose a life. The player moves to the next level if they color all platforms, and starts with 3 gnomes.
title: Gnome Quest

description:
Smurf Quest is an unlicensed 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo based on the Smurfs franchise.

It was a sad day when Gargamell found the smurf village. Papa Smurf barely had time to use his magic before they were all found. Luckily, Papa had three magic diamonds that he used to make the village invisible. Gargamell wasn't very smart, so he left the area. Things were fine for a few days, until a really bad storm swept through the village. Strong winds carried the three diamonds away to an unknown cave. It would only be a matter of time before Gargamell would find the village again, so Hefty Smurf bravely volunteered to retrieve the smurf diamonds before it was too late. The next morning, Hefty sets out to find the diamonds.

The player controls a smurf who moves laterally, and jumps between platforms and climb ladders. The smurf enters new screens by moving off the side or top of the screen, but if they move off the bottom of the screen without using a ladder they lose a life. The goal on each level is to discover the hidden diamond. It's game over if the player loses 3 lives.
title: Smurf Quest

description:
Eldus is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are King Ralum, the newly crowned ruler of Barthen. But, you have lost control of the land, and evil Wrelnins have invaded. Your father, old King Stalte, was the only one who could keep the bat-like Wrelnins away. Now you must find the Pool of Life, to give your father his youth back.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player must collect keys, jewels, fires, and the sword, a total of 21 items. They then must find the pool to win. The player exploring numerous screens while avoiding Wrelnins, which can rapidly damage the player. Doors and caves allow travel between different maps. The player can burn down trees after acquiring fire and the sword. The player has 3 lives, each life has 4 hearts, and the player loses half a life for each Wrelnin hit.
title: Eldus

description:
Jackpot Poker is a 1-player poker game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is dealt 5 cards, and has a single turn to hold or discard. The player can bet $1 - 5 each turn, and return is based upon the final hand. There are timed games or a specific number of turns.
title: Jackpot Poker

description:
Jeweled! is a tile-matching puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player switches jewel positions on an 8 x 8 board. If the rotated jewels form 3 similar jewels in a row, these jewels disappear, and all jewels vertically above these fall towards the bottom of the screen, and new jewels take their place. If the rotated jewels do not form 3 in a row, then their position is reversed. When the player has eliminated sufficient jewels, the player moves to the next challenge.
title: Jeweled!

description:
Joust is a 1-player conversion of the original arcade Joust for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The players take control of a knight with a lance who rides their flying ostrich (or stork, for Player 2) to do battle against computer-controlled knights who ride atop vultures.

Players must flap their steed's wings to hit the enemy from a higher jousting point to destroy the vulture and its rider. Once the enemy has been hit, an egg falls to the the platforms below. The knights must destroy the eggs before they hatch and release new and increasingly more difficult knights. The three strengths of enemy knights are Bounder (red knight), Hunter (white knight), and Shadow Lord (blue knight). Players must also contend with crumbling platforms, lava trolls who attempt to pull knights into the fire, and the unbeatable pterodactyl.
title: Joust

description:
Jumpship is a turn-based game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small triangular shaped that can rotate 360 degrees, teleport a small distance forwards, or warp to a random location on the game map. The player has limited fuel, and the goal is to leave the home base, pick up fuel, and return it to the home base. All gameplay is turn based, and it's game over if the player hits an object or runs out of fuel.
title: Jumpship

description:
Jumpy is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to jump continuously higher by jumping between trampolines, and it's game over if the player falls off the bottom of the screen. Some trampolines give way if the player jumps on them, and others continuously move. The player can also find jet packs, spring shoes, and other boosts to increase the climbing rate.
title: Jumpy

description:
King Tut is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from a top-down perspective, the player explores King Tut's tomb on a mission to retrieve as many of the valuable treasures as they can find. The player can shoot laterally and move in the cardinal directions to defeat enemies that spawn at a number of locations. The player must also find a key in each of the chambers to unlock the entrance to the next, more difficult chamber. Teleporter statues allow the player to rapidly move about the maze. The tomb is guarded by a variety of dangerous enemies, and will cost the player a life if they touch them. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: King Tut

description:
Turtle Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a tank which fires directly forwards and drives about a grid. They confront a number of turtles that scurry randomly about the level laying eggs. The turtles can be destroyed by shooting them, but eggs can only be eliminated by running them over. Eggs quickly hatch into new turtles that further endanger the player by laying more eggs. The player advances to the next level by eliminating all enemies, and loses a life if they contact a turtle. The player starts with 3 lives, and there are 5 difficulty levels.
title: Turtle Attack

description:
Lady Buggy is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a ladybug through a maze trying to collect all of the dots. The player can also collect hearts and letters for bonus points. Enemy creatures stream out of the center of the maze, and the player loses a life if they encounter one. Movable blue doors are located throughout the level, and these can block enemies. Skulls take a player's life or remove an enemy if they come in contact. When all dots are collected, the player moves to the next challenge. The player starts with 5 lives.
title: Lady Buggy

description:
The Lair is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character who walks about a series of twisting passageways and rooms that scroll in all directions trying to collect the Red Gold of Xan. Power items temporarily allow the player the kill the enemies in the maze by walking into them. The player starts with 3 lives, and tries to find all the gold in each large level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two Monsters and a Power Item

title: The Lair

description:
The Lair of the Kraken is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Barely eking out a living as a fisherman, one day you are out rowing when you hear a sweet sound coming from behind a rock. You investigate, and find it's the singing of a group of mermaids. They cast a water breathing spell on you, and drag you beneath the surface to a deep underwater dungeon. You are tasked with exploring the dungeon and battling sea creatures in a quest to find the sword of the Merman Andon. This sword is needed to kill the Kraken.

At the beginning of each game, the player rolls a random character, equipment, and stats. Each turn, the player can move through the passageways and rooms of the dungeon. A map is provided to guide the player. Each turn, the player encounters an enemy that they can fight or run from. Combat occurs automatically, and the player can potentially pick up items or find treasure.

sample_screenshots.caption: Giant Piranha in a Muddy Room

title: The Lair of the Kraken

description:
Laser Tank Duel is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a tank that moves between barricades on a grid. The tanks can fire directly forwards, and the players try to shoot each other for points. A number of balls move around the maze, which block tank shots.
title: Laser Tank Duel

description:
The Laserworm and The Firefly is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a laserworm, which slowly moves in all directions leaving behind a long tail. The player tries to shoot the firefly which floats about the screen. The player has limited time to shoot 5 fireflies, and receives a bonus for time remaining. If the player shoots all 5, they advance to a more challenging level. The player loses a life if they run out of time or hit the firefly.
title: The Laserworm and the Firefly

description:
Lokar's Magic Staff is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are in a chamber with no doors or windows. There are five crystal statues and Lokar's Staff in the room. The staff has three sections, but only one is activated. On each section there are five carvings. You may touch each carving three times before it fades. By touching a different combination of carvings each turn, you must try to activate the entire staff and then use it to get out of the chamber.

Different orders of pressing buttons cause the Staff to activate in a different manner. Wrong button order can cause the player's death. The current status of the Staff is displayed on the screen every 2 rounds. The correct order to activate the staff must be solved by trial and error.
title: Lokar's Magic Staff

description:
The Alchemist's Laboratory is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are in an alchemist's lab in an old castle. There are shelves of chemicals, lead bars, and a mixing bowl. Two sets of shelves are covered with metal grilles. By mixing the chemicals from the first group you can open the grilles covering the other two groups of chemicals. When you have all three groups uncovered, you must try to find the right combination that will give you the philosopher's stone, a magic substance that can turn lead into gold.

Different orders of mixing potions cause different potion effects. Wrong mixing order can cause the player's death. The current potion status is displayed on the screen every 2 rounds. The correct order to mix the potions must be solved by trial and error.
title: The Alchemist's Laboratory

description:
Squeeze is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The aliens are attacking from both sides! You must fight them off the best you can. If you can kill 100 of them before they reach the center of the screen then you have won the game. The screen is divided into 9 rows, and the player moves vertically between rows and can fire either left or right. The enemies move from the sides of the screen to the center, and if an alien reaches the center, the player is destroyed. The aliens move faster every 10 killed, and at higher levels clouds appear on the screen.
title: Squeeze

description:
Lost City, U.S.A. is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player finds themselves lost in a city with very little fuel. The goal is to escape the town and return home before they run out of fuel. The player drives around by typing directions, and can enter various stores throughout town to pick up or use items. The player has limited turns before they run out of fuel.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Lost City, U.S.A.

description:
Lunar Rescue is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a member of the Lunar Rescue Squad, in charge of rescuing lost astronaut explorers. The player attempts to fly a spacecraft from the bottom left of the screen through mountains to rescue a stranded astronaut by lowering a ladder for them, and then travelling to the base at the bottom right of the screen. Gravity constantly pulls the ship down, and the player must use fuel to maintain altitude as well as travel laterally. If the player hits a mountain, runs out of fuel, or hits the astronaut, it's game over. There are 10 levels of difficulty, which determine mountain design and starting fuel.
title: Lunar Rescue

description:
Les Lutins du Mont Rigaud is a graphic adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Every morning and evening, you travel across Rigaud Mountain on the way to work, admiring the animal tracks left on the ground. One rainy summer day you notice strange tracks glistening on a big rock by the side of the road. This leads you on an adventure to explore a hidden fairy world, as you try to discover these shy creatures.

The player explores the local forest and the hidden fairy world. Items can be collected and used, and commands are via VERB NOUN entry.
title: Les Lutins du Mont Rigaud

description:
Marathon is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The game consists of 4 short sidescrolling arcade games all played on a different part of the screen. The player tries to reach the far edge of the screen, while avoiding obstacles as the level scrolls. First the player tries to slide down a hill, then they fly a plane avoiding multiple obstacles, next they drive down a congested highway, and finally they navigate a submarine through an underwater cavern. There are 4 levels of difficulty, and they player receives a score based upon how far they travel in each level.
title: Marathon

description:
Mary and the Bees is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Help Mary Kramer catch as many butterflies as possible without getting stung by bees. The player moves Mary laterally at the bottom of the screen, while bees and butterflies flit randomly about the screen. Mary gains 50 points per butterfly captured, but it's game over if she gets stung by a bee.
title: Mary and the Bees

description: McCheckers is a 2-player modem-based checkers game for the TRS-80 CoCo.
title: McCheckers

description:
Megamunk is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

As a monkey of fortune, you must save the forest of Ledonia from the evil mammoth spiders. The player controls a monkey who climbs on a spider web. There are 11 levels, and the goal is to color the entire web orange by climbing every part of the web. The player must avoid falling coconuts and the spider which chases the monkey about the web. Small birds will randomly land on the web, which can be chased away for bonus points. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Megamunk

description:
Merchant to the Stars is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player travels to 15 different star systems to purchase and sell resources. The player must purchase fuel for each jump between systems, and they have limited resource storage space. The player can be attacked by enemy ships during travel, and must use their weapons systems to protect themselves.
title: Merchant to the Stars

description:
Moon Flight is a Lunar Lander clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to land a small vessel on 1 of 3 landing sites located on difficult terrain. The player has limited fuel to use to accelerate their vessel horivontally or vertically, while gravity continuously pulls the vehicle to the bottom of the screen. The goal is to navigate to the landing site, and carefully land the vessel there. More difficult sites are worth more points, and there are 9 levels of terrain and gravity difficulty.
title: Moon Flight

description:
Mortar Command is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

During World War II, your paratrooper battalion is dropped behind enemy lines to capture several bridges along the Rhine River. Unfortunately, your battalion runs into a Panzer division at one bridge. After a short battle, your battalion retreats. In the confusion, you become separated from the battalion, finding yourself at the far end of the bridge. Looking back across the bridge, you see the German tanks start up to pursue your fleeing battalion. After finding an abandoned mortar hidden in the bushes, you prepare to meet the enemy.

The player controls artillery at the left of a bridge, which can only fire between 90 and 45 degrees towards an incoming tank. The tank drives towards the player, and the goal is to lob an artillery shell onto the tank. Tanks approach one at a time, and each tank approaches more quickly. The player can not move their turret or fire while a shell is in the air. If the tank reaches the end of the bridge, the player loses a life.
title: Mortar Command

description:
Munchkin Blaster is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to shoot down alien vessels by controlling a crosshair. Three types of alien vessels move about and fire at the lasers and fuel tanks at the bottom of the screen. The goal each round is to shoot 20 alien vessels, and the player then receives bonus points for fuel tanks remaining. If both lasers are destroyed, it's game over.
title: Munchkin Blaster

description:
Night of the Ninja is a 2-player fighting game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player moves laterally, and can punch or kick high or low and block high or low. Health is displayed at the bottom of the screen, and a player is defeated when all health is lost.
title: Night of the Ninja

description:
Offender is a 1-player clone of Defender for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player needs to save stranded humans from being abducted by attacking enemy spaceships. They control a ship that can move in all directions, and fires directly forwards. The player plays on a map that scrolls left or right, and loops back on itself. A map at the top of the screen shows the location of alien vessels and humans. Alien vessels attempt to abduct the humans at the bottom of the screen and bring them to the top of the screen. Other alien vessels directly attack the player. The player tries to destroy all enemy vessels before they run out of ships or all humans are abducted.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Fire Off Missiles While Being Destroyed

title: Offender

description:
Ono is an adaption of the card game Uno for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Cards are graphically displayed on the screen, and the player competes against a single computer opponent. Starting with seven cards, the player and computer take turns placing a card on top of the active card, with the goal to play all cards in the hand. There are four card colors and special cards, and the player can play a card that is the same numerical value or color as the currently active card. If no card in the hand is playable, then the player must take a new card from the pile.
title: Ono

description:
Oxxo is a 1-player Reversi game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on an 8 x 8 board against a computer opponent, each player is represented by an X or an O. Each turn, the player must play their piece in a position that allows them to take at least one of their opponent's pieces by trapping them between two of their own. The player who controls the most positions when the board is filled is the winner. There are 2 levels of computer difficulty.
title: Oxxo

description:
Pac-Panic is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates their character through a maze trying to gather all the pellets, while being chased by 4 ghosts. Power pellets can be collected and saved, and can then be utilized as ghosts approach to make them vulnerable. There are 8 levels of game maze difficulty. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Pac-Panic

description:
Pac-Dude is a 1-player Pac-Man clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player navigates their character through a maze trying to gather all the pellets, while being chased by 4 ghosts. Each level has 4 power pellets which temporarily turns ghosts vulnerable, where they can be eaten and sent back to their starting area. When all pellets are eaten, the player advances to the next level with new maze design and more challenging ghosts. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Pac-Dude

description:
Pacdude Monster Maze is a 1-player clone of Pac-Mania.

Played from an isometric perspective, the player moves Pac-Man through a large isometric maze that scrolls in all directions. The player's goal is to eat all the dots while avoiding ghosts, but the ghosts will become temporarily vulnerable if the player eats a power pellet. Pac-Man can jump to avoid enemies, but some ghosts will also jump to intercept the player.
title: Pacdude Monster Maze

description:
Packetman is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Help Packetman through a maze trying to gobble all the dots. Three ghosts move randomly about the maze, and chase the player if they come close. The player loses a life if caught by a ghost, and starts with 3 Packmen. After eating all dots, the player moves to an identical maze with faster moving ghosts.
title: Packetman

description:
Inatak is a 1-player action game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. Enemy ships fly out of the structure at the center of the screen, and begin to move laterally while firing at the player. The player gains points for every enemy ship destroyed. When an enemy ship is destroyed, a new one replaces it so that there are always 3 ships on the screen at a time. The player starts with 3 ships.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Shoot Down an Enemy Vessel

title: Inatak

description:
Pacoman is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Paco as he tries to eat all the dots in a maze while avoiding the four ghosts that randomly move about. There are four power pellets that temporarily make the ghosts vulnerable when Paco eats them. When all dots are eaten, the player moves to the next level. When the player moves along a pathway they have already cleared of dots, they leave a small trail of blue dots behind them. The player loses a life when touched by a ghost, and it's game over when 3 lives are lost.
title: Pacoman

description:
Pelieti is a 1-player action game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player and computer each control a square that moves through a large 2D scrolling maze trying to collect dots. Both players are displayed on a split screen, and the one who has the most dots when all are collected is the winner.
title: Pelieti

description:
Ghost Rush is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player guides a ghost that travels endlessly around a circular track at a constant speed by reversing its direction. The goal is to pick up pellets that appear on the track, and when one is collected a new one appears. The player must avoid dangers including falling spikes and Pac-Man.
title: Ghost Rush

description:
Planet Conquest is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship that can rotate and move in all directions and fires directly forwards. Gravity continuously pulls the ship towards the bottom of the screen. A single alien ship moves about the screen, and the player tries to shoot this down. The player has limited fuel, but can resupply by landing on the flat landing pad at the bottom of the screen. The game tracks how many enemy ships have been destroyed and the number of player ships lost. If the player flies off the top of the screen the level resets. The player starts with 5 ships, and a ship is lost by hitting the bottom of the screen or an alien vessel.
title: Planet Conquest

description:
Pluton Quest is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It is the year 2014, and you are Captain Major Mandrell, deep space flyer for the Federation of Universal Communication. You have undergone many deep space missions. You are summoned by General Robertson for a briefing on your new mission. You have been selected to fly to Pluto to build a communication outpost at the edge of our galaxy. Professor Wong has picked up signals from outside the solar system, and this communication station will enable him to better pick up the signal. The player blasts off in the experimental CSX1 ship, where they must recharge on Mars on the way to Pluto.

All locations are graphically displayed on the screen, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry. The game is divided into two parts.
title: Pluton Quest

description:
Poker Squares is a 1-player card game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a 5 x 5 board, the player draws cards from a deck and places them on the board. Five card running on a diagonal are laid face down on the board, and at certain times one of these cards can be turned over. The goal is to score 5 vertical and 5 horizontal poker hands. The player's final score is the sum of these 10 hands.
title: Poker Squares

description:
Ponk is a 1-player clone of Pong for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a vertically moving paddle on opposite sides of the screen. The goal is to position the paddles to bounce the ball back towards the opponent. Every missed ball grants the opponent a point.
title: Ponk

description:
Proto-7 is a 1-player submarine game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is put in charge of the Proto-7 submarine, an experimental craft that is twice as fast as its opponents and heavily armed. The goal is to evade enemy submarines and destroy the enemy base and return to the rendezvous point. The play area is divided into a 100 x 100 square map, and the player can set 8 possible directions and the speed as stop, half, and full. An overview map shows the player position and all enemy vessels and the tactical map shows the exact location of nearby vessels. The radar pings each turn, with an additional ping for each enemy submarine within radar range. The player has 10 torpedoes which fire in the direction the player is facing. If hit by a single enemy torpedo, it's game over.
title: Proto-7: Mission Beneath Enemy Waters

description:
Across the Rubicon is a World War II based strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls American forces against their German opponent. At the beginning of each game, the player purchases units from a limited resource pool consisting of infantry, light tanks, heavy tank, fighters, artillery, and support units. All tactical commands are via the map window. Terrain, friendly, and enemy units are displayed here. The player can enter movement and attack commands for their units, and can order artillery strikes, parachute drops, and air strikes. The game ends when American forces have fallen to 40% strength or 24 victory points based upon German objective destroyed have been achieved.

Game play is divided into several possible commands or menus. Intelligence report shows the strength and losses of friendly and enemy forces. Reinforcement or Replacement will either bring in fresh troops, or bring in troops from previously destroyed units. The player has a number of reserve points, which can be used to summon infantry reinforcements. Like units can also be merged when both are depleted.
title: Across the Rubicon

description:
Barbarossa: The War in Russia 1941-1945 is a 1-player war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls German forces against their Soviet opponent during Operation Barbarossa. Each unit of time covers 1 month of game play, and different weather conditions are present each month. All German and Soviet units are displayed graphically on the screen. Cities can be displayed with the country currently in control. Each unit gets limited movement points per turn, and each unit has individual strength points.

Combat occurs when German forces are moved near a Soviet unit, and total losses are displayed after combat. Air attacks can be used to reinforce player attacks by asking for airflotte assistance prior to troop movement. Supply, terrain, weather, air power, and blitz affect combat results. Supply points are distributed to all forces, and determine fighting prowess. Supply points are determined by cities captured and surviving until the Spring, while supply points are used by all troop actions and movements.

Game play continues until all Russian cities are captured, total strength of units falls below 75, or the game reaches January 1944. Victory is achieved if all Russian cities are captured.
title: Barbarossa: The War in Russia 1941-1945

description:
Battle for Tunis is a 1 - 2 player wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the Tunisian Campaign of World War II, the player controls either Axis troops against computer controlled Allied troops or a 2-player game pitting human controls Axis and Allied forced against each other.

Played on a large scrolling map of Tunisia, the player controls and moves their named units. Each unit has unique combat strength and moves per turn, and local terrain effects troop movements. Combat occurs by moving a unit onto a square occupied by an opponent. When a unit's strength reaches 0 it is eliminated. Map view provides an overview of the entire campaign and all troop locations. Intelligence view provides information on nearby units.
title: Battle for Tunis

description:
Battle Hymn: The Battle of Gettysburg is a 1-player war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Confederate forces against the Union during the Battle of Gettysburg of the American Civil War. All Confederate and Union units are displayed graphically on the screen. Each unit gets limited movement points per turn, and each unit has individual strength (manpower) and stamina points. The player can review field of fire and direction troops are facing.

Game play occurs on the 2nd day of the 3-day battle, and each turn covers 30 minutes of the battle. Stamina, terrain, and direction troops are facing all have a direct effect on combat results. There are a total of 5 objectives to obtain during the battle to achieve victory.
title: Battle Hymn: The Battle of Gettysburg

description:
CINCPAC: The Battle of Midway is a 1-player strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes on the role of CINCPAC (Commander in Chief Pacific Fleet Headquarters) during the World War II Battle of Midway in June 1942. The player controls American naval forces against the Japanese navy. Each turn, the player controls the course and speed of their fleet, and can launch aircraft from either aircraft carriers or bases where craft are stationed. These sorties consist of torpedo, scouting, or bombing missions, and the player can land their aircraft at different bases. The goal is to seek out and destroy Japanese craft and naval bases during the Battle of Midway. Game play occurs in 1 hour intervals starting on June 4th.
title: CINCPAC: The Battle of Midway

description:
Battle of the Bulge is a 1 - 2 player wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the World War II Battle from December 1944 - January 1945, the player controls either Allied troops against computer controlled Axis forces or a 2-player game pitting human controlled Axis and Allied forces against each other.

Played on a large scrolling map of the Ardennes, the player controls and moves their named units. Each unit has unique combat strength and moves per turn, and local terrain effects troop movements. Combat occurs by moving a unit onto a square occupied by an opponent. When a unit's strength reaches 0 it is eliminated. Map view provides an overview of the entire campaign and all troop locations. Intelligence view provides information on nearby units. Each turn constitutes 1 day of time.

The German objective is to move troops into Liège, Belgium by December 31st or destroy all Allied troops. Allied victory is dependent upon preventing this from happening.

sample_screenshots.caption: German Troop Movement and Artillery Barrage

title: Battle of the Bulge

description:
Bomber Command is a 1-player strategy wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes on the role of commander of the British air force during World War II. From the squadron headquarters menu, the player views the number of new bombers and fighters, total planes, mission target, losses, and targets destroyed. The player receives new aircraft every month based upon the number of German installations destroyed.

From the map view, the player directs their bombers and escort aircraft. The player can change the altitude of their planes, hasten movement, drop bombs, bank the aircraft, and return home. Game play begins in May 1941, and each turn covers one month until the end of the war in May 1945. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Bomber Command

description:
