Final Frontier is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You have been chosen as commander in a struggle to gain control of an unexplored section of the galaxy. Your foe: an alien race called Volsung. Here in the distant future, when space travel has become commonplace, on uncharted star systems you hope to find the raw materials which are vital to your industry and construction of a fleet of space craft.

Game play consists of a galaxy of 30 star systems. The player starts in the upper left, while the Volsungs start in the lower right. Each uninhabited planet can consist of 8 types of star systems, where the player can start either an agricultural, energy, mining, or industrial colony. The player can create 4 types of space ships.

Each turn consists of a meteor shower phase, where all ships in an area of the galaxy are wiped out. Total production is displayed, and the player can earn credits which are used to purchase new vessels. Groups of ships can be moved during the movement phase. Each turn, the player can scan surrounding star systems, and systems can be colonized by moving an explorer ship to that location. The player then chooses which type of colony to form, and can only create 1 colony per turn.

Combat occurs by moving two opposing vessels adjacent to each other. Multiple ships can be brought to bear at once.

There are 3 levels of difficulty which determine the number of game play turns. The player receives a game play ranking at the end of all available turns.

sample_screenshots.caption: Myself and Volsung are Moving Vessels

title: Final Frontier

description:
Company Commander is a squad level strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A World War II tactical-level war game that allows for expansion modules to play a variety of different combat operations. Each mission has set objectives to accrue points. The player controls a small company of soldiers with multiple missions available. Terrain includes roads, clear fields, forests, and buildings.

Each mission is played on a single fixed screen. Player units are represented by letters, and each unit has independent movement points, health, and weapon strength. The player can fire at enemy positions by typing in coordinates of fire. Small arms fire requires line of sight for success, and the player can perform pinning fire to prevent enemy movement or throw grenades at adjacent enemies. Engineering units can throw satchels, attach mines to tanks, and throw smoke to impede enemy line of sight.

Each company has a leader, who can call combined fire from nearby units, apply leadership modifiers to nearby units, or call artillery and airstrikes.

One of the squadron members in each combat is represented by the player. Campaign points are accrued between missions, and the player's character can receive five promotions from corporal to company commander which increase their strength and leadership modifier.
title: Company Commander

description:
Fire One is a 1-player submarine game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played from the view inside the submarine, the player can set the heading, depth, and speed of their vessel. The player can travel via diesel or battery power to determine stealth of their vessel. When near the surface, the player can use their periscope to view 4 directions. The player starts with 10 torpedoes to target enemy vessels, and can use their deck gun when surfaced.

Game play is divided into a 4 x 4 grid consisting of open land and islands. The player receives missions to sink specific vessels. To assist with navigation and locate enemies, the player can view their radar and receive information from local quadrants. When the ship is damaged, the player can effect repairs from the repair menu, allowing for 2 minutes for each repair.
title: Fire One

description:
Guadalcanal is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Warfare features landing operations during the Guadalcanal Campaign of World War II between player controlled American and computer controlled Japanese forces.

Each unit has an individual unit number, combat strength, moves/turn, and duty/experience. Each turn, the player supplies movement and commands for each unit. Units can fire on enemy units, and can also shoot mortars instead of movement. Units can also radio for naval barrages, or call intelligence to help loate nearby Japanese units. The player has a limited number of Seabee units, engineering crew which can be used to clear jungle or construct airfields. Once per turn, the player can provide reinforcements to a remaining unit. American troops received a continued rate of supplies and supply ships, but these must be protected by constructing airbases to allow air defense of supplies. If supply levels drop too low, combat effectiveness of troops is gravely reduced.

Air operations must be coordinated with ground troops, and the player can launch search, interdiction, and cover operations to help locate Japanese forces, attack forces, or prevent enemy attack respectively. These can only be called every several turns dependent upon airfield status. Game play continues until all Japanese camps are captured or field strength falls below allowable level. The player receives a final victory score at the end of game play.
title: Guadalcanal

description:
Kamikaze is a 1-player strategy wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A game of naval combat between Japanese and American aircraft carriers during World War II. Game play occurs between January 01, 1945 and January 08, 1945. Each day is divided into 4 turns set during daylight hours from 0600 - 1800.

The game starts from the bridge view, where the player can view the status of their two aircraft carriers Dolphin and Seminole, and their fighter, dive bomber, and torpedo bomber allotment. The player can view their ships under the flag menu. Map views the gridded map screen, target examines contacts made using radar and search, ready prepares planes for air cover and attack, repair allow fixes to the carriers, and convert allows moving aircraft between carriers.

Most game play occurs from the map view. Radar is used when the player activates the map, and looks for nearby enemy ships and planes. In search, the player sends out aircraft and can evaluate up to 4 squares per turn. The player also can send out 3 picket gunboats to look for Japanese craft each turn, but these are at risk of being destroyed by Japanese air attack. The player institutes air attacks from this menu, and can send any readied aircraft to attack enemy ships within range. Fighter craft can be used to defend from incoming bombers and enemy fighters. At the end of air combat the player can move their fleet.

During the Japanese attack, the player can be attacked by Japanese kamikaze fighters. The player enters an arcade sequence where they control the main gun of their defending craft, and try to shoot down incoming Japanese planes. The player can take a limited number of hits before their ships are sunk. Surface attacks occur if the player's fleet directly encounters the Japanese fleet, and the player can either choose to sacrifice one of their vessels to cover their escape or directly engage in combat with the more heavily armed Japanese force.
title: Kamikaze

description:
Operation Dark Horse is a strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Pits player controlled NATO against Russia's western forces near Berlin during a theoretical Soviet invasion of eastern Europe. Each individual unit has a name, nationality, strength, morale, moves remaining, and mode. Combat occurs when units are moved adjacent. Score is calculated by enemy units destroyed and targets acquired.
title: Operation Dark Horse

description:
Saga: The Sorcerer's Curse is a graphical adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Centuries ago, Arcadia was the capital of a rich kingdom where the good king Alexander ruled wisely. During his reign his wizard Melcior was accused of practicing black magic and was banished from the kingdom. Before he left, however, he swore revenge. Life in Arcadia remained peaceful until one day when the king's beautiful daughter, Princess Jasmine, was kidnapped by the evil wizard's minions and placed under a magic spell. The king sent messengers throughout the land to find brave men to save his lovely daughter. The reward would be her hand in marriage.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. All locations are graphically displayed on the screen. The player has a lamp that must be filled with limited amount of oil, and must regularly return to the dungeon entrance to refill. The player has limited health, which can be lost during combat and other actions, but can be restored by eating good food and drink.

sample_screenshots.caption: Sword and Anvil Stuck in the Mud
A Spooky Ghost Guards a Shield

title: Saga: The Sorcerer's Curse

description:
Galactic Taipan is a 1-player strategy trading game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You've just sunk every cent you own into your own space ship. You're convinced you are as good a trader as any of those you have worked for these last few years. Now, you're going to get a chance to prove it. As you come in for a landing, your first as captain of your own ship, you reflect on the obstacles, both natural and man made facing you.

The player travels between star systems buying and selling goods to turn a profit. From the main menu, the player can view their cargo manifest, access the planet's marketplace, access financial services which allows purchasing a new ship, enacting repairs, or taking out a loan with interest. The player can view local star systems to plan their next trip, and can then travel either fast or slow, which influences fuel consumption and cost, to a new location.

Planets have 4 different development levels, which determine the type of goods they're willing to buy or sell. There are a variety goods available for trade. The player must avoid dangers including space storms that can damage both ships and cargo, and space pirates that can damage your vessel and steal cargo. If the player is sufficiently armed, they can challenge pirates in combat and earn bounties by neutralizing them.
title: Galactic Taipan

description:
Stalin Grad is a strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Set during the Soviet defense of Stalingrad against Nazi Germany during World War II. The player's goal is to try to protect Stalingrad until the end of game play. Each individual unit has a name, strength, and supply level. Combat occurs when units are moved adjacent. The player has infantry, armored and artillery units. Players receive a final score based upon performance during the mission. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Stalin Grad

description:
Waterloo is a 1-player strategy wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the 1815 Battle of Waterloo, the player commands Napoleon's French forces against allied British and Prussian forces. The player individually controls Napoleon, as well as an array of artillery, infantry, cavalry, guards, and skimirshers, each with individual strength, movement points, losses, and abilities. Units automatically engage in combat when adjacent, and artillery can be aimed and fired at distant troops.

French troops gain higher morale and combat prowess when near Napoleon due to his high influence. If Napoleon is lost, the player immediately loses. French units gain combat power when attacking from the north, and to a lesser extent from the east or west. Any units positioned in rough terrain will receive a defensive bonus. Cavalry units can be sent on patrol to view enemy troop movement further up screen, but there is a risk they will not return from their scouting mission.

Two Additional corps can be called in during game play, and the probability of success depends on objectives captured during the expedition. The player can impede enemy troop reinforcements by capturing the objective cities of: Ligny, Nivelles, St. Jean, and finally Waterloo. The goal for decisive victory is to capture Waterloo by day 3 at 6 pm, or within 42 turns. There are 5 levels of game play difficulty.
title: Waterloo

description:
Robotron: 2084 is a 1 - 2 player TRS-80 CoCo conversion of the original arcade game.

Inspired by his never ending quest for progress, in 2084 man perfects the Robotrons. A robot species so advanced that man is inferior to his own creation. Guided by their infallible logic, the Robotrons conclude: the human race is inefficient, and therefore must be destroyed.

You are a mutant human, who by some freak of nature has the ability to shoot energy pulses from his body in eight different directions! Your job is to save humanity from their own creation. The player can move and fire in any of eight directions. You get thrown in a room with various evil baddies strewn about, you've got to kill all the susceptible robots while at the same time finding some way to grab humans and avoid death. Indestructible hulk robots can not be killed, and they seek out and kill humans. Quarks produce tanks, which fire projectiles that bounce around the screen. Brains can reprogram humans into progs, which become enemy units.
title: Robotron: 2084

description:
Run Dino Run! is a single-player side-scrolling arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the Google Chrome browser game T-Rex Runner, the player controls a dinosaur as it tries to jump over cacti and pterodactyls. The player can jump while dangers rapidly approach from the right of the screen. Game play becomes progressively more difficult, and the dinosaur runs until it hits an object.
title: Run Dino Run!

description:
Shiphunt is a 1-player Battleship board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a 9 x 12 board, player moves a cursor to search for 5 hidden ships. Each shot is flagged as a hit or a miss, and the player has a limited number of shots to try to clear the board.
title: Shiphunt

description:
Shoot'n Range is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a firearm that moves laterally on the bottom of the screen, and attempts to shoot targets. The player has limited time to shoot all targets, and must maintain a 50% accuracy to pass the level.
title: Shoot'n Range

description:
Sidney: The Super Space Snake is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The object of the game is to help Sidney escape the floating Electroprison by consuming Electropods. Four teleport panels can move the snake about the maze. Each level, the snake progressively elongates as it picks up Electropods, and loses a life if it hits a wall or its own tail. The player must complete a total of 33 progressively more difficult stages.
title: Sidney: The Super Space Snake

description:
Simply Better Blackjack is a 1 - 3 player blackjack game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players compete against a computer dealer, and can either hit or stand each hand, with the goal to be as close to 21 without going over.
title: Simply Better Blackjack

description:
Sluzzle is a 1-player sliding tile puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player chooses a a picture which is divided into 16 sections and scrambled with 1 block missing. The player must slide blocks to rearrange the picture.
title: Sluzzle

description:
Sneaky Snake is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player maneuvers a rapidly moving snake trying to pick up mugs of root beer. The player must avoid snake pits and hitting walls. Every root beer drank elongates the snake, and adds an additional snake pit. It's game over if the player hits their own tail. There are 5 levels of snake speed
title: Sneaky Snake

description:
Spaced Invaders is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship that moves horizontally on the bottom of the screen and fires vertically. The player battles waves of increasingly more enemy ships, which move horizontally and fire towards the player. The player can fire multiple shots at a time. A single hit, and it's game over.
title: Spaced Invaders

description:
Space Invaders is an unlicensed port of the original arcade source code to the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player must defend the Earth from rows of bomb-dropping aliens. The rows of aliens begin at the right of the screen, and the player controls a laser cannon at the left of the screen. The goal is to earn points by shooting the aliens before they can land. The aliens march back and forth, and each time the end of the screen is reached they will drop one row closer to the bottom. Shoot them all to move to the next harder level. If any aliens reach the bottom of the screen it's game over. A flying saucer intermittently moves across the screen for bonus points. Three shields offer protection from alien fire, but also block the player's shots. The player begins with 5 laser cannons, and it's game over if all are destroyed.
title: Space Invaders

description:
Space Merchant is a 1 - 6 player space trading simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Starting with 500,000 credits, the player chooses to visit 1 of 8 planets each year for trading. The player can purchase 1 of 6 cargo types: medicine, factory tools, furniture, food, farm tools, or clothing. The player can purchase transport type, insurance for their cargo load, and security guards. After setting up the trade, the player can encounter dangers that cause loss of profit.
title: Space Merchant

description:
Mercenary Force is a 1 - 4 player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player is placed at the head of a mercenary organization, and each turn they are given a potential combat mission they can choose to accept or decline. These combat missions show the type of mission and payment on successful completion, their opponents' terrain, troops, type of weapons and armor, and their air support. The player must then use available credits to purchase troops, armor, and aircraft. They must also purchase logistics including food, weapons, medics, life support, insurance, and transportation. After supplies are purchased, the player enters combat and receives results including payment and lost infrastructure and troops.

sample_screenshots.caption: I Forgot to Take Enough Food

title: Mercenary Force

description:
Warrior is a 2-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two warrior chiefs pit their city states against each other. Each player starts with 50,000 subjects, and must distribute all their subjects as soldiers, farmers, tool makers, weapon makers, or scholars. The player has reserves of food, weapons, and tools, which are required for subject efficiency. Players can choose peace, war, or negotiating a trade of resources each turn. During combat, the weaker side takes losses in troops.

Each game lasts 20 turns, or until either side's population becomes twice that of the other. At 20 turns, the player with the largest population wins.
title: Warrior

description:
Yahtzee is a 1 - 9 player text-based implementation of the popular dice game for the TRS-80.

Players take turns rolling five dice, and each turn can choose which dice to keep. The player can reroll the remaining dice for 2 more rounds, keeping the five dice they prefer before choosing their scoring category. Scoring categories include 6 categories within the Upper Section, which include the sum of all ones to sixes. In the Lower Section, the categories include 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, full house, a 4 dice straight, a 5 dice straight, yahtzee (5 of a kind) and chance (which is the sum of all dice). A game is finished when all 11 scoring categories have been used.
title: Yahtzee I

description:
Space Protector is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small ship that can move in all directions and fire directly forwards on a screen that scrolls laterally to the left and right. Enemy alien ships move to the bottom of the screen where they try to contact humans. If they abduct a human, they turn into blue ships that move quickly towards the player. If the player destroys all alien vessels on the screen more immediately appear. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Space Protector

description:
Space Raiders is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a ship at the bottom of the screen that moves laterally and fires vertically forwards. The player confronts a never ending barrage of alien raiders, which move as a group laterally until they reach the edge of the screen, move down, and then reverse direction. Enemy vessels intermittently return fire. When all vessels are destroyed, the player starts a new round with the enemy vessels starting slightly closer. If the raiders reach the bottom of the screen or the player is hit by enemy fire, they lose a life.
title: Space Raiders

description:
Spacewar! is a two player port of the original Spacewar! for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players control spaceships that engage in a dog fight. At the centre of the screen there is a star which pulls the ships constantly towards it. The ships can rotate clockwise or counterclockwise, apply thrust, and fire. Each ship can also release a single mine which moves about the screen. The ships follow Newtonian physics and can use tactics such as a gravity assist. The first player to reach 7 kills is the winner
title: Spacewar!

description:
Space War is a 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a spaceship that can rotate 360 degrees, accelerate, and fire. Each game is timed, and the players try to repeatedly blast their opponent during a limited time frame. A small alien saucer intermittently appears on the screen and fires randomly. Ships wrap to the other side of the screen when leaving an edge. Player gains points for shooting their opponent or the saucer. The ships return to their starting position when one is destroyed.
title: Space War

description:
Spellbound: A Dungeons & Dragons Adventure is a 1-player roleplaying game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The powerful Archwizard is marshalling his forces of evil in the dungeon beneath the Town of Midgard. The forces of light are represented by Ymiro, the leader of the local temple, who strives to gather adventurers to defeat the evil.

At the beginning of each adventure, the player can access numerous locations of Midgard via the menu. The Adventurer's Guild creates new characters. The player creates a party of 6 adventurers from 5 classes: fighter, thief, wizard, priest, or paladin and 4 races: elf, human, dwarf, or gnome, and rolls for statistics. The Unicorn Tavern serves as the meeting place for these adventurers where a party can be gathered. The Library provides information and back story on the game world.

Once a party has been gathered, they can purchase equipment at Elmo's Trading Post, rest and recover at the Green Dragon Inn, purchase healing and level advancement at the Temple of Ymiro, or finally choose to enter the dungeon beneath Midgard.

Once entering the dungeon, game play occurs from a first person perspective in a wire frame maze. The player encounters parties of monsters, where the characters can use items, parry attacks, run away, cast spells, or fight if close enough to an enemy. Each enemy has distance, and can approach or run away from monsters. Experience points and gold from combat can be used to level up the characters.
title: Spellbound: A Dungeons & Dragons Adventure

description:
Spider-Hype is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Spiders bounce about on the screen, and the goal is to trap all spiders in the bottom half within a limited time frame. The player controls the barrier separating the top and bottom halves of the screen allowing it to be temporarily removed.

sample_screenshots.caption: All the Spiders in the Bottom

title: Spider-Hype

description:
Starblaster is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small vessel that can rotate and fire 360 degrees, and can also thrust and decelerate. The player must shoot asteroids and alien space vessels. Each asteroid breaks down into two smaller pieces, which break down again into 2 smaller pieces until ultimately destroyed. After each level is cleared, a new field of asteroids occurs. The player has limited number of temporary shields that can be used to defend the vessel.
title: Starblaster

description:
Star Lanes is a 2 - 4 player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls an investment company that establishes interstellar shipping lanes. Computer opponents can be selected. Played on a 12 x 9 board, each turn the player can choose 1 of 5 randomly selected positions on the grid.

The player can establish a new outpost by selecting a coordinate in the middle of nowhere. A new shipping company is established if a location adjacent to an outpost or a star is selected. This will reward the player 5 new stocks in the company, and each turn the player can buy more stocks in an established company. If a position is selected between two adjacent companies, they will merge under the name of the larger company, and the held stocks will increase in value. A company grows, and stocks prices increase in value, if a position adjacent to an established company is selected. After all spots are chosen, the player who has accumulated the most money is the winner.
title: Star Lanes

description:
Starship Falcon is a graphic adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Six months ago a terrorist group demanded to be designated the rulers of Alpha Sigma III, under the the threat of world starvation on the planet Earth. The Federation denied their demands, so they released a biologic weapon which has destroyed all known edible plant species from throughout the known galaxy. To date, no plant life has been able to survive on Earth. Recently, Federation undercover agents have reported a story told by a roving space trader, of a planet with abundant edible plant life. These plants have a reputation of being able to survive in all climates, and in fact are supposed to grow at an incredible rate. The Federation is desperate! If Earth's food source is not replaced soon, the Federation will have to evacuate all animal and Human life. Your mission is to go to the planet Zephyr and obtain the seed of these plants and return to Earth. Several Federation agents have been sent to obtain the seeds and none have returned!

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry. All areas are graphically displayed on the screen, and there is a save/restore feature. A help feature is available for difficult puzzles.
title: Starship Falcon

description:
Star Trek Adventure #2 is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are Captain Kirk of the starship Enterprise. In response to an emergency request for medical assistance, the Enterprise has orbited the class M planet Tycho IV to deliver vaccine against the deadly Parmelian fever. Because of the vaccine's magnetic properties, you and Dr. McCoy cannot transport it down, but must deliver it by the shuttlecraft Galileo. After delivering the vaccine, Kirk and McCoy are abducted by the Romulans, and must safely escape from the Romulan ship and save the Enterprise.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is no save/restore feature.

sample_screenshots.caption: To the Surface of Tycho IV

title: Star Trek Adventure #2

description:
Stinger is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a bee catcher, who tries to catch all the honey bees in a hive while avoiding the guard bees. The hive consists of 6 concentric counterclockwise rotating circles, each with a number of breaks that the bee catcher can move in and out of as they also rotate counterclockwise within the hive. Also within the hive are a number of guard bees that move at different speeds within the rings. At higher levels, guard bees can move between rings and counterclockwise. The player starts with 6 lives and loses a life if they contact a guard bee or run out of time. When all honey bees are collected, the player advances to the next level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Level 3 has a Counterclockwise Rotating Guard

title: Stinger

description:
Strata is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small horizontally moving paddle at the bottom of the screen. The goal is to bounce a ball to hit and destroy all the blocks on the screen. Each round, the blocks start 1 row lower. If the player misses a bounce they lose a life. Bounce type, paddle width, and ball speed can be customized.
title: Strata

description:
Strip Tails is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Designed to be played by a male and female partner, each player controls a small flashing square that moves on the screen leaving a progressively longer tail. If a player touches the tail of either of the blocks or the outer wall, the other player gains a point.
title: Strip Tails

description:
Strip Tease is a mathematical guessing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A naked woman is hidden behind a sign, and the player repeatedly guesses the numbers 1 - 3. The answer is randomized each guess. If the player guesses correctly the sign lowers, but if incorrect the sign raises. The goal is to completely expose the lady and win the game.
title: Strip Tease

description:
Super Master Mind is a 1-player number guessing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to guess a 4 - 7 digit code within 10 turns. There are 6 - 8 different colors depending on difficulty. Each guess, the player is told how many numbers are correct, and how many are in the correct position.

sample_screenshots.caption: No White, Black, or Blue in this Code

title: Super Master Mind

description:
Super Rooter is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a sewer rooter, trying to clean the sewers beneath New York City. The player has limited time to gather all garbage clogged in the sewers, and can move their rooter in all directions and withdraw backwards. Large pieces of garbage can float through the pipes, and if they strike the side of the rooter the player loses the device. The player can remove floating garbage if they move the front of the rooter directly into the floating garbage. If the player cleans all pipes an opening to the next level down appears. It's game over when the player loses 5 rooters. There are 9 levels of difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: Opening to the Lower Levels Opened

title: Super Rooter

description:
Swell Foop is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Played on a 16 x 11 grid consisting of blocks of 4 separate colors randomly distributed, the goal is to successfully remove all blocks from the screen. Blocks can only be removed if they are adjacent to another block of the same color, thus removing 2 or more blocks from the puzzle at a time. Blocks vertically above fall downwards as lower blocks are removed. When an entire column is removed, all blocks to the right move over 1 row.
title: Swell Foop

description:
Talking Battleship is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player competes against the computer on a 10 x 10 board. The player and computer places 5 vessels, and opponents take turns firing at the enemy to try to find and destroy the others' ships. Requires the Real Talker voice synthesizer cartridge to play, allowing the player to hear the computer commands.
title: Talking Battleship

description:
Tank Out is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo

The player and computer each control a tank which can rotate 360 degrees, drive forwards, and fire forwards. The goal is to shoot the opponent, and a point is earned each time the enemy is hit. Tank shells can bounce a short distance off the outer walls of the level.
title: Tank Out

description:
Tank Gunner is a 2-player artillery game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a tank positioned on opposite sides of a mountain. The players set the angle of their turret and fire, trying to hit their opponent. Wind effects complicate aiming.
title: Tank Gunner

description:
Temple of the Lost Ark is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player explores a series of nondescript underground caverns to recover the Lost Ark. Dangers include snakes, trolls, and pits.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a help system to navigate the game's puzzles.
title: Temple of the Lost Ark

description:
Thumb Puzzle is a sliding block puzzle for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to sort the number 0 - 23 on a 5 x 5 grid with 1 tile missing. A tile can be slid into any empty spot. The time and number of moves to solve the puzzle is tracked.
title: Thumb Puzzle

description:
Trickashay is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players each control a tank that can move in the cardinal directions and fire directly forwards. Played in a series of hallways with a 7 x 5 array of riccochet blocks in between, each player gains 10 points if they shoot their opponent. When a player shoots a ricochet block, the shot bounces at 90 degree angles between blocks until it moves off the screen. When a block is hit, the ricochet direction reverses.
title: Trickashay

description:
Trubble is a 2 - 4 player electronic implementation of the board game Trouble for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The goal is to be the first to move 5 colorful marbles around a board from the starting position to the final position. The player must roll a 6 to move their marble from the start position. If a player moves their marble to the same position of an opponent, that marble is returned to the starting point.
title: Trubble

description:
Tunnel Landing is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a lander that can move laterally and accelerate upwards. Gravity constantly accelerates the device downwards. The player must navigate a series of tunnels to reach the underground landing pad before they run out of fuel. The player starts with 5 landers, and if the lander touches the tunnel walls it explodes.
title: Tunnel Landing

description:
Mine Rescue is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A terrible disaster has just occurred in the deep dark caverns of the Calico Mines. Bad air has leaked into the five mine shafts after dynamiting for a new motherload. Many miners have been overcome by toxic gasses. You must get tanks of fresh oxygen to each miner before it's too late!

Played on a large scrolling map, the player braves multiple dangers, and can jump and throw their pickaxe to defeat creatures. The miner has limited oxygen for each expedition, and can refill their own tank at the starting point, and must return there when all stranded miners have been rescued. Only 5 oxygen tanks can be carried at a time, and more can be obtained from the mine office. Gems and gold nuggets can be gathered along the way for bonus points.
title: Mine Rescue

description:
Whatzit is a 1 - 2 player scrambled word game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player receives 10 scrambled words 1 at a time, and has 10 seconds to correctly type the right word. Points are awarded 0 - 1000 based on how quickly the puzzle is solved. The player with the highest score after 10 words is the winner.
title: Whatzit

description:
Wheel of Money is a 2 - 4 player Wheel of Fortune game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player takes a turn spinning a wheel, which can land on a money value, lose a turn, or bankrupt. The players guess letters from blanks on a board, and the first player to correctly guess the word or phrase wins money for the round. Vowels costs money to purchase, while consonants reward money.
title: Wheel of Money

description:
Wild Party is an adult-themed text game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Designed for at least 2 consenting heterosexual couples, the game recommends erotic activities for a party. There is an option for mild or wild settings, and for a short, medium, or long party.
title: Wild Party

description:
Killerhawk is a 1-2 player space strategy war game that can be played over the modem.

Each player controls a spaceship that can move in the 4 cardinal directions. The ship has limited fuel, and must replenish at the 2 star bases on the screen. Fuel is used by firing weapons, movement, or using the cloak. Weapons can only be fired directly forwards. The cloak makes the ship invisible to the enemy for 5 turns. Ships can also lay a single mine to damage their enemy. Ships can only mine and fire when visible. Each ship can receive 300 damage before being destroyed.
title: Killerhawk

description:
Wimpy is a 1-player spaceflight game for the TRS-80 CoCo

You are a passenger on the starliner Wimpy, heading to wherever the first year navigator manages to find port. Things haven't looked too good on this trip as the food supply was mistakenly swapped with that of a swine transport. Things turn worse when a siren sounds. The ship has collided with an asteroid and everyone is heading to their escape pods. Unfortunately, this ship is outfitted with Personal Escapemods Version 1 by Fat Chance, Inc., the biggest hunk of junk ever put together.

The game window is divided into a large front view, and 4 separate panels that provide top/bottom and side views of the vessel. The screens will show the location of dreaded Hugons, so the player can try to avoid them. The escape pod has limited fuel which is drained by acceleration. The player's shields take damage by getting rammed by Hugons, and if they take too much damage the ship is destroyed.
title: Wimpy

description:
X Rated Adventure is an adult-themed text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player receives a note in a bar about an unnamed girl who has been captured and tied up. The player must explore bars, old hotels, and other seedy locations to find the damsel in distress. The player faces dangers including drunks, pimps, and lesbians. All commands are via verb noun entry, and all verbs must be abbreviated to 3 letters. There is no save/restore feature..
title: X Rated Adventure

description:
Xenocide is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player's goal is to destroy all 36 cities on an alien planet. The player's ship circles around the planet, and attempts to drop bombs that arc towards the surface. If a domed city is hit, it is destroyed, and the city fires a corbomite missile in response. The player then enters a 1st person view where the missile streaks towards the player. The player controls a crosshair, and tries to shoot the missile down. If the missile hits the player, it's game over. The player has limited oxygen (time), fuel, and bombs to complete their mission. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: Xenocide

description:
Xmas Rush is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player attempts to slip into a forest, grab the last Christmas tree, and safely escape the forest while avoiding the attacking snowmen. The player can move in all directions, and each time they safely escape the forest an additional snowman awaits to hinder the player. The game tracks the number of attempts, seizures, and safe escapes.
title: Xmas Rush

description:
Rahul's Quest: Search for the letter of LOVE is a 1-player action game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Rahul is looking for the letter of love in a large ice maze. Rahul can run left and right, climb up and down ropes, and jump. Because of the slippery ice, Rahul continuously moves, and only takes a break if positioned moving into a wall. The player must avoid falling down holes or being hit by random objects that fall from the top of the screen. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Rahul's Quest: Search for the letter of LOVE

description:
Gnome Quest II: Firespire is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

When the celebration was over, Tel Hilar returned to his hut for the night. It had been terrific. Tel was a hero for returning the Spirit Sword to the Gnome village. Now his father the king sought his aid in recovering the Firespire. There were three weapons in all, stolen by the evil wizard Jerane. The wizard's plan for dominance was being realized until Tel recovered the first piece of the three Gnome weapons, the Spirit Sword. The Firespire and Wind Crystal were still in the hands of Jerane. The Firespire was believed hidden near the Rogtheon Monuments, formerly forts during the days of the Troll Wars, but now abandoned.

The player traverses a number of rooms from a side perspective. The player can exit off the side of levels, and can also exit through a number of floors. Dangers including bouncing monsters, fireballs, and bubbles must be avoided. The player can collect items including keys for unlocking doors, jewels, and additional jump power. Jewels can be collected, and used to purchase increased jump power, extra lives, or extra continues.
title: Gnome Quest II: Firespire

description:
Crionaut Warrior 3 is a 1-player maze game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to move through a maze from a 1st person perspective, but always looking to the north. The player will sometimes be stopped by Crionaut Warriors, who can only be destroyed by lining up the vertical and horizontal lasers at the top right of the screen so they hit the flashing enemy. The total time to escape the maze is recorded.
title: Crionaut Warrior 3

description:
Destination: Unknown is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Your car has blown out a tire on a desolate country road. You must seek to repair your car or find a new one to reach your destination. Explore the local fields and woods in search of items to help you.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Destination: Unknown

description:
Snak Shak is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player runs a snack shop at an American football game. The player has the length of the football game to try to sell as many snacks as possible. The player must balance their time between waiting on customers, filling the soda machine, preparing popcorn or coffee, and filling cups with ice. If the shop does not have what the customer is looking for, that customer is lost. If the customer line is too long, customers are lost.
title: Snak Shak

description:
Search for the Lost Treasure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You start out in the woods searching for the lost treasure of the famous King Erik. The player must beware of dangers including cobras and evil wizards, and explore old houses, taverns, stores, and caves.

All commands are via verb/noun entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Search for the Lost Treasure

description:
Country Club Adventure is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are due at the country club by noon. To make matter worse, someone stole your club pass card. The player can check the time at any point, and has a limited amount of time to complete the adventure. The player must explore their home and the surrounding neighborhood in search of the lost card.

All commands are via verb/noun entry, and there is no save/restore feature.
title: Country Club Adventure

description:
Robocrook is a text adventure for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are a cop on the trail of a robotic criminal. You must explore the nearby city to track down the criminal and bring him to justice. The player meets a variety of pop culture celebrities and characters from the late 80s and early 90s.

All commands are via verb noun entry. There is no save/restore feature.
title: Robocrook

description:
Aliax is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a digging robot that tries to descend into the ground. The robot can dig dirt to descend deeper, or can jump to higher ledges. Monsters roam underground, which can be defeated by digging the square they're in. Each screen is timed, and it's game over if the screen isn't cleared in time. The player starts with 3 lives.
title: Aliax

description:
Snow Ski is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player moves a downhill skier left and right, but also speeds up and slows down, as they try to avoid numerous incoming obstacles. If the player hits a rock, telephone pole, tree, or other danger, the skier loses their skis skidding down the mountain. Hit 3 obstacles, and it's game over.
title: Snow Ski

description:
Cavern Quest 2 is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo

You are Jumpin' Joe Davis, a fearless archaeologist in search of the lost treasure of the Baldana civilization. There are seven lands of the Baldanas to explore.

The player can move left or right, and can move between above ground and below ground levels by using ladders. The player can also jump over dangers they encounter, including: monkeys, spike traps, and pools of water. The player starts with 3 lives, and it's game over when all are lost.
title: Cavern Quest 2

description:
B.E. Break-In is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

You are the Break-In commander. Your mission is to break into the Blast Earth base on Demarus 9. Blast Earth is an alien organization designed to destroy the Earth. Word of their terrible plan has reached Earth Force leaders, and you have volunteered to try to break into their base and destroy all the power they intend to use for their attack.

The player controls a paddle which moves horizontally at the bottom of the screen, with the goal of bouncing a ball into the blocks above. Blocks are destroyed when hit by the ball, and the goal on each level is to clear all blocks. There are 3 bonus stages on levels 3, 6, and 9, where the player tries to catch falling power orbs for extra points. When a ball falls off the bottom of the screen, the player loses a life.
title: B. E. Break-In

description:
Video Pinball is a 1 - 4 player pinball game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls two flippers at the bottom of the screen. The player can modify the location of edge bumps, circle pops, edge pops, and knock outs.
title: Video Pinball

description:
Alpha Search is a 1 - 2 player educational game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small saucer that moves laterally. The ship can move vertically by landing on one of the 3 colored elevators that constantly move up and down. The goal is to collect all letters of the alphabet in the minimal amount of time. If a letter that is already collected is selected, that letter is lost.
title: Alpha Search

description:
Quizspin is a 2-player trivia game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players take turns spinning for the topic and monetary value of a question. The player can choose from 3 questions worth $50 or $100. Topics include: Math, States and Capitals, U.S. Presidents, Chemistry, or a Mystery Topic. Players take turns spinning and answering questions, and the first player to reach a value from 500 - 9000 points is the winner.
title: Quizspin

description:
Treasury Pak is a compilation of 30 previously released TRS-80 CoCo games.

It contains the following: Alcatraz II, Artillery Duel, B-Invaders, Battlefleet, Battletrek, Boom or Bust, Colorout, Color Trek, Concentrate, Cosmic Superbowl, Croid, Dungeon of Aritma, Ecod, Eyewitness, Game of Life, Grabbitt, Hang Twelve, Kadoink, Klondike, Laser Command, Lemons, Lothar's Labyrinth, Oil Magnate, Reno, Saipan, Space Hogs, Space Traders, Tiny Calc, Whirling Dervish, Yahtcc.
title: Treasury Pak

description:
Viking II is a 32k remake of the 1 - 4 player Viking for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player takes control of an independent city state starting in the year 750, with the goal to outperform their neighbors over a number of years. Each year, the player must allocate resources to maintenance and growth of their grain production, as well as their fishing fleet. The goal is to promote population growth by adequately managing resources. Rats pose constant danger to grain stores, and losses can be minimized by maintaining a healthy population of ferrets. Guards can help protect fishing fleets and the population. The player has to raise taxes to pay for their expenditures. The player can enhance their city by purchasing fishing boats, markets, armories, temples, adding onto their hall, and more acreage. If the population is overly exploited they may revolt, causing great damage to resources and infrastructure.
title: Viking II

description:
F-16 High Performance Instrument Flight Simulator is a flight simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes control of the cockpit of an F-16 aircraft. The game is designed as a realistic simulation of the aircraft, and the player must monitor their fuel, landing gear, flaps, thrust, angle, and pitch. The player can control the sensitivity of the aircraft, and can try to follow checkpoints.
title: F-16 High Performance Instrument Flight Simulator

description:
Ockywoky is a 1-player puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player is hunting for the mysterious criminal Dr. Ockywoky to try to bring him or her to justice. The player travels to 17 different cities where they can interview up to 5 informants. Each informant may provide information on the location of Dr. Glimm's headquarters, details on the identity of Dr. Ockywoky, or one of the 3 digits for the passcode to Dr. Glimm's secret safe. Each time the player travels or visits an informant it uses the player's limited time and money. If the player can't identify Dr. Ockywoky and open the safe in time it's game over. If the player incorrectly guesses the identity of Ockywoky or inputs an incorrect passcode, it's game over. There are 4 levels of difficulty.
title: Ockywoky

description:
Juno is a 1 - 2 player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Embark on a daring trek into deep space as you battle wave after wave of menacing aliens sent out by the evil lord Hakmera Chinuk.

The player controls a ship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. Alien ships move about in the top layer of the screen, where they can't be hit, but demonstrate where on the battlefield they'll appear. Enemy ships then appear and swoop and fire towards the player. The player starts with 3 lives, and has limited time to clear each wave of enemy attackers.
title: Juno

description:
Fleau is a French-language text adventure with graphics for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts in the woods, and explores a number of directions.

All available directions are displayed on the screen. All commands are via VERB/Noun entry. There is a save/restore feature.
title: Fleau

description:
Leo is a 1-player action game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a tank that starts in the top left of the screen, and tries to reach a goal point on the screen. The level is divided into a number of platforms, and the turret of the tank can be rotated 180 degrees. The player starts with 10 shots, and can destroy platforms to travel to lower levels. The player is chased by Leo, a large face that moves directly towards the player destroying everything in its path. If the player is caught by Leo, it's game over. The player can choose to exit their tank and try to make a sprint towards the goal point.
title: Leo

description:
Night of the Living Dead is an interactive novel for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Things don't seem to be going your way. The fall semester starts tomorrow, but it looks like you're going to miss your first day of classes. You are hopelessly lost and have run out of gas. It is beginning to get dark, and the recently deceased are returning to life with an insatiable appetite for living human flesh.

Joined by Sheena, who you recently picked up hitchhiking, the player must survive numerous gruesome zombie attacks during the night. The player starts out in a church and the surrounding graveyard, and makes their way through an old farmhouse and farm.

There is a save/restore feature, and all commands are via VERB NOUN entry.

The first player to submit a complete solution for the adventure was awarded $500.
title: Night of the Living Dead

description:
Wheel of Fortune is an unlicensed version of the TV game for 1 - 6 players.

Each player takes a turn spinning a wheel, which can land on a money value or bankrupt. The players guess letters to fill blanks on a board, and the first player to correctly guess the word or phrase wins money for the round. A player is allowed to spin again if they correctly guess a letter. Vowels costs money to purchase, while consonants reward money. There are 4 word categories and difficulty can be increased by mirroring words.
title: Wheel of Fortune

description:
Computerized Bingo is a bingo game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The program calls out random numbers for standard bingo game. Allows for round robin tournament or single games. Comes with 40 physical bingo cards,
title: Computerized Bingo

description:
Rainbow Forest is an arcade game for young children.

The child flies their flitterbug across the screen, landing on green sprouts to transform them into shimmering rainbow trees. When the rainbow forest is fully grown, a treasure chest full of glittering goodies appears, spreading glittering treasures throughout the forest. The flitterbug must then collect each treasure to place it back in the treasure box to complete the level.
title: Rainbow Forest

description:
So Big, So Small is an educational game for young children the TRS-80 CoCo.

Contains 2 educational games:

  • So Big, So Small: Children select a shape, and then manipulate the color and size of that shape.
  • Jesse's Color Bugs: The young child presses the keyboard to listen to tunes and watch color bugs skitter across the screen.
title: So Big, So Small

description:
Space Zapper is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a space station at the center of the screen that can rotate their turrent to the 4 cardinal directions. Enemy space ships appear in these directions and fire towards the player. The player can shoot down incoming missiles and gains a point for every alien ship destroyed. Some alien ships rapidly circle the space station, and the player must shoot them down before they fire towards the player. If the player is hit it's game over.
title: Space Zapper

description:
Galactic Hangman is a 1 - 2 player word puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player has been kidnapped and sentenced to hang on an alien planet. The player must guess letters to solve a word before they make 8 mistakes and are hung. The player is not penalized for trying to use the same letter twice. If the player solves the word, a spaceship warps in and beams the player to safety. The player can create their own words or use a prearranged list of several hundred words.
title: Galactic Hangman

description:
747C Flight Simulator is a Flight Simulator for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Designed as a detailed flight simulator for the large passenger aircraft, the player takes control of the the cockpit, and tries to successfully take off and land the aircraft. The player's altitude and air speed is displayed on the screen, as well as the heading, fuel, and radar. There are 3 levels of difficulty.
title: 747C Flight Simulator

description:
Golf is a 36 hole golf simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

An overview of each hole and the golfer's position is displayed on the screen. Holes have fairways, trees, sandtraps, and greens. The player selects their club and type of shot by typing a 3 character code to choose from 9 different clubs, which determine how far a shot will go, and whether they want to shoot short, medium, or long with that club. A directional marker is then rotated around the player's position to choose the shot direction, and the ball can be seen moving on the screen. The goal is to reach the hole in as few shots as possible, and the game tracks shot count over 36 holes.
title: Golf

description:
Box Shoot is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls an arrow that moves vertically at opposite sides of the screen. Both players try to shoot at a box positioned in the middle of the screen. Each time the box is hit, it moves to a different position in the middle. A bar at the bottom of the screen shows the score for each player, and the first player to take full control of the bar is the winner.
title: Box Shoot

description: Zero Hour is a mashup of game genres. It's a platform game with a few puzzle elements and a sense of adventure thrown in. Your mission is to infiltrate the site at ground zero, avoid the surveillance robots and disable the security sensors on each of the 12 levels to gain access to level 13 where you must disarm the nuclear bomb before the countdown timer expires. Written specifically and exclusively for the Tandy Color Computer 3, the game is designed for a standard 6809 CPU but will utilize a 6309 CPU if it detects it to provide an approximate 10% speed boost. (Source: official web site)
title: Zero Hour

description:
The Great Word Game is a 2 - 4 player word puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players compete to outguess their opponent's words. Each player chooses an English word up to 12 characters, and can't use proper names or hyphenated words. Players guess letters one at a time, and if the word has the same letter more than once, then they're revealed from left to right. The players can also add and guess blank spaces. Players gain 10 points for each letter correctly guessed, and 50 points for guessing the last letter of a word. Players gain 10 points for each unrevealed letter plus a bonus if a word is guessed correctly, but loses 50 points if incorrectly guessed. When one player solves a word, the other has 2 turns to guess their word, otherwise the successful solver gains a further bonus.
title: The Great Word Game

description: Aliens have been raiding Earth and abducting its population. Destination: to be transported to their native planet and become a source of food. Your mission is to oppose them and bring the fight back to their home world and stop the onslaught. Gunstar is a vertical scrolling shoot 'em up that spans four levels of play, beginning on earth and journeying through space, to the extraterrestrial base, where the player will have to confront the alien overlord. Your craft is equipped with a basic missile system, and throughout the levels upgrades can be obtained. There are also energy capsules to gather to power up your smart bomb that damages everything hostile on screen. Apart from lesser alien vessels, you will be encountering boss aliens with more complex attack patterns, also requiring a lot more damage to take out. The game features a point system and high scores will be saved onto the high score table.
title: Gunstar

description: You are an emoji. You find yourself confined in some sort of bottomless pit, endlessly scrolling as you fall downwards. How long can you last? Water Fall is a simple arcade game with just one character, your protagonist, with randomly generated scrolling platforms and colored pellets. Your goal is to always land on a platform, avoid the pits and move fast enough so that you won't be caught between a platform and the top of the screen. Also, collect as many pellets as you can along the way. Pellets come in different colors each with its corresponding point value. Additionally, every second or so that passes awards you with points, so the longer you survive, the higher the score. The game gradually picks up speed and platform patterns become more challenging, culminating in an unavoidable game over. The control mechanics are extremely simple, there's no jump button and you can only move left or right to land on platforms below. Visually, there are a couple of notable features. The game runs on low resolution semigraphics and there's some (Choppy) backdrop parallax scrolling. When it comes to audio, the game only supports the Tandy Speech and Sound Cartridge if your computer is equipped with one, playing a simple tune and a few phrases in synthesized voice, e.g. when you pick up a pellet the game announces aloud the number of points made.

sample_screenshots.caption: You are the white emoji and there's a green pellet on the bottom right platform.
Got crushed by the top left platform.
Two purple pellets. The bottom one will be tricky to reach.

title: Water Fall

description: Pop Star Pilot is a cutesy side scrolling shooter with a twist. Instead of fighting enemy vessels and installations you have a different task: Pop as many balloons as you can and avoid collision with the terrain. Your aircraft is equipped with a single shot gun and can be upgraded to burst shots for a limited time by bursting the red balloons. Your fuel gauge is steadily depleted and can be replenished by shooting stationary fuel tanks. White and green balloons are for points only. Strewn across the first four levels are tokens, and shooting a set number of them will unlock the fifth and final level. The stage layout progressively moves on from urban areas to narrow tunnels and more.
title: Pop*Star Pilot

description: Neutroid 2.015 is a remake of Neutroid II, with revamped graphics, and toned down difficulty. Additionally, this release incorporates a different screen mode to fix its predecessor's incompatibility with the Tandy CoCo 3. The gameplay is unchanged: You control a particle and move across a grid, collecting green and orange particles. Your sprite is constantly moving and can only be made to take left of right turns with your joystick, there's no direct directional control. Colliding with the harmful white particles, laser beams and the top or bottom of the screen causes damage. Collecting an orange particle will enable you for a few seconds to chase and consume a white particle for an energy boost. Once you pick up all, you move on to a more challenging level.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game will detect if your CoCo is a model 3, and will prompt you to choose your video output.
Game over and high score entry (Tandy CoCo 1)

title: Neutroid 2.015

alternate_titles.title: Maze Race and Capture the Flag!

description:
Mazerace & Capture the Flag! are two 1 - 2 player games for the TRS-80 CoCo.

In Mazerace, the player moves their character through a large randomly generated maze to try to reach the exit point. The game tracks how long it takes to reach the exit. In a two player game each player competes for the lowest time.

In Capture the Flag!, 2 players or 1 player versus the computer try to move across a randomly changing hexagonal board to reach the flag at the right of the screen.
title: Mazerace & Capture the Flag!

description: 4K Invaders is yet another rendition of the classic arcade Space Invaders, this time made to fit in 4Kbytes of BASIC. There are rows of hostile aliens flying over your ground defense gun and shooting at you while slowly approaching. Acting as a means of defense, four barriers absorb a finite number of shots before disintegrating. You can move left, right and shoot at the enemies and your task is to dispatch every single one before they reach your position, which ends up in a game over. When a stage is completed, a new one begins with raised difficulty.

sample_screenshots.caption: The simple title screen. Strangely, the title only says "Space Invaders"
Almost halfway to clear the first wave of baddies.

title: 4K Invaders

description:
Somewhere in the future, technology has advanced to a stage where citizens can enhance their brain functions by installing electronic implants inside their heads. Millions of people have undergone surgery as a means to become mental superhumans. As it turns out, these devices are actually a method of mind control for the corporations to affect how people think and act. You are a gunman who's had enough of that. Your job is to infiltrate the headquarters of one such corporation and assassinate the chairman and orchestrator of this conspiracy.

Gate Crasher is a first-person shooter, not unlike Wolfenstein 3D. You wander through the halls and corridors of a five-story office building, armed with a firearm, taking out armed henchmen in black suits and making sure not to hurt innocent programmers (Dressed in white shirts). There are bullets and first aid kits strewn about the complex, to replenish your ammo and health. Also, there are electronically locked doors whose code must be decoded (In some sort of puzzle minigame) and computer terminals to destroy before you can move to the next floor. Technically, the game features 360 degree motion and digitized sound effects.
title: Gate Crasher

description: A homebrew Pac-Man clone, closely following the arcade classic, both in appearance and gameplay. The screen layout has been altered, with the playfield at the center and scores, lives etc. on either side. A great deal of attention has been paid to replicate the original's control mechanics and how the ghosts behave.
title: Pac-Man: A Tribute to the Great Game

description:
Laser Star is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players fly their spaceships in all directions, trying to shoot each other with laser blasts. There is also a large Alien Asteroid Control Station in the center of the screen, which fires off laser blasts in random directions. The goal is to blast the opponent as many times as possible without taking return fire.
title: Laser Star

description:
Helo Battle is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a large helicopter, and tries to drop bombs directly into the fortress at the bottom of the screen. The fortress returns fire, and bombs explode in the air, destroying the helicopter if too close. A sneaky guy can approach from the side of the game and fire at the player. If the player is hit, they restart the game.
title: Helo Battle

description:
Block Buster is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a paddle that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen. The goal is to bounce a ball to prevent it from falling off the bottom of the screen, and to try to break the blocks at the top of the screen. There are 15 levels of difficulty which control ball speed.
title: Block Buster

description:
Force Field is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The aliens are attacking Earth's force field. The player controls a small spaceship that moves laterally at the bottom of the screen, protected by a force field. The ship can fire vertically upwards. Five alien vessels appear at a time, and when an alien touches the shield 1% of total power is lost. When all aliens are destroyed, an identical new wave of enemies appear.
title: Force Field

description:
Laser Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a laser cannon at the bottom of the screen with a crosshair, and must defend their six cities from incoming missiles and cruise missiles. The player has limited laser blasts per barrage, and receives five points for each remaining shot and 100 points for each surviving city at the end of each round. Each round has more incoming missiles, and it's game over when all cities are destroyed.
title: Laser Attack

description:
Starbase Attack is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player aims their pulse-firing laser with a crosshair, and tries to shoot either incoming warheads or asteroids. The player must defend their base long enough so that the docked spaceships can blast off, safely evacuating the planet. If the domed cities or awaiting rockets are hit, it's game over. There are two levels of game speed.
title: Starbase Attack

description: Cosmic Ambush is a vertically scrolling shooter, visually reminiscent of mid-eighties coin-ops. There is no backstory whatsoever, just your spacecraft taking on countless enemy vessels flying in different patterns and formations. Power-ups show up frequently and shooting one will upgrade your gun one step up. In contrast, taking a hit will degrade your firepower. You have a health bar which is depleted as you sustain damage and replenished when you fly over specific recharge fields. When your health bar is gone you lose your only life and start over.
title: Cosmic Ambush

description:
Diggem is an arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a round smiley face that digs about underground. They are chased by two square faces that always move towards the player. The player digs through the ground to collect ground plants. Each plant is worth 100 points. The player can defeat enemies by causing the plants to fall on the squares. This action is worth 1000 points each. If both enemies are destroyed the player moves to the next identical level. The player starts with three lives.
title: Diggem

description:
Driveway is an arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small car that moves laterally as obstacles scroll from the bottom of the screen. The computer tracks how many obstacles they've hit. There are three levels of difficulty, different speeds, and the option for invisible cars.
title: Driveway

description:
Mind Boggle is a Mastermind variant for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to determine the correct position and color of four spaces in an unknown pattern. Each color is used only once. The player has six colors they can place, and each turn they are told how many pieces are in the wrong position in the puzzle, and how many are in the correct position. There is a maximum of 10 turns to solve the puzzle.
title: Mind Boggle

description:
Flag Capture is a 2-player puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Two players hide a flag and bomb within a 6 x 10 grid. The player tries to find the flag without hitting the bomb, and gets a clue to its location with each move. The player gains points for flags captured, and loses points for encountering bombs. Players can choose stationary or migratory flags. The first player to 100 points is the winner.
title: Flag Capture

description:
Hangman is a puzzle game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player has seven attempts to guess a word that is shown initially by blanks. Each successful guess is displayed, and each incorrect guess adds one letter to the word 'Hangman'. If the player guesses wrong seven times it's game over. There are three levels of difficulty, and three word length options.
title: Hangman

description:
Racetrack is a 1–4 player horse race gambling game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each round, the players bet on one of eight horses. Each horse has different odds for each race. Players start with $500, and can choose their bet each round. The race is animated with all eight horses running across the screen.
title: Racetrack

description:
Robot War! is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It is the year 2020, and the player is in control of the warship Photon from the planet Romulus III. Robots from the planet Nebulas have attacked the player's home planet and captured their mothership.

The player enters the maze-like planet Nebulas, and on each screen must quickly shoot and destroy all stationary robot enemies. The player can move and fire in a total of eight directions. The player must destroy all enemies and quickly reach the escape door before a large fast-moving enemy appears and chases down the player. There are three levels of difficulty. The player has a total of five lives to complete 10 levels to reach their mothership.
title: Robot War!

description:
Slot Machine is a 1-player slot machine game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with $100, and it's $1 per spin on a three-reel slot machine. The player can win with cherries or three-of-a-kind.
title: Slot Machine

description:
Basketball is a 2-player arcade sports game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

A basketball player is placed randomly on the screen with a basket on the far edge. The player selects the angle and velocity to throw the ball into the basket. The first person to score 10 baskets is the winner.
title: Basketball

description:
Bombardment is a 2-player artillery duel game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player's artillery is positioned on opposite sides of a large mountain. Wind affects artillery fire. Players take turns inputting firing angle and power to try to destroy their opponent.
title: Bombardment

description:
Blackjack is a 2-player card game versus the computer dealer.

The player starts with $500, and bets $10 to $90 each game. The player competes against the computer dealer, and wins if their cards are closer to 21 than the dealer without going over, or manages to draw five cards without hitting 21. The first player to hit $1000 wins, and they lose if they hit $0. All controls are via joystick.
title: Blackjack

description:
Frenzy is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Each player controls a small character with a progressively elongating tail that can move in the cardinal directions. Players gain points by collecting bonus items that appear on the screen, and lose 5 points and reset the round by hitting walls or the tail of either player. Each player starts with 0 points, and the players set an individualized victory and defeat score.
title: Frenzy

description:
Quest for Lenore is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Once upon a time there lived a blonde beauty whose name was Lenore. She had a fiance named Hero. One day when pretty Lenore was out walking, a ferocious ape-like creature saw her and carried her away. The hero follows Lenore to a city filled with mazes.

The player moves between rooms to find Lenore, and can encounter red and blue dragons. These can be defeated by having either the red or blue sword to defeat them. The special fiend Doomwinged Bloodthirst cannot be defeated.
title: Quest for Lenore

description:
Quick Think is a 2-player board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players take turns dropping colored pieces on a 7 x 9 board represented by seven pegs at the bottom of the screen. The goal is to place four pieces in a row, and pieces always fall to the lowest available position. There is an option for timed moves.
title: Quick Think

description:
Advanced Pong is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls three paddles that move simultaneously horizontally on the screen. A small paddle covers the top and bottom of the screen, while a large paddle with a single space covers the center of the screen. Multiple robots are positioned across the center of the screen, and the player scores a point whenever a robot is hit. The game progressively speeds up as more points are scored. The player's score is calculated over five rounds.
title: Advanced Pong

description:
Convoy is a 1-player board game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Based upon the board game Battleship, the player and computer place 1 aircraft carrier, 2 battleships, 3 cruisers, 2 submarines, and 4 patrol boats on a 20 x 10 grid. The locations of the opponent's ships are kept hidden, and the players takes turns firing shots by typing coordinates. The computer informs the player whether each shot is a hit or a miss. The first player to sink their opponent's fleet is the winner.
title: Convoy

description:
Space Station is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a crosshair, and tries to shoot incoming alien spaceships that approach the space station at the center of the screen. Gameplay progressively speeds up as aliens are shot down. The station's strength starts at 100 percent, and each alien ship that reaches the space station causes damage. It's game over at zero percent.
title: Space Station

description:
Bag-It is a 1–6 player memory game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

Players take turns typing the name of an object and placing it in a bag. The player must remember the name of the object and type it correctly. Each turn, one more item is placed, and the player must retype all of the items.

sample_screenshots.caption: Placing an Item in the Bag

title: Bag-It

description:
Bowling is a 1–4 player 10-pin bowling game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player lines up their bowler on the alley using the joystick and throws the ball. Spin can be applied to the ball at any point, but cannot be stopped once the ball stops spinning. As the ball passes the pins, a zoomed in view of the ball's motion is displayed. Each game has 10 frames, and the player has two balls per frame.
title: Bowling

description:
Conveyor Belt is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player tries to move across a screen of 15 horizontally-moving conveyor belts, with each one running in the opposite direction. Numerous black boxes travel across the belts. The player's goal is to move across the screen without hitting a box, gaining 1 point for each successful trip. If the player travels off one side of the screen, they appear on the opposite side. It's game over when a box is hit.
title: Conveyor Belt

description:
Destroy is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a ship that moves horizontally at the top of the screen. The goal is to drop bombs at passing subs while avoiding incoming mines. The player can drop up to 5 bombs at a time, and the number of bombs available in reserve slowly replenishes. The player scores points for every sub destroyed as the enemy sails horizontally across the screen, and the player loses half their points if hit.
title: Destroy

description:
Loony Lander is a 2-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

One player controls a landing craft while the other controls a saucer. The lander's goal is to maneuver through the gaps in the clouds and mountains to land on the flat surface. The saucer's goal is to ram the lander to destroy it, or force it into the mountains or clouds. The saucer is not destroyed by mountains or clouds, but both saucer and lander are destroyed if they touch the edge of the screen. The surviving player is awarded 1 point each round, with the first player to 10 points the winner.
title: Loony Lander

description:
Stock Market is a 1-player market simulation for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player starts with $5,000 cash on hand and 10 each of the four available stocks. The player can buy or sell as many stocks as they wish per turn. Each of the four stocks randomly increases or decreases each turn. The game ends if the player runs out of money.

sample_screenshots.caption: End of Turn Change in Finances

title: Stock Market

description:
Starblazer is a 1-player strategy game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

When the crew of the USS Wasp left the peaceful Spectrum Galaxy, the player was commanding officer of the most modern star vessel known to science. But, after being trapped in a negative dimensional time warp for an eon or two, the predatory Xyclons have overrun the player's home galaxy, and the Wasp is the only vessel left to attack these predatory invaders. The player's goal is to destroy all Xyclon patrol vessels and mother ships before the USS Wasp is destroyed.

The main screen is divided into a central viewport and four minor viewports in the north, south, east, and west directions. The entire galaxy is divided into 16 sectors, which the player can warp between. One of these sectors contains an old Starbase, where the player can resupply. This location is hidden and randomized each game.

The ship's current arsenal, power, and system status is located at the right of the screen. The ship is armed with a number of weapon systems, including nuke torpedoes, QRay, and mines. Combat and landing occur from an arcade perspective.
title: Starblazer

description:
Rowboat is a 1-player arcade game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small rowboat, with each joystick controlling a single oar. The goal is to dock the rowboat without going over the waterfall. The fast-moving current in the river provides further challenge.
title: Rowboat

description:
Pennypede is a 1-player Centipede clone for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls a small character that moves around freely at the bottom third of the screen, and fires vertically. Rows of centipedes stroll across the top of the screen, and move down and reverse direction when they hit an obstacle. When the centipede is shot, it breaks into smaller sections.
