Large spiders roam across the bottom of the screen. Every centipede hit leaves an obstacle that blocks up to four player shots before being destroyed The player starts with three lives.
title: Pennypede

description:
Escape from Prison City is a 1-player adventure game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

It is the year 2189, and the player has decided to take their one man spacecraft for a spin, accidentally straying over the border into the dreaded Prison City. Hit by the automatic defenses of the city, the player crash lands on the surface, and finds that their battery for liftoff has been damaged beyond repair. The player must find a replacement battery in the maze that is the city and escape alive.

The player uses their arrow keys to move through a large maze. The player will encounter people, animals, and other dangers in their search. During encounters, the player can choose to befriend, fight, or hide from the encounter. The player can also collect weapons and shields to help in any combat that arises. The player can also encounter falls, where a rope or shield may help protect them.

There are 25 game variations, and five skill levels. Skill levels determine the number of hidden batteries.
title: Escape from Prison City

description:
Denna is a role-playing game for the TRS-80 CoCo.

After capturing the Castle of Denna, the player and companions were given to wine and song and celebration. So much celebration, in fact, that the overthrown king's stock of ale was depleted, and the player was forced to rummage through the castle for more. Upon discovering a staff with indecipherable writings etched on it, the player brings it back to their inebriated companions. As the companions drunkenly play with the wand, the player finds themself transported to the dark dungeon deep within the bowels of the castle. The player must now escape from the Dungeon of Denna.

At the beginning of each new game, the player rolls a character's strength, agility, physique, and alertness. Statistics determine the player's hit points, combat factor, defense factor, damage modifier, and number of attacks. The player can equip one item at a time, and has eight body parts with individual strength: head, neck, left arm, right arm, chest, abdomen, left leg, and right leg.

While navigating the dungeon, the player can only see the area immediately around them. The player encounters doors which can be trapped, and may be one-way. There are also secret doors that appear identical to walls. The player further encounters stairs that allow them to move up or down levels. Items can be found throughout the dungeon that can be picked up or dropped. Furniture can be encountered, which can be looked in, on, under, or behind for items. Weapons can be wielded or unequipped. Spells can also be picked up and read.

When in combat, the player is provided with monsters' hit points, number of attacks, combat, and defensive factors. Each monster has eight areas to attack with individual hit points and probability to hit. To kill a monster, total hit points or the hit points for a specific area must be reduced to zero. As the player defeats monsters, their experience and combat aptitude increases.
title: Denna

description:
Phalanx is a war game based upon the battles of Alexander the Great.

The player can fight battles at Granicus, Issus, or Arbela. Depending on the battle, the goal is to achieve victory within 15–35 turns. The player controls phalanxes, archers, and cavalry. The player may choose defense, offensive, normal, or ranged stance for units. There are six conditions for victory.
title: Phalanx

description:
D-Day: The 6th of June is a wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player controls Allied forces against their German opponent during the D-Day landings on June 6th, 1944. All Allied and German units are displayed graphically on a 2–3 screen scrolling map. Each unit gets limited movement points per turn, and each unit has individual strength points.

The player's goal is to invade the German held shoreline, knock out six pillboxes, and quickly capture a German city. From there the player builds a base to strike further into enemy land, destroying German cities and airfields, and establishing supply depots. The player moves individual units, but can also call in air supply and naval bombardments.
title: D-Day: The 6th of June

description: Anizio is a 1–2 player World War II strategy wargame featuring the Battle of Anzio during the Allied invasion of Italy in 1944.
title: Anzio

description:
River Crossing is a World War II squad-level strategy war game for the TRS-80 CoCo that provides additional scenarios and functions for Company Commander.

This add-on involves a host of new functions including a situation map, new terrain features, minefields, spotters, late arrivals, flamethrowers, renovated operation of direct fire, weapon malfunction, artillery, enemy armor operations, terrain modifiers, and more precise victory objectives.

The player takes on Russian, Japanese, and German opponents in 12 scenarios, including: Borisov, New Guinea, Guadalcanal, Pont l'Abbe, Kursk, Remagen, Sicily, and others.
title: River Crossing

description:
Luftflotte: The Battle of Britain is a strategic wargame for the TRS-80 CoCo.

The player takes the German side and tries to destroy Britain's will to fight from the air. The player attempts to destroy 24 British cities producing one of six war materials: petroleum, armaments, aircraft, shipping, morale, or electronics. The player must also contend with 26 British air bases, 18 low radar sites and 17 high radar sites, all creating an intricate web of defense.

In total, the player controls 3 Luftflottes, consisting of 2,000 individual planes. The player launches bomb runs, recon missions, strafing sorties, or transfers. A strategic map of Britain shows the location of targets and coordinates plane movement.
title: Luftflotte: The Battle of Britain

description:
Island Adventure is a text adventure with graphics for the TRS-80 CoCo.

While taking a spin in their airplane, the player is forced to crash-land on a remote Atlantic island. They are knocked unconscious and, though not injured in the crash, their plane has been demolished beyond repair. Upon awakening the radio is missing, and the player must find it to signal for help as soon as possible. The player must contend with constant starvation and thirst, and will need to make sure they keep themselves filled with food and drink. The player encounters hostile natives, strange abandoned temples, and other dangers.

All commands are via VERB NOUN entry, and there is a save/restore feature available.
title: Island Adventure

description:
Space Adventures for the TRS-80 is a series of if type-in arcade games designed to teach programming on the TRS-80 CoCo.

  • Alien Attack: The player fires in eight directions from a space station in the center of the screen. The player can take three hits before their shields are depleted.
  • Invasion: The player moves a turret left and right to destroy the incoming enemy vessels.
  • Moon Shuttle: The player must navigate their shuttle through a deadly asteroid field.
  • Protector: The player must defend against incoming alien vessels for up to two minutes.
  • Red Alert: The player must pilot their spacecraft through a number of caverns.
  • Space Duel: Two players face off from opposite sides of the screen. Players move vertically and fire horizontally towards their opponent.
title: Space Adventures for the TRS-80
